She is only hard b/c she weeds the lazy students out and focuses only on those who are serious.  I made a C but learned more from this C than 100% of the classes i made an A in.

Excellent teacher.  You will learn something from this class.  You will do homework and she goes over it in class calling on students for the answers.  She has a great personality and make you feel as if she is on your level.
She is a really good professor. You will learn in her classes. Is somewhat hard, but no harder than anyone else teaching this class. She is real helpful and knows her stuff...
I thought it was easy, I am an accounting major though so i was actualy interested in the material, probably wouldn't recomend her for non buisiness majors, but great for any buisiness major.

If you are a slacker and just want your degree so you can go on to be a drain on some poor firm, DON'T take this prof., you will learn accounting. I hated acct and dreaded the class. Madden made class fun and educational. I knew I would pass this class but didn't think I would ever like acct.  Due to her style, I no longer hate acct.

name_title: Cecilia Michelon-Knowles Professor in the English department at Youngstown St ate University

ratings.comment: Was my first professor on my first day.  Graduating soon and wish I could thank her
Was one of my favorites in my four year.
openminded    likes to teach
Very nice and Extreamly helpful! Awesome teacher wish she taught more classes!
Shes very nice.

name_title: Roland Buck Professor in the Business department at Morehead St ate University

ratings.comment: Roland Buck was one of the best professors I ever had. If you show up for class, pay close attention, and work the problems from his old exams, you can learn a quite lot. It's been decades since I took his courses. Since that time, I've become a multimillionaire working as a private investment advisor and active trader. Thanks Dr. Buck.

I found that as long as you show you study an adequate amount, his class was fairly easy. Economics is not my favorite thing, but it wasn't horrible in his class. Participation during class was also really important.

I don't know why all the students don't like him. His test isn't too bad as long as you study the old exam he gave to you. If you don't understand the old exam, go to his office ask him, he will help you. I think it is a class easy to pass. A lot of my classmate got an A.

I don't understand why all the students don't have good comments for him. His text is easy as long as you study his old exam he gave to you and go to ask him. He has a big curve for the exam. a lot of my classmate got an A.

Take him if you need the class. But come prepared with an energy drink and a coloring book because that is the only way you will last. Check out the books website for help when studying for the test, and go through the practice test on his sight.

name_title: Tom Creahan Professor in the Business department at Morehead St ate University

ratings.comment: Dr. Creahan is so nice. All you have to do is come to class and put in some extra effort to study before tests, etc. I think he is a professor that sees when a student really tries in his class and is willing to help them if they are willing to put forth effort too.
This was so boring. I always dreaded it, and I would almost fall asleep. He lectures the whole time, but it's sooo boring. I learned most things from the textbook.
I only had this class for a few weeks but in those few weeks i realized this class was god awful. Class was boring and not much interaction.
Boring, acts like his class is the only one you have. Gives very vague lectures but asks very specific questions and laughs when you're wrong.

Tom Creahan is the worst professor at MSU. He is soft talker and you literally cannot hear his lectures. I read the chapters before the test and still scored awful. You must take a quiz repeatedly to get a decent/ at least 50% on the test. He gave me the worst grade of my life. Do not take him

name_title: Jerome Dusek Professor in the Psychology department at Syracuse University

ratings.comment: Kind of an annoying man, but the class wasn't bad. Tests were a tad challenging but if you read and study lectures you will be fine. Pop quizzes are opportunity for extra credit. Nothing extraordinary but I would recommend.
Jerome was boring, but easy.

Everyone who commented is someone who does not want to do the work. This is a real college class as in you can't be on your phone or be late, the teacher takes no bs. One of the best classes I've taken at SU, learned a lot. Tests not hard if you actually go to class.

Reading what people wrote about this professor scared me but experienced something entirely different. He is strict. Don't come in late, don't play on your phone or computer. Kinda basic rules in any classroom. He explains things well and welcomes questions and clarifications. Tests are tricky but if you read, go to class, and study you'll be fine.

This is by far the worst professor I have ever had at this University. Horrible. Horrible. Horrible. His tests are all trick questions and he is a complete know it all when you want to get help from him. NEVER TAKE ANY OF HIS CLASSES!!

name_title: Daniel Green Professor in the Political Science department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: I enjoyed Green as a professor even if others did not. He gave really interesting lectures and was kinda funny. Made study guides for each exam and had us vote on which questions to drop. The big issue was the grading on exams. I knew all of the material on exams and still never got a great score because the TAs graded way too harshly

Professor Green was okay. He gives very minimal feedback on written exams and expects you to come to him or his TAs with questions on grades (even though you can't tell what you got wrong). It is hard to know what is or is not important in lecture. He is passionate about the topic and does really well in applying concepts to current events.

Class is 3 exams and attendance from discussions. THE STUDY GUIDE IS THE EXAM. IF YOU DO STUDY GUIDE AND WRITE OUT ANSWERS AND ACTUALLY STUDY AND GO TO DISCUSSION THIS CLASS IS A FREE A. HE GIVES YOU ALL THE TOOLS TO SUCCEED. 

He also does these review sessions before exams and they are incredibly helpful to understand what he is looking for.

I was honestly scared to take POSC240 based on everyone's reviews but Prof Green and the class itself really aren't that bad. You will be told to get a textbook but you don't need it. If you actually come to class, take notes, and study for the exam you will pass. It's graded by only 3 exams but his office hours before the exam are also helpful.
I liked the class format and felt like I learned a lot. The grade relied a lot on exams which was difficult to get a good grade in.

name_title: Craig Boyd Professor in the Philosophy department at Greenville University

ratings.comment: Craig Boyd is probably the most entertaining professor I've ever had.  He is certainly one of the brightest!  He has excellent powers of rhetoric.
Simply the best prof at GC- too bad he left for greener pastures.
Changed my life.
No Comments
this class was really challenging but in a good, intellectual way. Boyd always made us step out of our mental boxes and challenge ideas to help us know what we believe

name_title: Rick Mc Peak Professor in the Theology department at Greenville University

ratings.comment: He is an all around great guy, loved taking COR 102 with him - the trip was awesome! Only complaint is that he is a little sketchy when it comes to letting you know what is due when. Grades papers pretty rigorously.

If you don't like Rick, we don't like you!  He is one of the most respected professors among the students.  I graduated in 2007, and I can still recall so many things he said.  I asked him to give me books to read after I graduated, and he brought me into his office, and gave me a few off his own shelf.  It's not about the grade! He changed my life
Would read 60+ pages a night and then have a one question quiz the next day. Boring lectures and gets way off topic to often. Very disorganized.

One of the most transformative classroom experiences I've had in 4 colleges I've attended. Community building, deep introspection, and a real question of success/failure based on a willingness to self-sacrifice for others. Who can teach this stuff? Dr. McPeak. You must commit 100% to the process...it will change your life. And isn't that the point?

He is not available to be talked to if we need him, he assigns homework and books to read but we never go over them in class, very frustrating! He makes no since during class he is very scatter brained and does not stay on one topic for long, he is easily distracted.

name_title: Andrew Karplus Professor in the Biochemistry department at Oregon St ate University

ratings.comment: Dr. Karplus curves the class generously only because of horrendous exam scores. You have to rely on several hours of pre-lecture videos and memorize the most obscure, abstract details. Exams require you to write down word-for-word definitions for even the slightest bit of credit. Be prepared to read a lot, and utilize the office hours.

Dr. Karplus is a very nice person, but his lectures and slides are not well organized and he expects you to memorize every detail. Points only come from tests and quizzes that grade you on things you have memorized, no note card or calculator allowed. I told Dr. Karplus I caught a graduate student cheating and he did nothing to address it.

Rude when students asked for help on material in office hours and will get in ur face if you look down @ ur notes. Grades only on test and quizzes with no EC. If you don't put down exactly what he wants on the exam, you get no credit. Expects you to read his mind. Makes u watch hours of pre-lecture content. Study guide does not reflect exam content

Only grades on quizzes and exams. Extremely tough grader, and unhelpful in office hours. Appears nice at first, do not be fooled. If I had to choose between a degree in biochemistry taught by this professor or having my limbs removed one by one while being forced to watch Illumination's 'The Lorax' on repeat, I would choose the latter.

Andy really cares about his students learning. That being said, I do think he expects students to pour an unreasonable amount if time into the class. If you want to do well youll need to spend a significant amount of time fully understanding concepts as well as memorizing seemingly minute details.

name_title: A.S.Cavaretta Professor in the M athem atics department at Kent St ate University

ratings.comment: Worst "teacher" I have ever had. He is very critical of how you do a problem even if you get the same answer as him. His tests are hard and he expects you to know how to do the problems even if he hasn't taught the material yet. His notes are hard to follow and they are useless. You are better off being taught by a tutor in the library. AVOID.

Wow, this might be the worst professor I've ever had. His lectures are INCREDIBLY difficult to follow, and his explanations could not possibly be more unclear. I have no idea how he grades, either; I've never seen a pattern. I would never wish this class on even my worst enemy.
Terrible, terrible teacher. Put me down in class for attending tutoring, made me feel worthless. If you are a calc genius, you might be okay. If not, take someone else.

First time posting on this site just to tell people to NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER. I have over 130 college credit hours and this was the worst teacher I ever had. I'll admit it doesn't help that the course was Calc II, but his problem is that he's been teaching it so long he forgot to know what it's like to be the student.

Absolutely horrible!!! His class was a joke. I was at tutoring more than I was in his class, and I only missed a few classes. By the end I stopped caring, and I got the same exact grades I did from the very beggining when I studied like crazy. I still managed to get a C but I changed my major because of him. He made me HATE math :(

name_title: Lowell Zurbuch Professor in the Engineering department at Kent St ate University

ratings.comment: I dislike this guy. He is so boring. Dont take him if you dont have to
Doesn't return papers, grades are not given untill the end. Your grade is dependent on his sole opinion of you.
Kind of standoffish but very funny and knowlegable.
Can be very helpful..
a full-on nerd with lots of information and an easy format for all classes

name_title: Gary Hubbell Professor in the English department at Kent St ate University

ratings.comment: I couldn't believe it was an honors class, it was that easy. Even though he says he grades the daily comments and attendance, he doesn't. As long as you speak during class, you'll get on his good side.
Writing 1- He's very chill and laid back, although his voice is soft and put me to sleep. He gives few essays and a lot of in class work. I'd recomend taking his class
Intro to Shakespeare was a great class with him. He was extremely helpful and knows pretty much everything about the plays. Great guy. Take him.

Intro to Shakespeare was a great class. Hubbell isn't extremely dynamic, but is very nice and helpful. Makes insightful commentary and encourages class participation. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it's best to be present for his lectures. If you have to skip, you can easily - all you do is read one Act for each class, so you know what you missed.
College Writing I - This professor is easing going. As long as you are specific, you can ask any question and get and answer. Give you a lot of time to write your papers in class.

name_title: Howard Hesby Professor in the Agriculture department at Texas A&M University at College St ation

ratings.comment: He was a great asset to A&M in so many ways and he will be greatly missed by alumni and faculty alike.
I loved him and his class. He is an awesome professor.
really easy, busy work. nice, funny guy. RIP Dr. Hesby
super easy... busy work. just gotta go to class. really nice and funny. RIP
super easy. lots of busy work. nice guy and really funny. RIP

name_title: Jason Kirksey Professor in the Political Science department at Oklahoma St ate University

ratings.comment: Dr. Kirksy was one of the hardest teachers I have ever had. However I won't regret taking his class ever. Do everything he tells you and you will pass. He is an amazing person and will help you if you put the effort in and try.

He is the professor from your nightmares! He is purposefully intimidating and makes you feel terrible about yourself. Read everything and NEVER miss class . . . even if you are bleeding from your head!

Took this class while in high school. Made B's on all the tests without studying. Also had ample opportunities for extra credit, which pushed me up to a solid A. Very engaging. Strongly urge that you take the class, but don't say "i don't know" or he'll throw erasers at you. He still remembers my name to this day.

This is a wonderful teacher! If you pay attention, read, and do the assignments - this is not a bad class. I learned a lot, ignore the negative comments. You'll learn so much by the end of the semester, it'll tie into everything else you do in law or politics.  Oh, and he's hilarious. Most people in our class loved him for the jokes.

By far the best professor ive had as a political science major - gives ample extra credit, thorough study guides and has quite interesting lectures. bottom line is: go to class and you will pass his class and learn a lot more than whats required.

name_title: Christopher Druzgalski Professor in the Electrical Engineering department at California St ate University Long Beach

ratings.comment: He is a cool person, but as a professor, he is unorganized and can be hard to follow along, but he is trying to help you learn and will answer any question. Tests were okay but class average was pretty low. He curves and is generous with grading. If you want to pass, do extra credit and study concepts on your own time (he expects this).
good luck

DO THE EXTRA CREDIT! Extra circuit presentations and powerpoints about EE topics are encouraged. I got an A on the first midterm, worse on the second, and the final. Labs weren't too bad and no homework was due. I thought for sure I would've ended with a B, but it's probably because I didn't take advantage of the extra credit. Good luck.

Although in the beginning it was tough, you'll learn to like Druzgalski, he will do any example if you ask to clarify. Tests are very difficult, conceptual circuit designing questions. Participate and build extra circuits, I failed both midterms, passed the final with a B but I participated in class and built 5 circuits and ended with an A.

Avoid this professor if you can, especially if you haven't been exposed to this type of material. His "notes" are a bunch of illegible scribbles on the board and he is kinda hard to understand. Be prepared to do a lot of self-studying as he tends to jump around into material that hasn't been discussed. Presentations and extra credit is a must!

name_title: Roberta Allen Professor in the Business department at Western Michigan University

ratings.comment: Beautiful person, inside and out.  Happy, pleasant, caring.  A veritable educator, not a trainer.  If you are looking for skills training, go elsewhere.  You get back several fold what you put into the course.

Roberta is very pleasant and personable. There is a single-spaced 4 page paper that you have to do in this course & I was very stressed out about this paper that I was not able to turn it in on time. Since I was a hardworking student in class, Roberta was very understanding and gave me a one week extension to complete the paper and turn it in.
Has she ever worked in the business world outside of WMU? Not! It's all bookwork and theory for her! Get real, please!
A very helpful professor, knows the Business field well, can make a boring class a little more interesting

Course material was easy and we often worked in groups.  Let out early a lot.  Very helpful with assignments, such as resume.  A student passed away over thanksgiving in our class and she was very sensitive and handled the situation well.  Very nice, approachable.  1 page paper was our final.

name_title: Helen Bowers Professor in the Business department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Helen had a tough semester. Unfortunately I felt I didn't learn much in the class. Bright woman, but not the best teacher. If you put the work in, it shouldn't be hard to get an A. Tests are multiple choice and she may offer extra credit. She is very willing to work with students and accommodate them, but I often found I was teaching myself.
Professor Bowers had a very tough semester while teaching my class, but I would still not recommend. Lectures are long and boring not too much hw or tests though. Easy B hard to get an A.

Bowers is completely unprepared for every class and spends half of it fiddling with her technology or erasing her mistakes. Going to class isn't mandatory because it's a waste of time and you end up being more confused. Take anyone else but her... she doesn't even know how to teach all of the required sections. Very nice lady, but bad teacher.
Professor Bowers does nothing to keep the class engaged. Extremely boring 1 hour and 15 minutes. I have learned nothing in this class, and am a Finance major. Avoid Bowers at all costs.
very boring but easy test easy class

name_title: John Antil Professor in the Business department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: This guy is a nut case. He's funny and class seems light but he literally does not teach. Him and the class is so unorganized it's actually frustrating. It would be fine to be like that if the tests weren't impossible. He makes them himself the night before and the questions make absolutely no sense. Do not take this class with him it's horrible

This man is ridiculous. Not clear on the syllabus, and doesn't have clear due dates. Made us pay $40 for a computer "game" that is utterly useless and difficult to understand. He rambles on most of the classes on tangents that have nothing to do with the material. Vulgar and thinks it's hilarious. Would not recommend if you want to learn anything.

Very unusual guy but probably one of my favorite professors. If you are attending his class as a business student interested in marketing/comm, you will get a ton out of his lectures.  He does ramble, but the stories always help get better context of real world application of the principles.  Feel free to interject & challenge him, he loves it.
Best teacher I have ever taken at UD, I loved him. You have to work for a an A but he makes class interesting. TAKE HIM

I was really interested in this class. If you enjoy marketing you'll enjoy Antil. He's a little offbeat but that makes the class fun. He's also a little vulgar at times which I think is awesome. He gives out packets with a lot of redundancy but studying the day before the test has gotten me a good grade

name_title: Steven Hunt Professor in the Business department at Morehead St ate University

ratings.comment: Dr. Hunt is an AMAZING professor. For this particular course, he crafted his own units with useful readings/videos that related to the newer and up-to-date healthcare management systems. He provided feedback on all assignments and provides his personal phone number which you can contact if you have ANY question. I will take every course he offers!
Easy class, Very nice teacher.

This teacher doesn't know where he is even at half of the time.  Class is awful, he lectures over things that you already know.  He barely knows how to do the projects himself.  I do NOT recommend this teacher.
Good professor.
great teacher and very helpful, cares about the students... boring class though.

name_title: Paul Sicilian Professor in the Economics department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Paul is a great guy. Very kind and funny. However, the class is very tough. The class uses R studio the whole time - and he expects you to already be a master at it. Spent many hours a week to get a C on homework assignments. Quizzes were difficult - but the final paper is not too bad. Unfortunate that this is the capstone for Business Econ majors.

Rambles about stories that are not clearly related while using heavy niche vocabulary (jargon). I went to the office hours of a dif. Econ prof to learn the material and be successful in this class. The exams have multiple choice and short answers and don't come back quickly. The professor is disorganized in his lectures. Be ready to teach yourself.

Prof Sicilian is terrible! The lectures are not helpful whatsoever and have no relevance to the work he assigns. He also does not include point values in the syllabus and you are left wondering if you will even pass if you are struggling. Quizzes are hard and worded horribly. R studio is not taught well by him. I had to learn using other resources.
Professor can go on tangents and grade harshly, but the content is interesting. Unstuck Study AI was a lifesaver for comprehending the material and preparing for exams.
Was a bit sporadic, but a generous grader. Will have to learn some things on your own.

name_title: Jacob "Jerry"Cohen Professor in the American Studies department at Brandeis University

ratings.comment: Amazing professor. Class is fairly easy but the material is so interesting it wouldn't matter if it was difficult. He can ramble at times but if you stick with him he has some very intelligent and thought provoking things to say.

His class isn't as easy as you'd think, only because he's a tough grader and looks for specific things. He will give you an outline ahead of time so barely any reading is necessary-plan it around the topic you choose. He rambles and is unclear, lectures almost useless. In-Class essay based class with a 12 page midterm to do on your own.

Professor Cohen is great! He genuinely cares about his students doing well and makes himself available to help whenever you need it. He's also really funny and has many great stories about historical events he was around for. Sometimes he can be a little repetitive and long winded but it's a great class.

VERY knowledgeable about subject matter. Tends to ramble and go on tangents, but if you can actually follow the lecture he has a lot to say. Light workload, interesting class, Cohen is a lot of fun to shmooze with.

The saying goes for a cohen class, its pretty easy to get an A and nearly impossible to not get a B.  That being said in order to get an A you should go to class, interact with cohen, meet with him.  He is a very interesting guy with knowledge on almost anything.  If you take his classes seriously it will pay off!

name_title: Doug Green Professor in the Science department at Ohio University

ratings.comment: I took him for a standard Geology course a year or so ago and he rounds up by about two letter grades. I had a D and received a B. Class is curved, the class was introduction to Geology. Interesting guy, is knowledgeable on the content. Do the homework and wing the tests you will be fine.

I love Dr. Green. He's a super nice guy and has a real no bullcrap attitude. You really need  to come to class so you can get all the info from his lectures and you  definitely NEED to read the book if you want to do well. He's always willing to help and you should definitely take his class.

It's kind of a boring class unless you're really into geology but its quite passable. Green really knows his stuff and will help you understand it too (he wants everyone to do well). The grade consisted of three midterms, 1 final and the lab component plus a decent curve because the exams were challenging (no homework or attendance!)

You have to work for your grade. Homeworks were relatively easy, but you had to spend time with the material. Your textbook will become your best friend. READ IT. Lectures were long and boring, but he is very knowledgeable. Willing to help students during his office hours and weekly review sessions.

For an intro class it is really hard. The lecture is really boring&hard to pay attention. Dr. Green uses the book's power point so it's a reiteration of the book. Write down what he says in lecture not the slides. If you're not going to try, don't take this class. It is hard. The avg. on the majority of our tests were 50% but he curves (Thank God)

name_title: Araya Debessay Professor in the Accounting department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Demanding but caring.  Lots of group work, homework and weekly quizzes, but he wanted us to succeed.

I don't think that Debessay is the worst person ever. He truly cares about wanting students to learn, but sometimes it comes off wrong. He can be condescending, suffocating, and a little snarky and off-putting, but he's a really sweet man, just not the best professor. Do the homework, do the test banks, participate, and you'll be fine.

Professor Debessay is a very nice man. His lectures are very boring but he takes attendance. The class material is so easy you can learn it on your own from the online homeworks and quizzes. Exam questions are straight from the test bank he gives you, study those and you should get an A.
Worst professor I have ever had. That is all I have to say. You are better off taking this class at community college than suffering through ACCT200 with Dr. Debessay.

Debessay is the most personal professor I ever had. He takes time out of his summer to ask his students how he can best teach them. He's called my phone for help, emailed me checking in, and even invited me to his house for dinner. The class? All I'll say *wink* is DO THE TEST BANK *wink wink wink wink* and CHECK YOUR WORK on online quizzes *wink*.

name_title: Gary Sarver Professor in the Psychology department at Ohio University

ratings.comment: This has been the best professor that I have had so far during my college career. How you do in his class is solely dependent on how you perform. Interact with him during his weekly Q&A, use the information given during the Q&A in your discussion post, and you will do fine. I finished this class with a 99%. Taking more of his classes next semester.

Does have high expectations, but is incredibly fair. Answers all questions promptly and effectively. Course material sticks like glue and you won't even realize it is happening. Book is a great choice and great read, but the lectures are the cherry on top. Great professor and great person. Wish every professor was a little bit like Sarver.

Lectures and notes often are only his opinion and leave very little room for outside thoughts. Lectures are often very unorganized as he jumps from topic to topic and back again. Discussion and exams are graded inconsistently, if you add any type of personal opinion or experience to discussion board will be docked points.
Is a very hard grader, not understanding at all. I wouldn't recommend taking his class- though it's made up of discussions and exam his grading is beyond ridiculous even if you spend hours of work.

Professor Sarver knows his stuff and makes the material engaging. Attend the Q&A sessions, watch the lectures, and use resources like unstuckstudy to nail the midterm and final. It's not an easy A, but the effort pays off with a solid grasp of the content.

name_title: Arthur Young Professor in the Science department at San Diego St ate University

ratings.comment: I took his class in the mid 1970's when Professor was a new teacher. I thought he was the smartest and best teacher I ever had. I was a Civil Engineering Major and was impressed with his knowledge on every thing. His lectures were so interesting and on the leading edge.

Do not take his class if you have no desire to work and understand the subject. I you are interested in astronomy he is one of the best professors you will ever have teach you.  You must study for the test in order to do well.  He knows his subject which is what you want from a professor.!
Very intelligent and funny, but not very friendly. His tests were random and harder than I expected. There are much easier courses to pick for your Science GE than Young's class.

All he does is lecture...he's kinda funny and really intellegent. But his tests are way hard and they are hard to study for. I fell asleep in the class at least 10 time last semester. You will learn something but its hard to get an A.

Worse Teacher ever... He lectured the whole class, made you buy his books which you dont even need for the class and non of the stuff he talked about was on the tests... I thought this class would be an easy GE, Hardest class ever.

name_title: Ralph Ferretti Professor in the Educ ation department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: A nice man, offers extra credit, three exams easy to study for, 3 papers but an easy grader.

Dr. Ferretti was one of the most understanding and caring professors I have ever had. Enjoyed going to his class and he showed great videos! Class isn't mandatory, but tests are straight from the lectures with a few questions from the book. Course is 3 exams, 2 papers, and extra credit opportunities. Exams are easy if you study! 10/10 recommend!

Dr. Ferretti is awesome! Attendance isn't mandatory but if you don't show up, you won't get the notes. There are 3 exams, all straight-forward and only needed minimal studying. There are 2 papers which are also easy and straight-forward. There's an opportunity for 10 points of EC which is awesome even though the class is already easy! Recommend!

Really an incredible teacher! Go to class everyday, take notes, & study just a couple days before the exams and you'll do great! The tests kind of can be tricky but it's all covered in his lectures so there should be no surprises. He gives a lot of extra credit & he's so sweet & passionate about teaching

Amazing teacher! This is one of my favorite education classes I've taken so far. He really cares about everyone doing well and he is extremely knowledgable. 3 Exams, 2 papers and 2 field placements. Tests are straightforward and easy if you study and take notes from his lectures. Papers were easy to write and field placements were very interesting.

name_title: Idris Traylor Professor in the History department at Texas Tech University

ratings.comment: I had Dr Traylor for several Russian and Soviet History classes in the mid-80s. He was an outstanding scholar, lecturer and advisor.

I graduated in 97 from Tech, and Traylor and Brink were my FAVORITE professors. You can tell that Traylor loves this subject and wants you to love it too. He really challenged me to write about things that weren't just "interesting and obvious" to me, but would have me learn a wealth of new info on things I didn't know. Absolutely brilliant...
Had Professor Traylor for a course on Imperial Russia.  Professor Traylor is brilliant, loves the subject matter, and makes the class want to learn.  Amazing professor and a truly nice man.

The very best professor I have ever had.  Made a lasting impression on my life.  I had him over 20 years ago, and I still remember his lectures and use the notes that I took in that class (I'm now a professor, myself.)
Undoubtedly, the best history professor on campus!

name_title: Roberta Golinkoff Professor in the Educ ation department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Very rude to students and unclear in expectations/directions. LOTS of reading and group work for every class. Lectures are confusing and slides are never posted after class. Test questions are very specific. Minimal assignments, nitpicky with grades, and only gives feedback to one person for group work. Calls on students at random. Avoid if you can

This professor is the worst i've ever had. I wouldn't recommend unless you LOVE pop quizzes and disrespect. She is rude to her students and will call on you at random. Did I mention our only grades are these pop quizzes? I truthfully believe she uses this class to promote her lab and her books she's helped make.

Just don't do it. Professor Golinkoff is insanely rude to her students and then laughs it off. Class is essentially pointless as it is basically another chance for her to test her students like she does in her lab, hardly any notes are taken. Exams are on minimal content for the amount of reading that's required. Save yourself the trouble.

She needs to stay in her lab and stop teaching. She randomly calls on people every class then interrupts you and blames it on being from Brooklyn, like no you're just rude. You will spend hours reading the textbook and supplementals, and her test questions are extremely nitpicky. Her class is useless and class time could be used more effectively.

Golinkoff cares a lot about her students, but the amount of reading and group work required is kinda ridiculous. She has a strong personality that van come off as rude, but I did enjoy her teaching style. Must be prepared for each class and she has random pop quizzes on all the readings every week

name_title: Regina Frey Professor in the Chemistry department at Washington University in St. Louis

ratings.comment: She managed to explain difficult chemistry concepts in a clear manner and seemed to really care about her students. I credit her help sessions to getting an A in chem 112 because Sobotka's teaching was so bad.

Frey is the worst of the Chem professors. She just plowed through the material, and she seemed to no care if we learned anything. Daschbach was much better. Frey was also useless at help session unless you asked a question about a specific hw problem, and even then she would just read the key, which we already have. Really frustrating semester.

Professor Frey had supported my friend and me through very tough times. She was very caring and I very much enjoyed her class. I am very happy to have taken my first chemistry class with Professor Frey. In a sense, she helped me grow a healthy mindset towards college. I couldn't thank her enough.

Frey is very awkward. She reads from her notes in a cold tone. It is not clear she understands everything she is saying. She does not answer questions well. Then she insists we work together on simple clicker questions. I strongly recommend you take someone else for Gen Chem. Overall the course is good, but she is not.

An incredibly sweet professor who genuinely cares about students' academics and their personal wellbeing. Her explanations are SO helpful and she breaks down the material so that you understand it very intuitively. Gives out candy during help sessions!

name_title: Georgia Pyrros Professor in the M athem atics department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Her online lectures are very easy to follow. Get the red book. I liked her, but she has a strong accent so if you have an issue with that, then take another professor.
She is a very sweet lady, and really loves what she does. However, be prepared to really have to work for your grade in this class, especially if you're not very keen with math to begin with.

Took this class and wound up withdrawing and taking a W. Horrible teacher, class consisted of her doing the practice problems and going way too fast. TA was horrible and also confusing. I thought I was good at math and had already taken calc in highschool but this was absolutely horrible.

Pyrros is nice but she is probably the worst teacher I've ever had. Honestly. I went to a private high school and got an A+ in honors math all 4 years, and had an F in this class despite going to the tutoring sessions, doing all homework, and studying for hours. Don't take math at UD if you can help it- take it somewhere else over winter session.

Pyrros is ok. She makes you work for an A. Also, she will call you out in the classroom if she sees you talking or on your phone. However, from what I've heard, if you're going to take 221 she's your best bet. Go to her office hours, she really can be helpful and she really does care about her students if you show her that you care as well.

name_title: Susan Mc Kenna Professor in the Languages department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Very nice professor, but I would never take her again, only because of how much of a tough grader she is. Lots of homework. This class is mainly on memorizing poetry so if you REALLY love poetry, unlike me... then the class is for you. She makes me wanna drop my Spanish minor. Participation matters so do the HW. I hated showing up for this class.
She was very nice and helpful outside of class, but a tough grader and made me want to drop my Spanish minor.

If I could have taken any other course, I would have. The course material was interesting but I was picked by the teacher immediately as a bad student the first time I walked in the classroom. This was not something one could recover from as every assignment was met harshly and every sick leave was met with skepticism.

She is really great. 3 exams (one in class paper), outside essays that you revise for more points, one cumulative final. Read the assigned readings , do the homework, and participate in class. She is lovely.

Dr. McKenna, who I had for Span Lit, is great. She's so enthusiastic and engaging. Lots of real Spanish reading, which can be rly difficult, but she'll help you get through it. $ VhL textbook is necessary. Grades tough on participation + essays, so RAISE YOUR HAND 3x a class. Supersuper nice and wants you to do well. You'll learn a lot!

name_title: Sonja Lyubomirsky Professor in the Psychology department at University of California Riverside

ratings.comment: I found the class enjoyable and interesting.  Assignments were straightforward but the exams were a bit difficult mainly because they covered a lot of material (both lecture and readings). There were multiple readings per week, many of which were long so this class is not a small time investment. She does curve the final grade

Probably the least enjoyable psychology class I have ever taken here. Majority of lecture is spent with the professor talking about her own work or other material that won't even be on the exams. Rest of the time she is busy promoting her book. Way too much material and barely any guidance. If you want to pass, read the texts and go to your TAs.

The class content is actually super interesting & I learned a lot. HOWEVER, the exams are unnecessarily hard & are mostly based from the readings. She DOES curve tho which will probably save us. Also, she's kinda not humble and sort of conceited?? You'll see when u meet her.

The study guides are useless, and she's on vacation so much we barely had any in person lectures. Exams are 70% of your grade and she makes them unnecessarily difficult, they are heavilyyy based on the readings which are also a lot every week. The class average for all of the exams never went above a C, psyc110 was easier fr.

Learned a lot from this course, however, the exam was heavy on other material rather than the slides itself. As a professor, she should worry about attending her class rather than going to New York, going on vacation with her daughter, and attending events. Wants us to buy and read her own book (profiting from her students). Exams worded bad

name_title: Jeff Jordan Professor in the Philosophy department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Exams require a lot of studying! Only about 3-4 exams the whole year and 1 assignment and that is it for grades. Very stressful time when exams came around. He's a pretty nice guy, but a boring teacher and doesn't provide any enthusiasm in the lectures. Was painful going to class every day.

Professor Jordan is a great lecturer who makes the material engaging. Attend classes, take notes, and use resources like the free textbook and unstuckstudy ai to prep for tests. The workload is manageable if you stay on top of it. Definitely a class worth taking.
Great guy. He's the reason I added a philosophy minor. Super clear when teaching. Awesome when answering questions in and outside of class.

Jordan was a great professor. I joined his class late to satisfy a breadth and ended up finding a love for philosophy. He is truly passionate about his job and will answer any question. Attendance isn't mandatory but some exam questions are directly from class. Exams are pretty easy and he offers extra credit.

Jeff Jordan is a tremendous guy. The lectures are typically pretty long, but he makes them engaging and wants discussion to occur. He really cares about his students. The material can be a lot, and it can be difficult, but he offers lots of study guides and has review sessions to help for the exams. Attendance is mandatory unfortunately.

name_title: Jeff Gillespie Professor in the Accounting department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Very approachable, friendly, clear lectures, clear expectations

Professor Gillespie is one of the best professors i've ever taken at UD! I personally think some of the material in this class can be challenging, but Gillespie was so helpful and really wants his students to succeed. He answers emails so quickly and makes himself available to really help you understand. He cares about every student that he teaches

Jeff is awesome! You can tell that he really wants the students to succeed. Jeff was extremely helpful and responded to emails quickly. He was also really accommodating when we switched to online classes. The material can be tough and you'll have to spend a lot of time studying outside of class but Jeff does everything he can to help you do well.

Professor Gillespie is the best. He always makes himself available, I've emailed him with questions late and he always immediately responds. In class we do problems, and those problems are the same thing as the quizzes. He gives you ample help on take home quizzes. DO the online homework, it is worth more than the quizzes, annoying but easy.

Jeff is the man. Our class got moved online due to COVID-19 and he's been on top of things. His lecture style focuses on doing problems, which I love. If you need help, just ask him and he is more than willing to help you outside of class.

name_title: Philip Flynn Professor in the English department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Flynn is a professor who changed, focused and directed my life. It was my first college class. He continually encouraged me. I was a broken Nam vet, a guy who was uncertain about returning to "the world", and especially to school. Now, at 64, looking back, I realize that he was one of the guys who taught me how to think critically. Thanks Doc.

his classes are pointless. had him for victorian poetry as well. doesn't teach at all. just reads from the book. essays are a joke since they either don't relate to the class learning objectives/material or he grades based off of what HE thinks needs to be on them. little room for student ideas and creativity. boring.

Great teacher.  He is a bit soft-spoken which can be an issue if you come to class super tired.  Attendance is mandatory, and he's a real stickler for grammar.  But overall, super nice guy, cares about his students, and really enjoys what he teaches.  Take him if you have the chance.

if you're a favorite of his and write what he wants to hear you'll do well. he offers a lot of office hours but it seems only certain people can get A's in the class...i wouldn't say he's an easy grader unless you stroke his ego.

Definitely recommend Flynn, he's a sweet old guy and very easy to talk to. I've gone to his office hours once or twice and he definitely wants you to do well in his class. I am taking him next semester too!

name_title: Hillar Neumann Professor in the Business department at Northern St ate University

ratings.comment: ECON 330-NT1. Detailed and constructive feedback is provided for understanding the material. This class is not an easy class, but definitely worth taking because there is so much to learn regarding banking and financial institutions. He is also available to ask questions and provide guidance. One of my favorite professors.

My favorite Professor! This was prof Neumanns first year at JMU and I transferred into his class last minute, so I was a little nervous at first, but it turned out to be my favorite class! Very interesting lectures and he is very helpful if you are confused. Easy tests if you study and weekly online quizzes that are an easy A.

There isn't a lot of material to use, I read the textbook and used the powerpoints and still had to find videos to help me with homework. You do have to work, but he is always helpful when you ask questions. Only complaint is frequency of homework, it could be due same day as exams, but if he knows you work hard he isn't bad about late work.

I took Econ 201 online - he didn't really give any powerpoints or tools to learn, so you had to read and teach yourself the concepts. However, he was very willing to help answer any questions. I did dislike how much homework he gave - every Friday starting at week one there were chapter assignments due, even if it was an assessment (his tests) week

I took the first level of this course with a different professor and passed it by one point and feared taking this course. Choosing Professor Hillar at WCU was the best decision I made on campus. He makes you work for the grade but everything you get, you earn 100% and he takes pride in his students. If you have the chance, choose Hillar.

name_title: Scott Peterson Professor in the Business department at Northern St ate University

ratings.comment: Great class.
The class was difficult, but the professor was very knowledgeable and always got back to me right away when I had questions. The tutor sessions were also helpful.

Seems to have a passion for the material he teaches but not a passion in helping students or teaching. Breezes over things and I've seen him skip over classmates questions because we were running out of time (cut to him talking about another class for 15 min lmao)
Scott was a really difficult teacher to work with. His responses to questions rarely helped and he was full of himself.

Doesn't grade constantly. Homework(at least in the class I'm in) is all worth the same amount of points. So weather its 10 questions or 35 its all worth the same amount of points. Sometimes not doing the homework is worth it tbh if its all the same and its going to take a long time to do the homework. Its not a rewarding class at all.

name_title: Jan Blits Professor in the Educ ation department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: I felt like his lectures were an episode of the tv show Lost. All over the place, nothing made sense, barely even English. But what are lectures anyway? What is Lost? What does it mean to lecture? The first element is water. Water is everything. But seriously, really hard grader, suck up to him at office hours to improve your grade.

I have to agree with the review below mine. He's very knowledgable about his subject, but because of that, he is set in his opinions of the subject matter and will dismiss you as being uneducated if you offer a different viewpoint. He's not a bad guy, but the lectures were painfully boring and ego-driven. Meet with him and you'll get a B at least.

Blits is a really smart professor, but the material isn't open to anyone's interpretation but his own. And his interpretation is often muddled and confusing. He just stands in front of the class and utters random phrases related to the readings. Only 3 papers to write, but I have no idea what he grades them based off of.

Blits is smart, too smart, he thinks his word is law. disagree and it's like you insult his intelligence.  grade consists of three papers but how he grades those nobody knows, you get to revise the first two papers, he encourages students to meet with him, he's good at clarifiying things but only if you have questions ready. avoid if possible

I was a little worried to take Jan based on previous ratings, but I actually ended up really liking the class.  His grading is kind of mysterious but he is very enthusiastic and knowledgeable about his material which makes for an interesting class.

name_title: Lucia Palmer Professor in the Philosophy department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: this woman was brilliant. she loved students, she loved teaching, she loved philosophy. i think she added a lot to this university and only wish she could have stuck around for my entire semester with her.

Class is BORING!!! If you go the only way to get anything is to sit front row, right in front of her. She is very old and cannot speak up. 1 in class test, 1 14 page paper, and final is a 10 page paper. You can get an easy A, but you will have to spend a lot of time writing. Nice lady though.
very nice lady, but class is boring...impossible to understand. most of the class is discussion(people yelling at each other.)  grade determined by 3 ten page papers. everyone gets over a B.

You can barely understand anything she says; not only does she talk with an accent, but she doesn't talk above a murmur.  She's always confused and mixing stuff up.  Class was easy though; consisted of three exams that were mostly true and false with an essay question at the end.  However, I'll never take this class again if I had the choice.

The class is easy bc of take home exams but going to class is pure torture. Maybe its worth it to get the grade but the class is excruciating bc she is so quiet and coughs all the time (smokes like a chimney).  She can also be quite disrespectful to students. She is very old, talks very slowly, and has thick accent. Sadly I doubt i learned anything

name_title: Helen Intraub Professor in the Psychology department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Such an interesting and insightful class to take, and I know I will use what I learned in it for my future classes. Professor Intraub gives you a lot of information all at once, which is my biggest critique. However lectures are recorded and textbook she is very open to meeting outside of class. Grade is only made up of 5 exams.

Great professor! Really cares about students and our learning. Only graded on 5 exams - not curved. Really challenging content but she makes herself available outside of class so much to help students who are struggling - but you have to take initiative and reach out. Hard class overall, lots of content, but you'll learn a lot from her.

Dr. Intraub was an engaging professor who is clearly very knowledgable and passionate about the material. Grades are only made up of 5 pretty difficult exams. Attendance in class, thorough reading of the textbook, and some solid studying are required to do well on the exams. Otherwise, the class is pretty light in terms of work

Overall, I enjoyed Dr. Intraub's class and recommend taking her class. Her lectures were usually pretty interesting. The exams were a bit difficult but not too bad. She values student discussion and is open to any questions. She is pretty approachable.

Dr. Intraub was very knowledgable about the material but I didn't feel that I took much away from the course. Lectures were confusing & unclear making it hard to prepare for exams- you never knew what would be asked. Final grade is made up of only 5 exam grades. Wouldn't recommend to those who like clearly taught courses & understanding material.

name_title: Anthony Seraphin Professor in the M athem atics department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: The most "Mid" class ever with pointless work added to just bring added stress for no reason.

I would say the lecture was mostly to learn how to use stat crunch. Seems like he took advice from past years and assigned less hw and gave plenty of time to completed it. Tests, hw, and quizzes were online so you really got what you put into the class.
This professor was not the most engaging, but with unstuck study ai and the free textbook, I was able to teach myself the material and do well. Attendance is mandatory but not too helpful.

This professor was very boring and I would not even go to class by the end of october. I taught myself the entire course and it was heavy on homework. the exams were online but still impossible to do and they were like 3 hours long. Do not take this class unless it is required, it was brutal.

Worst professor I have ever had. He basically whispers everything in a monotone voice and just reads of the slides and if you ask him a question it is clear he has no idea what he is doing. If you go to class, you'll be in the same place as if you skipped. Attendance is not mandatory, but you get slight extra credit if you show up.

name_title: Peter Horv ath Professor in the Health Science department at University at Buffalo (SUNY Buffalo)

ratings.comment: He is so helpful and the class is fun

I took him online and u are just provided with powerpoints and expects u to understand and know them for exams. Just wished he did more like assign hws or something bc I can't really say I learned anything. I, however, wished I took the class more seriously as well lol. He does provide extra credit for online students so take advantage of that.

I had him for an Academies seminar, and he was the funniest and quirkiest person I have ever met. He brightened up my day, and he even gives me hugs when I see him in the hallways. Great guy, I would recommend him for anyone.

I took this as a summer class, and it was pretty easy. Straightforward and clear criteria. I met with him after the semester to discuss some questions about my major (nutrition). He talked with me for over an hour and answered everything! Very smart and a great guy! I'm glad to know I'll have him over a couple more times. Would recommend!

It's easy stuff. But people underestimate it a bit too much. There are no lectures to listen, strictly slides and outlines available online. Give yourself 3 days before the exams. Look over everything. Remember specific food examples. Best thing about Horvath is that he's the only professor who offers 7 points of extra credit. DO THEM. Easy A.

name_title: Ann Cohen Professor in the Accounting department at University at Buffalo (SUNY Buffalo)

ratings.comment: Do not take her at all. Avoid if possible. Grades very harshly, dropped my GPA from a perfect 4.00. Avoid if you care about your learning and grades!

Professor Cohen is very intimidating but one of the best in the accounting program. Her lectures are a bit disorganized and you need to spend hours outside class trying to learn the material. Read the chapter before she lectures on it and you won't fall behind. If you put in the work you can get an A but it is a lot.

As usual, there's an intense group project. Pray you get a good group. Study, do the homework, participate. DO NOT come to class late. Don't be alarmed when she doesn't hesitate to express her disdain with your class performance. She will.

Cohen is an intimidating woman stemming from her incredible knowledge of the topic area & confidence in the class room which reassures you as a student in lecture but perhaps also discourages seeking outside help. She presents the material very clearly but  does not spoon feed you anything & makes you work for it if you want to learn. Good luck

One of the worst teachers I had while in the accounting program. However she is a required teacher so theres no avoiding her. So here is some advice: -Go to class, she doesnt post notes online, and she'll hold it against you for missing -Take the best notes possible, she doesnt teach out of the book so you have limited study material

name_title: Tamara Rabe Professor in the English department at University at Buffalo (SUNY Buffalo)

ratings.comment: slow at grading things but she's so sweet. she's very accommodating and tries to make the class easy. extends deadlines and cancels class often. just go to class and do the few assignments and you'll be fine. don't bother buying the textbook bc you dont actually need it.

Rabe is a great English 105 professor. She is very understanding if you are sick or have a lot of work piled on you. You barely have class throughout the semester because she makes it office hours instead. She also takes her time giving assignments leading up to the essay so it's not stressful. I would recommend her for anyone. Also gives regrades

Unless you're an ass kisser do not take her for ENG 105. She's a tough grader especially to students that have no interest. If you don't go to class when attendance isn't mandatory or you don't tell her in detail about your other classes having more work, she thinks you're a lazy student and will grade you as such.

I love Tamara Rabe. She is the kindest lady ever and I'm really going to miss her. We rarely have class and a lot of conference days. She is very helpful and responds to emails quickly. Her kind words really make you feel good. And she truly is an angel! Pick her for eng 105 and you won't regret it. Her class is 4 papers and she works slow with us.

I had Rabe's class at 8:00 for English 105. Attendance is mandatory, so her entire class had to get up at the brink of dawn so she can repeat the directions of an assignment that had been posted for weeks. When she didn't feel like holding class she would send an email the morning of telling us, but many people didn't even see the email in time.

name_title: Raymond Orrange Professor in the Managerial Science department at University at Buffalo (SUNY Buffalo)

ratings.comment: I really enjoyed Professor Orange's class. He has funny sense of humor and is actually a nice guy though he can be a tad condescending; do not be intimidated. He underlines exactly what he expects from students with no ambiguity. Tests are exactly what he says they'll be in class and are very easy. My only complaint is the labs are useless!

I didn't watch a single lecture and I earned an A-. Simply do the assignments on time, go to recitation every week, and study the practice tests a lot before the actual test. Professor Orrange seems like a cool funny guy but I had total ADD when it came to watching online lectures. I would recommend the class though

Literally tells students EXACTLY what is on the test. "This will be on the test." Gives the answers to homework assignments during lecture. Boring at times but it is evident that he is passionate about his profession. He LOVES when students goes to his office hours! If you do the practice tests you are Guaranteed an A. Recommend
Horrible professor, very hard teaching methods. Avoid if you can!
Very easy class. The online lectures are very boring though

name_title: Steve M attox Professor in the Geology department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor Mattox is an amazing professor, he is very approachable and cares about your success as a student.

You are lucky if you are able to have Steve during your time at GV. I loved him as a professor and a mentor. He is a great person who has so much passion for what he does. I wish I could take this class again. He is definitely my favorite professor in my 5 years at GV.

Steve is great! He cares about what were learning about, as well as his students. He expects a lot from you, but is more than willing to do everything he can to help you succeed. Gives an amount of work that is suitable for the course. I hope he teaches this course more in the future as he did a great job!

Overall professor Mattox was a great guy, I knew almost nothing coming into the class and he was always available for extra help and loved answering questions. It is clear how much he enjoys teaching and it radiates to the students, highly recommended.

I found Professor Mattox annoying, both as a person and as a professor. He didnt communicate well at all and when asking for help, he would provide vague answers that had almost nothing to due with the original question. Didnt seem like he cared if you did well or not. Had an attitude of I dont know, not my problem.

name_title: John Hewitt Professor in the Law department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: He is one of the authors of the book we used, so if you take notes and read the book you will do fine.  I filled up an entire notebook, there are lots of notes and the lecture can be very boring at times. Pretty easy, 4 tests 70 mc each and in class questions, 1 can be dropped at the end of the semester.

On the 1st day professor hewitt described the patriot act as the sole reason why there has been no successful terrorist attacks on US soil. If you share his views, I'm sure he's great but if you disagree, which i hope you do, then don't take his class.

He's a really nice guy but his lectures are so boring! He just reads off his notes and out of the book. Attendence isn't mandatory but you'll end up regretting it if you don't go to class, since a lot of the test comes from lectures.
Hewitt's Capstone is the one to take if you don't want to be overwhelmed.  He breaks up the work and it is related through film, literature and music.  I really enjoyed his class.

Very nice guy, very boring class.  My entire class failed all his tests.  MUST READ BOOK THOUROGHLY!!!  Gave a lot of extra points for lack of grades on tests, which was very helpful!!!  Not a bad prof, he was helpful if needed

name_title: James Houston Professor in the Criminal Justice department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: The worst professor I have had.I am taking his Gangs class at USFSM. I am getting all A's in every other class and will be lucky if I pass his. He does not stay on topic and never remembers directions he gave us for assignments. Tests are very hard.  If you want to pass the essay tests write as much as you can otherwise you will fail.

The worst Prof EVER! He is inconsistance with material, he frequently goes off topic. His personal life and prior research is his platform not education. To pass his class you have to be a Teachers Pet! Good luck with figuring him out. His text books are those authors who he has done research with, great ethical guy, not so much!

Horrible as a 6-9 I took the most basic level he teaches and i feel bad for those who have him and are majoring in CJ. impossible to talk to him. No one ever showed up for class it was so bad and we only had it once a week.

He is a great prof! I had no intrest in the subject, but he tells a lot of stories and makes the class fun. He in very interested in his students needs and wants! He will do all he can to help and you will do well in his class if you prepare. There is a lot of writting on the tests but he is a decent grader. He is a wonderful prof!

Dr. Houston was a great guy to talk to, very interesting, but really is a bad prof. he does tell some interesting stories and likes to help you out, but if you are in this for an easy A, not gonna happen. class average was a C. nice guy, bad teacher, thats all.

name_title: Edward Baum Professor in the Chemistry department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I would definitely recommend this professor for CHM 102. Professor Baum made this class exceptionally easy, and as long as you do your online assignments its an easy A. He also allows test corrections for half points back on all exams. He really wants his students to succeed.

Easy A /B+, but Prof Baum even stated that a lot of what he says isn't what we need to know, and he will ramble on about information that is not relevant. This creates an overload of information that is harder to process. He also doesn't explain anything well, if at all. Nice guy but arguably the worst professor I've had at GVSU, and I'm a junior.

I would definitely recommend this professor for CHM 102. Professor Baum made this class exceptionally easy, and as long as you do your online assignments its an easy A. He also allows test corrections for half points back on all exams. He rarely takes attendance, but showing up will definitely make tests easier. Great professor overall!

Baum is a nice guy, but his lectures tend to be super boring and not interesting. The book comes with a code online that you use to do homework, so don't buy the actual one if you want. He does let you do test corrections for half the credit back on exams. He's super boring in his lectures though.

Baum is a nice guy. He gives study guides as well as goes over the study guide the class before the exam. He allows you to do test corrections for half the points back on the exams and all of the homework is online. He is a quiet talker and can be hard to hear.

name_title: Lorelle Thomas Professor in the Fine Arts department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I love Dr. Thomas! She cares about each and every student, allows you to work with her out of class to improve your grades and will tell stories and allow student to put in feedback. I would definitely take classes with her again!

I WOULDN'T RECOMMEND. she makes class interesting and fun by telling stories and who married who, who did what.... and smth about the subject. but when it comes to exams, she doesn't ask about who slept with who! I don't remember anything that i learned in this class she just makes you memorize them for a short period of time 100 names !

She is able to take art history and breathe real life into it. This is a talent, because I have taken 3 other art history courses and have seen how stale the material can seem when every class involves sitting in a dark room looking at slides and listening to lectures. She is also very personable, and a lot of fun. I have really enjoyed her class.

Funny, but she expects way too much on her tests. Spouts nothing but trivia about the images, then expects you to know things about them that you never actually went over, but you know who slept with who... no good, too bad she's the only prof. for this class.
I think she is an utterly disorganized professor. One can never tell when she's spouting useful information or gossip. Though she seems like a nice person I would not recommend her as a professor.

name_title: Tim Fisher Professor in the Fine Arts department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Fish was a fantastic professor. Respectful and clear feedback while also being challenging. His classes were the highlight of my time at Grand Valley. He really cared about his students and you could tell. I learned a lot from him, and currently have a successful job in my field for 10+ years.

My first mistake was taking this class as a free elective. Don't take this class unless you have to!!! Super strict grader who rarely gives out A's. Super strict on Attendance so DO NOT SKIP or show up late! HEAVY workload with an expectation that you use 6-9 hours outside of class to work on assignments. Not tech-savvy so the syllabus is outdated.

Fish today, is not the same Fish that was. Gone are the harsh critiques, the satirical attitude, and the insane grading. 20 years ago, even 5 years ago, Fish was the hardest professor to take at this institution. He now hands out A's when a decent effort is given. Critiques are 95% strengths with maybe a gentle criticisms here and there.

I took a few classes 20 years ago. He has high standards and is a fair, but tough grader. I learned more from him than any other. He didn't hand out A's... Ever. You had to work for it. If you received an A, it's because your earned it. He gave honest feedback. He may not always say what you want to hear, but what you need to know. Thank u, Tim.

I like Fish as a person, but not as a teacher. His grading is not only unclear but it's so difficult to please him. He gives the longest lectures that feel very unnecessary. This class took over my life for that entire semester. The amount of homework is actually insane. I have pulled so many all-nighters to get my drawings done on time.

name_title: Jim Donnelly Professor in the Marketing department at University of Kentucky

ratings.comment: just to the point. no guessing what is expected.
This is guy is amazing!! The reason I am a Business Prof today....

The best professor ever. Starts out classes telling a bizzare story seemingly unrelated to anything... teaches the class... sums up with a one liner pulling the whole shebang together with pertinence, humor, and intellingence. I love the guy.

His tests were paragraphs long multiple choice questions that cover absolutely nothing from lecture. The questions are very hard to read when you are in a room of 350 people. His stories were entertaining, but he really needs to handout test prep sheets if he's going to spend the hour bragging about himself.
Wonderful teacher! He is known around the world and has come up with the slogans for the McDonalds commerials. He is Amazing!

name_title: Michael Dewilde Professor in the Philosophy department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Best ethics course I've ever taken! He keeps the lectures a two-way conversation, with role-playing to help you understand the topics. The situations discussed are extremely valuable in your career, and even personal relationships. DeWilde is very talented and knowledgeable, we need more professors like him! Very light homework load too.

Second half of the class was with him in a smaller lecture group. Definitely a very calm personality so be mindful of what time of day you take him. Great discussions in class and supplemental learning resources that he provides. Assigned two books, but hardly used one of them. Try and find the books online somewhere for free.

Professor DeWilde is a great man and professor. He cares about his students and the course, as a whole. I will warn that he is very monotone at 8am, so be prepared to drink lots of coffee to pay attention. A great grader and overall would take him again!

Class is graded heavily on participation so attendance is mandatory. But topics are so engaging it's really not that bad to speak in class and this is coming from someone who HATES public speaking. Also no textbook but 3 books to read throughout the semester. Also assignments are easy and you get plenty of time to complete them.

I would recommend everyone take Professor DeWilde. It is obvious he cares about his student's success and wants you to be prepared for the real world. Role-play scenarios were engaging and made you analyze situations from different POVs. This was an SWS for me so we did have papers, but nothing too long, and an easy A if you put forth the effort.

name_title: David Ihrman Professor in the English department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor Ihrman is fantastic. He is extensive in his knowledge, and teaches with a rare passion. He is not a challenging grader, if one is willing to work hard on their papers. He assigns three papers, two 7-9, and one 4-5. On the 4-5 meet the requirement but do it well. With the 7-9 go big. I did 12 & 14 pg papers and I received perfect scores.

He is a nice guy but not a great professor. His lessons are super confusing and often not related to the reading. He doesn't use blackboard and his grading doesn't make sense. He grades some papers with a letter grade and others with a 1-3.

Great prof! Lots of reading and his lectures aren't the clearest, but they are interesting and can go off on tangents. There's two longer papers and one shorter one, and he allows rewrites on the first two. If you're a strong writer, you'll be fine, and besides he's always available for help. Beware though, his final exam sucks.

I would not recommend Professor Ihrman. If you want to succeed and feel good about your papers you turn in, do not take him. Although he does let you rewrite 2 out of the 3 papers, it honestly does not help and he does not take into consideration the time and effort put into his class. His final exam is impossible & expects you to know it all.

Despite not using Blackboard, one can pretty assess what is their grade in the class based on one's grades from the papers we have to write. I appreciate and respect Dr. Ihrman, a lot. I think he is an outstanding professor who is passionate about literature and has us all asking the deeper question, "Why does this matter?" I recommend him!

name_title: Bruce Engle Professor in the English department at Morehead St ate University

ratings.comment: Overall not awful, but a lot of work. He is a very tough grader, often taking points off for minimal things, and will not give you the benefit of the doubt on any sort of application error or anything. Very strict in terms of guidelines and assignments.

A very hard grader and is very specific on what he wants on the assignments. I would recommend to not take him online because he isn't very clear on what he wants and you only kind of find out after he grades it. He does not leave room for creative writing and you have to stick with the formatting that he requires.

I took this class online, very intelligent dude. Knows what he's talking about. The assignments, especially the ones from the textbook, are tedious and lame; so long as you have an ok work ethic though, they're not too bad. Very harsh grader on the essays and the summary, so PLEASE try on all of them. Due dates are at 5PM

This professor grades very tough with very few guidelines. He expects more than he cares to clarify. All homework is due at 5 pm, which is very unreasonable for an online course. I would not recommend.

Dr. Engle is a very nice man, he learned my name within the first two classes. Participation does matter, but we never talk about anything particularly difficult. He will call on people to answer questions, so make sure you do the readings & homework. I would for sure take this professor again. 10/10 reccommend.

name_title: Kristine Mullendore Professor in the Law department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Honestly, the lectures were so boring. He is super monotone and just reads off the slides but will mention a little bit about working in a jail. Exams were pretty easy if you took notes on the lectures. Overall, easy class just a very boring class and a mediocre professor. Take him if you want an easier workload but be prepared to be bored in class

Mullendore is very knowledgeable about the information but expects you to know it too. She is very rude if someone asks a question. She acts sassy if a person doesn't know the answer. Exams are hard because some things are not in the lecture or book. Her class is only based on a few grades which is really annoying if you do bad on exams.

The class consist of 3 exams, a court observation paper & participation. Attendance is mandatory. She gives you outlines to follow with the lectures (that aren't posted) and the outlines do not follow the lectures / she discusses topics very fast and gets irritable if you have a hard time understanding. Exams are lengthy & hard as well. Work hard!!

Content of this class is real helpful for CJ & Mullendore is very knowledgable. There is a lot to learn, so each of the 3 tests has a lot of info but if you study and ask questions you'll do fine. One court observation paper and attendance is marked. If you put in the effort and study for the tests you'll learn a lot and do well.

Very nice prof. Graded on a court report and 3 exams plus attendance. Exams are mildly difficult but she grades the essays very fairly and the majority of the exams are essay questions. If you work for it you'll get an A or A-.

name_title: Petr Plechac Professor in the M athem atics department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Very surprised by the lack of good ratings on here. Petre was one of the best professors I have had so far in college. His initial explanations can be slightly confusing, but he makes sure to leave a couple classes before the exams to go over the content and make sure that everyone understands. He gives ample extra credit. Highly recommend.

TBH, I was scared of taking Engineering Math I with Dr. Plechac (since he has some awful reviews here), but he's been great! He is super generous with partial credit, and has added extra credit to all our midterm exams. Homework is graded for correctness, but comes from the textbooks, so its manageable if you use the books. Also no quizzes!

Try not to have him if possible, very knowledgeable but does not teach this material well. Hard to read handwriting and non-stop notes of formulas and theorems that you don't know what to do with made this class maddening. Midterm is 35% and final is 45% of final grade. Very few examples of methods in class or textbook. Generous grader to be fair.

Gave us extra homeworks that were basically the exact opposite of extra credit. Meaning he gave extra homework, expected it to be done, but if anything was incorrect points were taken off, however no points were given for the homework. Also illegible and does not explain concepts well. Better off just reading the book

I respected him for his knowledge. But he had no regards either for my hard work or for my good behaviour. I worked for an A. Did brilliantly in the mid terms and homework, he gave me a C. I am in a derpession now in medical terms. olst my confidence. U thnk he cn sleep paecefully. all i have for u is cusres.

name_title: Edwin Joseph Professor in the Geography department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: DR. Joseph is an extremely interesting person and he bring plenty of real-world experience to his class. His methods may seem different, but are very effective.
