Yes, the class was very unorganized and could have been better with a clearer objective. The class has only been offered once before this section.  I encourage students to experience at least one of Dr. Joseph's classes while at GVSU.

Do not take this professor.  He is so unorganized and lost.  He hasn't taught me anything and I was so willing to learn.  He left the country on the last week of classes without telling us and he never posted evaluations.  He is a worthless teacher. Do not take him.

Probably the most interesting person you will ever meet if you get a chance to talk to him. He is a pretty easy grader and is very lenient. His classes are easy, however, he is not very structured or organized. I got much better grades in his classes than I really deserved.

I wonder if any of the students with bad grades ever bothered to chat with Dr. Joseph. I deserved the C+ I received and I earned the B+ in GPY 310.  There is a method to the madness.  However, he could use some organizational skills.

name_title: Mark Staves Professor in the Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I'm a CMB student, so I know Dr. Staves pretty well. I took Foundations of Brewing, and my past experiences in keeping lab notebooks made the class a breeze. The class is just a few online quizzes, a presentation on basically whatever you want as it relates to beer, and a final where you have to taste a beer and an off flavor and identify them!

Lectures provide all the important information. Textbooks are background reading. Mr. Staves is passionate about biology, and adaptable with his quizzes; he talked with our class about it, and decided to change his quizzes from one-take to multiple takes. The class is rough and the tests make up your grade, but he's understanding. Also Kahoot lol

The class was very challenging for me and I truly had to work for my grade. The Kahoots are awesome. Pay attention to the questions! Prof Staves is a great option for this class. Without him, I would not have gotten the grade I did. Go to his office hours! The week of finals, he scheduled a 1 on 1 with me for an hour and a half! 10/10 recommend:)
Very fun kahoots

It was a brewing class and it was awesome. Prof. Staves knows the craft (pun intended) and enjoys teaching it. It was a summer course so it was quick, which was unfortunate because I could have easily gone a full semester in that class. Choose it for your Issues course. Best decision you will make as an undergrad

name_title: Glenn Haynes Professor in the Economics department at Western Illinois University

ratings.comment: Glenn is the best teacher he is the reason I picked up an econ minor! If you have the chance take him! I just wish he would teach higher classes!
There are way too many assignments due each week.
Absolute Beast. It has been 6 years since I graduated but I look back and this guy was by far the best teacher I have ever had in my life.
dudes a straight beast. one of thee best teachers out there.

If you're offered the opportunity, take this class without thinking. Absolutley the best professor I have ever taken at western, Glenn is always there to help, and won't stop until he is sure you understand.

name_title: Rita Grant Professor in the Accounting department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: She is the worst professor Ive had at GV. I genuinely wonder how shes made it this far in life with her apparent lack of social skills. Consider yourself warned if youre unlucky enough to have to deal with this wannabe professor.

Worst prof Ive had at GV. Doesnt teach at all and just posts like 10 minute videos talking about what you need to do, but doesnt explain how to do it. Is EXTREMELY rude, even called me not smart in a comment on an assignment. Super disrespectful and makes the class very difficult and stressful.

Worst professor Ive ever had. Doesnt teach at all and expects you to remember everything from acc 212. Doesnt care about students at all, and responds to emails with sass and anger, as if she hates her life. Makes this 1 credit class very hard. She is the only prof for this class, so get some friends to help each other out, bc she wont
She cool.

She doesnt give much instructions at all for any of the assignments. She offers plenty of resources to teach yourself but does very little herself. Working with your classmates is gonna be your best bet because she does not enjoy answering questions.

name_title: Ellen Shupe Professor in the Psychology department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: By far the best professor I have had. With social psychology, this class offers many great opportunities. She is very flexible, understanding, and her lectures are beyond useful. She loves what she does and it shows. I recommend taking social psychology with Professor Shupe!

The course code isn't correct here as I had her for the Northern Ireland study abroad. Cannot recommend Ellen Shupe highly enough, as her study abroad program is easily one of the greatest memories I will ever have in my life, and she is very responsible for that. The entire trip was beautifully run, and she cared so much for every student.

Professor Shupe is a caring instructor who makes the capstone experience engaging. The workload is manageable with helpful feedback. Using unstuck AI alongside the readings helped me prepare effectively for the weekly assignments.

I cannot recommend her enough, take her classes! Capstone was very easygoing and when we were too stressed, she removed assignments. Doing the group project with students in another country was also a very fun and rewarding experience! She's so sweet and caring, I'd take any class she teaches.

The sweetest professor, cannot recommend her enough. She genuinely cares about her students and is very accommodating. Workload was very respectable considering it is a capstone class. Reading and writing intensive, but again she is very understanding that things happen and willing to help if needed. Overall just the best.

name_title: Bruce Sagan Professor in the M athem atics department at Michigan St ate University

ratings.comment: Prof. Sagan is a nice, caring man, but he is not the best teacher. My class was taught by online videos (outside of class, about 45 minutes worth, 3 times a week, count as a grade). Along with the videos, there are webwork assignments due 3 times a week and the questions are not similar to class or videos. There are weekly quizzes. Not an easy clas
AWESOME PROFESSOR!!!!!!!!!

Professor Sagan is really good math teacher.  He teaches everything that he expects you to know, and is very respectful and understanding with his students.  Taking this class made me add a math major.  317H starts as a difficult, weed-out style class, but gets easier.
Excellent professor that was very clear in teaching calc 2. He was a really nice guy too!
Awesome - made me want to become a Math major - too late though!

name_title: Gregory Viau Professor in the English department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Easy A.  weekly quizes that are easy. In class assignments that are easy. and one paper at the end of the semester. Didn't learn anything the whole semester...

Loved Prof. Viau! Writing 305 is a really helpful class.  You only write one paper (Midterm essay) and if you get above like a C- on it you don't have to take the final.  Lots of grammar exercises and writing techniques, improves your writing A LOT. Points are up for grabs every class and it isn't hard to get an A. PLUS it's extremely beneficial.

I really enjoyed this professor. I hate writing but I took his WRT 305 class and the way it was structured we didn't do as much writing as I thought it would be, instead we did more exercises on grammar and analyzing other papers. If you're not a big writer and need to take this class I highly recommend him. He was also very helpful.
Sooo easy, if you're not a huge fan of writing take 305 with him, you barely have to do any writing. You also learn about writing for your specific major, so that was helpful too!

A really good class. would def. recommend for business majors. hes really helpful and lets you turn papers in late. easy quizzes. there are assignments and quizzes every class. a lot of papers but the class is easy. Take HIM

name_title: Sheila Blackman Professor in the Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Very easy to work with and responds quickly to emails! Super clear about instructions and exactly what she is looking for.

I was hesitant to take her course because of the low ratings, but honestly she is amazing. Very willing to work with students and VERY clear grading criteria. Not sure if she changed the way she teaches the course/assigns homework but she is hands down one of the best professors I've taken. Absolutely take her.

This is my second semester at GVSU but not my first year with college classes. Professor Blackman truly cares about her students... No Text pur. HOWEVER - She assigns approx 15 - 20 things to do a week from readings, homework, quizzes - REQUIRES students to attend a zoom meeting (half on Saturday and Half on Monday). Its like 1/3rd of your grade

I'm currently taking her class. It's a lot I get less work doing the CMB labs where we work with RNA and make a conference poster to present. This is during the pandemic and it's all online no zooms just read all the material she gives and you better have it memorized. I have been yelled at by her for taking notes and looking back on my notes.

Probably the worst prof I've had at Grand Valley. Very disorganized; very hard to follow and know her expectations. She is very rude when you try and gain clarity. Just not a reasonable person at all. She wants everyone to love plants as much as she does, and that's just unrealistic. Good luck.

name_title: Rodd Lowell Professor in the Computer Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Great professor who delivers engaging lectures and genuinely cares about his students. There's a lot of work though. Lots of reading, weekly quizzes, 3 exams when we could've just taken 2, and mandatory attendance. The assignments were few and super easy though. Some may complain about the content but I think he's a pretty good professor.
Prof Lowell's class can be challenging, but Unstuck AI helped me prep for the exams and projects. The lectures are hit-or-miss, but office hours are valuable if you're struggling.

I think it has value in the sense of helping students get internships and practice interview skills, but it doesn't at all cover technical interviews. I feel like a lot of this class is a repeat of WRT 350, and I don't enjoy that they force you to take it before getting credit for internships.

Even with lots of readings, and multiple exams, and quizes it was super easy to take and he was very open to questions. The course is lecture heavy, but doing assigned readings asap is something I would recommend for any student taking 290.

This is a required course for CS majors, and you'd think it's gonna be a blowoff, but don't. This guy gives like 10 hours of reading to do every week. I basically gave up even trying to get them done by the fifth week when he gave us a 20 page case study to read, and then barely went over it for 5 minutes.

name_title: Keith W atts Professor in the Languages department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor Watts is a kind person and I thought his lectures contained very helpful information for people in all levels of spanish. The lectures were also very conversational, so it was easy to feel comfortable, and had lots of opportunities to talk to your classmates. I really enjoyed this class and his teaching style, definitely would take again!

Professor Watts is AMAZING! I absolutely love him as a teacher! He really cares about his students and wants them to succeed in his class. He is super accessible outside of class if you ever have any questions.  Don't be afraid to make mistakes in his class; he's super forgiving and will help you get your point across.

Honestly has 0% to do with who he is as a person I'm sure he is a wonderful man and lovely to be around. That being said he is IMPOSSIBLE! The content is quite easy and probably too rudimentary for the course, but the formatting, scheduling, and overall communication is atrocious. Unclear what is going on/ expected at all times. so stressful.

Watts is a great man, but cannot figure out Bb to save his life. He also asks you to do homework, but you don't really have to do it because he goes over it in class. You turn in a few of them, but he mostly looks for completion. Tests are long, quizzes are often, but if you pay any attention in class you'll be fine.

Not a fan at all. In this class we had 2 tests, 4 speaking assignments/analysis, and a presentation as the final exam. He did not know how to work Bb we had to email him assignments and he won't talk to you in english even if u have a problem. Passive aggressive and singles out students.

name_title: Joe Hornik Professor in the Computer Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: BEWARE! This class was by far much harder than my CIS 200 level classes. Professor Hornik doesn't do a good job at explaining code, and each week the projects get harder and harder. The tests are open note, but even with that it is hard to do well. Unless you have a background in coding/programming, I would not take this professor. I struggled HARD

My first programming class. If theres 1 tip I can give you to survive CIS160 it is to GET HELP. These are hard concepts. I would suggest his office hours or the success center. I went every single week to get help on the assignments and I have a 97% in the class. Tests are open note. Hornik is a great guy. Can be boring but is ALWAYS ready to help.

Prof Hornik is sort of a boring professor, but don't change your class schedule or anything. If you show up to most of the lectures (not mandatory) and show up to all of the labs (mandatory) and work hard in them, you'll do fine. He is a fine professor. Lectures are just a little boring.

Hornik has the patience of a saint. The class was really slow for me, but I am clearly more advanced than my fellow students. I wanted to dole out throat punches in every class, but he calmly helped everyone to move forward.

Joe is a great professor who loves helping students learn. If you are genuinely interested in COBOL, he is more than willing to help you understand and fix whatever is going wrong. His project requirements are very straightforward. He even uses class lectures to go over EXACTLY what you will do in the project. Book required. Or at least a few pages

name_title: Jo Ellen Miller Professor in the English department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Prof Miller is one of the best profs I've had. She is extremely knowledgeable and is able to use examples or rephrase things so you understand, you just have to ask. Much of the class is discussion based so you are responsible for your own participation which will reflect in your grade. Absolutely loved this class and wish I could take it again.

Jo was pretty good. There is 2 papers and you get to pick what play to write on and she gives super good feed back. You can resubmit a paper for a higher grade. She does not use blackboard at all which makes orginization and knowing your grade very difficult. beware you will have to act out Shakespeare
Independence is key, barely any help from Professor. The work load is over the top for this class.

Professor Jo was such a great teacher. You can tell she is very passionate about the things she teaches. I had her for 2 classes and neither had much homework but if you missed class you wouldn't lost some participation points. She lets you make them up with an assignment but I wouldn't recommend missing a class. Overall I would enroll in her class

Kinda made me hate Shakespeare. The class is an hour and fifteen mins long, but really should just be 50 minutes. You REALLY DIVE into Shakespeare so if that's your thing, then take this class with her. She is very passionate, but puts you on the spot and will dispute you. Papers are also kinda hard, but once you get the hang of it, you're good.

name_title: Greg Wolffe Professor in the Computer Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Recent graduate, took all the classes, had all the profs. Trust me, Wolffe is the best. I learned so much in OS it was amazing, and he made it understandable and interesting. Great class, great prof.

Wolffe was my favorite professor at GV. His lectures are extremely informative and clear and he makes OS seem pretty straightforward. He is knowledgeable and is also caring and wants everyone to understand the material. The labs and the homeworks are well made so that they reinforce the material. Take OS with Wolffe if you can!

Super interesting guy. Finished undergrad with a major in biology, was a forklift driver for a while, and ended up pursuing a Ph.D. in Computer Engineering. He has the rare ability to take complicated topics and explain them with easy-to-digest analogies. His class is very challenging, but this is definitely the professor to go with for OS.
The class is tough but Wolffe does a great job of explaining complex topics. I left the class feeling accomplished and smarter.

He is very effective at teaching touch and technical concepts. He explains things very well, offers great answers to student questions, and uses helpful analogies. He is a bit of a tough grader, but the expectations are laid out so you can guess what grade you will get before turning it in.

name_title: Amy Stone Professor in the M athem atics department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: If you suck at math, I wouldn't recommend. Quizzes are all or nothing, though you get a few attempts. Whole course is graded out of 100, attendance is 25%. There is no structure to her notes at all and she does about 2 practice problems on the board per quiz / concept. Then she expects you to use the provided to help yourself learn it after.

Teaches the material very well. Gives really annoying 3 question quizzes where if you get one wrong you essentially fail. Didn't show up to class a couple times and missed a quiz which bombed my grade. She's very approachable and always encourages learning even outside of class. Never had an issue understanding the topics she taught.

I had professor stone this semester, and I would not recommend!!! If you are not very good at math, this class is not for you. Her grading structure is VERY unforgiving, as every test is all or nothing. She grades the whole semester out of 100 points, and it is very easy to not get those points. Her lectures are very hard to follow.

Coursework did not really line up with the homework, quizzes, or the final exam. There also was not an actual structure on around the notes for the course, which was very unhelpful and confusing. She is a nice person but not a very good teacher. I would recommend switching to another professor if you have to take this course for credit.
I cried.
She was super nice, gave lots of chances, and wanted her students to succeed. If you want to do good in the class, you will. Pay attention and you will learn everything you need to know from her.

name_title: Madhu Prakash Professor in the Educ ation department at Penn St ate University

ratings.comment: This class was awful. This was supposed to be an education seminar, and we didn't talk about education once during the entire course of the class. She made us do ridiculous group projects (i.e. go to the sustainability institute and do a presentation to the class) and forced us to cook even though she knew we had no kitchen access! Avoid if you can

Snoozefest! She loved guilt trips (like buying food from anywhere but a farmer's market, owning a cell-phone) It was a one credit class but she gave as much work as a 3 credit class. She tried to change our lifestyle but didn't teach us about education. she made us cook even though she knew we lived in dorms with no kitchens. Avoid her if you can!!

Madhu is a fantastic philosophy teacher, and a good person.  She is 100% sincere, and is always herself.  If you like to have rubrics or a point system, you won't like the assessment, because these are anathema to her teaching philosophy.  Instead she will help you challenge your assumptions and help you learn ed philosophy.

Madhu is the most beautiful wonderful soul I have ever met. She loves each and every one of her students and tells us all we are each others' teachers. This class makes you question your beliefs and makes you cultivate your own philosophy of education. The people that hate this class are set in their ways and aren't open to learning and loving

This class will push you. If you like to live in your bubble then this class will not be enjoyable for you. If you want to learn about education, localism, and how to take an active role in shaping your community's future, then this class is for you. Those who rated this class poorly are beyond my understanding.

name_title: Toni Perrine Professor in the Communic ation department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: The class is interesting because the films she shows are really cool. Can be a bit lecture heavy at times but the lectures always relate well to what she screens. SHOW UP TO CLASS. Also, do any extra credit you can in the beginning because it can be hard to keep up towards the end of the semester.

I love Toni so I am a bit bias. The class is reading heavy but worth the information as it is very interesting. Theories can be hard to understand but she does a good job of explaining them in more modern terms. Papers can be long and difficult to write, but she's always willing to help.

Toni makes you work hard, but I think she is a great professor. She really wants her students to learn. Yeah, the big papers are tough, but she is great to work with during office hours to make sure you understand the material. Definitely try and get on her good side during the first few days.

Toni was a wonderful Professor. At first this class seemed like an endless amount of work, but I soon realized she just wants you to live up to your potential. Not just do the bare minimum. She made me get excited about learning again! Take her if you actually want to further your education!!

Toni is one of the hardest professors I have ever had at GVSU. She is not very accommodating to students (doesn't post grades on BB) and she is a really tough grader. Her classes are required, but do NOT take two on the same day as I did, huge mistake. Get ready for reading and group presentations. If she likes you the class will be way easier.

name_title: Rob Franciosi Professor in the English department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I was in ENG 225 and it was great! The professor assigned interesting readings, gave engaging lectures, and was compassionate, listening if you faced personal challenges. However, their instructions for writing assignments were unclear at first. While this likely won't impact your grade since he's an easy grader, it's something to keep in mind.

He is very nice and understanding. I took 226 as a senior and found the content a bit boring, as I had already studied a lot of it. That being said, it is very easy to do well in this class. There are a lot of assignments, but he is an easy grader and doesn't care if you turn it in late. Final is an easy, pre-recorded poetry read.

Great guy, very flexible and understanding with requirements. his remembering 9/11 class was very depressing at times (due to subject) but his lectures struck me as very passionate and informative. Interesting discussions. I wasn't a fan of final essay and group project but he was willing to adjust expectations if students needed more guidelines.
Has a good heart.
He is a very harsh grader, he just talked/lectured through many of our classes while we all sat in silence, incredibly boring at times

name_title: Chris Dolder Professor in the The atre & Dance department at University of California Berkeley

ratings.comment: Urururur

I graduated in 1999.  How is it that I still remember him?  He was amazing.  I can't recall the names of my art profs, my sociology profs.  I'm creating an at-home fitness routine that incorporates things I'd learned from him.  In a sculpture class one day the model remarked to ME that I had an amazing body.  Thanks to him.  So inspirational!

Christopher Dolder was the most talented, hard-working, passionate, driven and caring teacher I had at UC Berkeley's Dance Department.  He was HARD & BLUNT, and I LOVE that about his teaching style.  He challenged you because he believed in you.  He helped me get into grad school and become the dance professor I am today. Lots of 1 on 1 if you ask.

one of the best instructors I've ever known. i gained a true appreciation of the importance of discipline and hard work, and how much you can accomplish when you combine those two essentials with your own passion for something.  He's so talented and so nurturing.  Thanks, Chris!!
One of the best.  He is very determined that everyone improves in the class.

name_title: Peggy Vandenberg Professor in the Philosophy department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: If you can take a class with her, do it! She is such a sweet lady, and really knows the Enlightenment thinkers. Pay attention in class, study for the exams, visit her office, and you will do well. Highly recommend!

Not too bad, but make sure you attend every class because attendance is mandatory for your grade. She also gives pop quizzes throughout the semester, but as long as you do the reading and focus on the subject in the syllabus you will be fine. She's a tough grader for essays, but helps during office hours. Not the best, but definitely not the worst.

Professor Vandenberg is a ray of sunshine. She is so funny and really loves what she teaches and cares about her students doing well. She can get a little scatterbrained in lecture but I think it's due to her excitability over the topics. As long as you do your reading and pay attention in lecture, she grades lightly so it's an easy A!
Very funny and you can tell she loves what she is doing. Passionate about her job. As long as you read and show up you should do well.

Vandenberg is amazing. I was going through one of my busiest semesters ever when I had this class, and she was beyond understanding. We went over so many philosophers during this class, and I learned so much. I would definitely take her class again. Just be sure to actually do the readings. She's a very genuine and nice person. Funny too!

name_title: Stanley Lombardo Professor in the Humanities department at University of Kansas

ratings.comment: Great professor. You will learn so much from a class with Professor Lombardo.
If you at all want to take Greek, take him. He is really a nice guy. Super helpful and you will learn a lot.

I cannot stand lecture courses.  However, Prof. Lombardo made this one tolerable.  He is an excellent speaker.  If you want an "A" in this class, focus on the exams.  They're worth 75% of your final grade.  The exams are not easy.  They're all fill-in-the-blank and short answers.  If you don't read the books, you will fail the exams.  Good luck.

This guy is a genius, straight up. Learn to get on with him from the start, and you'll be fine. He expects good work from his honors classes, but less so from the non-honors. Take him if you're at all interested in latin or the classics.

A very interesting professor who knows something about everything. His lectures were, for the most part, very interesting and they are sometimes even humorous. As some have said before the tests are short and cover a wide range of material. But if you read what is assigned and have at least an average memory, they are fairly easy. Thumbs up!

name_title: David Leonard Professor in the Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Gives "partial credit" but takes off 2+ points for a small mistake. Will call on people randomly in lecture. Gives great examples in lecture, but skeleton notes are often out of order. Incredibly long and confusing homework but helpful if you have the time to do it(don't have a job or other classes). Overall his pros are about equal with his cons.

Dr.Leonard is one of the best to take this class with (461). He is very knowledgeable about what he teaches, gives great examples, lays out his expectations for exams/HW very clearly, is easy to reach with questions/concerns and is overall a very respectable caring guy. Understood this class with him much better than I did any of my O-chem classes.

Very caring, wants you to understand biochem and succeed. "Practice exams" match the actual exam almost perfect so it's very easy to ace exams. Only issue is he gets stingy if you don't do all the video notes and if your late to class, he will call you out which is more annoying than anything. Would defiantly recommend this guy.

Prof. Leonard was an overall good professor for biochemistry. His exams and homework were pretty fair, and I enjoyed taking his class. Only thing I would say is to make sure to listen and take good notes, as he mentions important topics in his lecture but doesn't write them in his fill in notes, so understanding the material can be tricky. Enjoyed!

Amazing professor for a hard class! Practice the homeworks until you master the concepts, it helps with exams so much. Try your best on practice tests because he is willing to talk you through difficult application concepts, and the real tests are very similar! Study a bit each night too and attend discussions and office hours. Awesome guy!

name_title: Marty Abramson Professor in the Educ ation department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: The exams were all based on the book, but we spent most of our class time talking about news articles he had us read. I do not feel like I learned much information from his lectures. It's an easy class to pass, but it felt like a waste of time. He uses cards w/ everyone's name on them to decide who has to talk next so always be prepared to talk.

Worst grad class experience in the whole program. Refuses to use Blackboard or GVSU email. Pulls cards w/ student names to force participation. Confusing lecture w/ notes all over the place. Impossible quizzes over 5-9 chapters in 1 week. Curves grades so heavily even if you fail you get a B-. You will pass but probably won't learn much.

Lets his classes decide when things are due and also lets the class decide when an amendment to a due date needs to be made. Unfortunately lecture is a part of the class you can't skip but he was entertaining enough to hold my attention through 3 weekends of classes. Fair grader with lots of feedback. Would definitely take him again!

Do NOT take this professor for this class. Majority of class is long-winded lectures. Notes are all over the place. Due dates change. Assignment descriptions are vague. Little to no class participation. Hard to get a hold of for extra help. Does not pick up on student frustration/confusion. Straight A student until I took this class.

He was my favorite professor all semester. He only assigned three quizzes all semester, including the Midterm and Final exams. There were only two big papers which were fairly easy, but time consuming. Regardless of what other students say, he is great to have as a professor, funny, and makes it worth your time to be in class.

name_title: Michael Scordilis Professor in the Engineering department at University of Miami

ratings.comment: Ok, I've had Scordi for several classes. If you're smart and work hard, you'll get an A, simple. However, in class, he's impatient, rude, and will not hesitate to implicitly call you stupid. If you're reading this Professor, consider the fact that some students don't know everything, and that's why they ask questions...

The class is difficult unless electrical eng is your thing. He is no pushover, but he will work with you if you show him you care. Doing the homework or at least trying is a must to getting a good grade on the test. Taking the class during COVID-19 was exceptionally difficult, but he really did his best and even held 4 extra review zoom sessions.

I think Scordilis is a GREAT professor, but I think his teaching is tailored to people more interested in circuits. Hes very quick, so I recommend reviewing your notes from the previous class before getting there; he likes to ask questions. Do the sample tests and KNOW how to do the homework, and you should be solid. He is the more difficult prof

From the very beginning of the course, Scordilis comes off as difficult. Your grade for the course is based entirely on Scordilis. He doesn't take time to know most of his students and you never know what you'll be doing next in class. Look out for when he's in a bad mood as he often projects onto his students and is very impatient. Pay attention.

Overall, you have to be an electrical engineer to be able to take him. He goes ultra fast on lectures and his test are really hard. If you can take another teacher take Kubat, Sung-Jim-KIm or Hamman. You are not going to learn with scordilis. He will literally ruin your GPA as a BME. 3 Test and a final. no quizzes

name_title: Mitchell Hall Professor in the History department at Central Michigan University

ratings.comment: If you're going to take any single history class in the department, take this one. I cannot stress that enough. Dr. Hall is so passionate about the topic and the lectures are very interesting-- you get musical interludes during class on a regular basis! There isn't any "busy work" for this class, and your grade rests on a few papers and the exams.

This class is amazing and Professor Hall's passion for rock n' roll makes it even more enjoyable.  His knowledge on the subject makes you want to learn even more.  Very kind and I recommend getting to know him, he's truly a wonderful person!

Going into this class, I was a little nervous after my grade on the first test, but I immediately went to Professor Hall and asked what I could do to form better study habits and pass the class.  He was so accommodating and truly wants to see his students succeed! Very kind and I appreciated his subtle humor.

Mitchell is AWESOME. He knows so much about the topics and he's so passionate about what he teaches. I am grateful I got the chance to have him as a professor. If you take the time to get to know him, he's such a cool guy. Just be ready to listen to lectures and study for exams (there are Quizlets out there!). 1000/10
Run. His class lowers my overall GPA. He is so picky about what you write in the essay on the exam, and his study guide was never helpful. The worst grading system I've ever experienced

name_title: Sufen Lai Professor in the English department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: She talked at you more than talking to the class, and did not give clear explanations during her lectures. There were no available lecture notes or presentations so you had to retain everything she said aloud and write down as much as possible in class. The readings were easy, and pop quizzes were easy if you read the section.

I really like this prof and I think she is overall a great person. But with that said, she seems to grade papers kind of harshly (did better on papers in WRT 150!) And just kind of talks at us during the class time as other people said. Overall good, her last semester here ig so I am glad I had her while she was here!:)

Class was ok. I wasn't particularly engaged in it. Most of the meeting time was her talking at us not with us. It felt very one sided. Also if you don't do the reading you will regret it. Not a tough grader. You get what you give into the class.

Professor Lai was very nice and isn't too hard of a grader. However, if you don't read the assigned readings you'll regret it - the quizzes are solely based on them. She will love you if you do read and participate in class discussion.  Do the extra credit, you won't regret it.

Professor Lai was a great instructor! She is really nice and had interesting stories to tell that connected with our class discussions. The books were all very good and worth reading. I enjoyed this class overall and would recommend her!

name_title: Thomas Herzog Professor in the Psychology department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: OMG the most boring class ever. If i didn't have a friend in this class there is no way staying awake would be possible. Reads the ppt word for word. 3 tests 25 Q A/B multiple choice. 50 Q cumulative final. Tests are harder than you think so STUDY! Also, 12 1 pg papers. Definitely do the extra credit and reading my not seem essential but it is!

Lectures can be pretty dry at times. Tests are pretty easy, but do the readings and study guides!! Each test has 25 questions with only two options, they're easy but only if you study. He offers a LOT of extra credit too. He's pretty easy going and has hilarious trivia questions and prizes. =)

His lectures were very unorganized. You will have better luck not coming to class ans just reading the book. He is good at holing your hand through the project though. And you get multiple chances to redo homework and papers.

Didn't actually teach and only taught to the two front rows and the people he knew already. Hard to hear but all he did was read the powerpoints that he gave us at the beginning of the year. Tests were on material we didn't cover and doesn't give study guides. I love psychology and the premise of this class but it was ruined by his ineptitude

This is the most boring class I have ever taken! He wrote the book himself, then his powerpoints go over it..and you never really learn anything new.  The tests can be tricky, since there are only A and B answers, and somtimes both seem to work.  Ok class, but I would switch to someone less boring!

name_title: Hari Bidasaria Professor in the Computer Science department at Central Michigan University

ratings.comment: I don't know how the university justifies the existence of this man on campus. He should NOT be teaching at all. God Bless anybody who mistakenly takes his class.
This guy has to be the worst professor in the history of mankind- no exagerration. He should not be teaching.

Worst class I have ever taken! I sat through the entire semester and couldn't understand one word. Don't even try to ask questions, you'll get more confused. He can't understand what you're asking, and you can't understand him ever. Just wait for the lab handout and expect to teach yourself. Easy labs, teach yourseld, but worthless professor.

Day to day, this professor will: Make a big deal about odd, trivial things, such as "showing your teeth" (smiling), taking notes on a laptop, etc. Also wastes a lot of time in class ridiculing students for not being able to answer a specific question on Test X or Lab Y. I wouldn't reccomend a class he teaches unless you already know the subject.

I can usually deal with most bad profs.  This guy accused me of cheating on the test.  Told me I failed, and then I attended 2 more weeks (sucking it up, thinking he just failed that test, and I will go on) then he says "you fail" as in the class WHAT, so after going to the dean, I get back in 4 weeks later only to get a D-. PATHETIC, killed my GPA

name_title: Leonard Kass Professor in the Science department at University of Maine

ratings.comment: Prof. Kass runs a challenging yet engaging class. Homework is extensive, but exams are heavily scaled. Staying on top of work is key. Unstuck ai helped me ace this course.

One of my favorite teachers of all time. The exams are incredibly tough, but he scales all exams by 30 points, and with all the other assignments the exams don't have a huge impact on your final grade. This class had an insane amount of homework, with some homework assignments being over 200 questions long.

Kass takes pride in the fact that his courses are rigorous and challenging.  I think he is an engaging lecturer and truly cared about students learning.  His course is intimidating but if you put in the work to do the bare minimum (turn your homework in on time and participate in case studies) you will get an A even if you don't do well on exams

Absolutely amazing professor. Leonard Kass is likely my favorite professor I've ever had. He makes the lectures engaging, entertaining, and interesting, he grades fairly, and is a fountain of knowledge.

Dr. Kass is not afraid to challenge you, which is fitting as BIO 208 is no easy course. Although the exams are difficult, Kass teaches the material in a way which makes it fun to learn and study the material. His enthusiasm and overall character has made this class one of my more memorable experiences at The University of Maine.

name_title: Kenny Laundra Professor in the Social Science department at Southern Utah University

ratings.comment: Horrible person, teacher and mentor.  Not sure where he based his ethics, but I got out of class after a black letter on an opinion paper that didn't agree with his homosexual and extreme environmental agendas.  Not personable to anyone who didn't think the way he did or allowed him to indoctrinate them.
Laundra rocks, he's very interested in students at SUU, He should be here a long time.

I only say he wasn't helpful because I couldn't find him.  He was willing to help, though.  He's a funny guy.  The only thing I didn't like was the F word he kept saying.  I know it was for a reason, but I was slightly offended.  However, he taught me a lot, and I would take a class from him again if I was majoring in Soc.
No Comments
No Comments

name_title: Vandana Pednekar-Magal Professor in the Communic ation department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Made an assignment due before the class semester even started.

Her announcements are always unclear or missing important details, so you never know what's due or when. She also takes off points for no clear reason, even after you've done all the work. It's really frustrating. Save yourself the trouble and pick a different professor.

My issue with this class is that the lectures were a bit all over the place. I did not enjoy them. But on the upside, just make sure you read the textbook and the Powerpoints that she makes. Once you take notes on those two things, and participate in her class, you should be completely fine.

I enjoyed her class. She is very nice and caring. Her class is not hard, just be sure to participate. The only thing that is a bit complex is her test - they are very structured and shes a tough grader. But overall the class was laid back with not a lot of assignments.

Dr. Magal is a great professor and cares about the her students, but she seems to not be very organized. She tends to forget when assignments are due (not the worst thing) and she also forgets how she described the assignments to students which can lead to a lot of lost points.

name_title: Georgeanna Tryban Professor in the Sociology department at Indiana St ate University

ratings.comment: Do NOT take her. She belittles students, and she thinks she is a god. Do not question her either or she will call you out and try to embarrass you. I should have taken the prior comments on this site about her in mind before I took her class.

Had this so-called professor for Sociology 101. This was in the fall of 2001. On the day of 911, she went off about how it was America's fault this happened. Some kid got up and started screaming at her and then left the room. She should be fired and her pension taken.
AWFUL. NEVER TAKE THIS TEACHER EVER! Her assignments are ridiculous. It seems that she thinks the only class students take is hers. The workload is ridiculous and she is VERY rude!

Not sure if this person can teach or not. Just uses an on-line resource for assignments and posts scores from assignments. A lot of money for a quiz and paper grader. Seems to have a short temper and thinks Phd. means she has been Beatified, A real loser to me.
horrible and extremely boring.

name_title: M atthea Cremers Professor in the Anthropology department at University of California Santa Barbara

ratings.comment: Very nice professor, You're grade is based on two assignments that are to prepare for your main assignment of the quarter which is a presentation of about 10-15 minutes about any topic of your choosing about gender and the environment. Somewhat unclear guidelines, but very easy and fun. Must go to class for attendance, but overall a good class.

Overall, terrible. Inconsistent and unclear grading, unhelpful, just plain mean. Comes across in lecture as kind, if lost, but do not bother going to office hours because that facade disappears when she isn't lecturing. Laughs at what she considers dumb questions, huffs, rolls eyes, all to hide the fact that she actually has no clue.

Sweet, technologically challenged professor. Lots of movies. Posts all material on gauchospace so don't buy book. Only reason to go to lecture is to get attendance points since you can easily review from home. Easy class that was also very interesting if you want to learn about how modern sexism has effected the anthropological sciences.
Really sweet and helpful lady, a lot of notes and attendance is mandatory but only 2 tests where questions are given beforehand. Do not need to buy textbook

This is probably one of the most boring classes I have ever taken in college. She is really nice and tries to make the material interesting, but it just doesn't work. There are identifications and essays for the midterm and final but she does give the questions for the essays out in advance.

name_title: Alan Fridlund Professor in the Psychology department at University of California Santa Barbara

ratings.comment: Hilarious and makes the material super interesting. Also is a practicing psychotherapist, so he talks about his own experiences with patients that have the disorders talked about in class. You are only graded on the midterm and final, but both are multiple choice and pretty straightforward. Definitely my favorite class I've taken at UCSB!

he is hilarious! attendance was consistent because he was just that amazing of a lecturer and as a person! i emailed him on a current study on something we were covering (so not mandatory ASAP email) and he responded within a couple hours, so super accessible!!! he was super nice and funny, very clear grading (midtermx2, final). get the textbook!

Professor Fridlund is one of the best professors I've had at UCSB. Though the class was hard, and I recommend taking him for upper divisions instead, his lectures, explanations, and ability to make students understand the groundwork of psychological processes, experiments, and theories are unparalleled.

he is hilarious and has a lot of experience relevant to the course that he shares to help solidify concepts. he posts slides before lectures. grade break down was midterm and final only. take this class if you're a psych major it is so interesting.

one of the best lecturers i've had and he's is a funny guy who cares a lot about this profession! go to his office hours to chat with him if you're interested in clinical psych. my tip is to do the study guide throughout the lecture and form study groups to solidify the material for your exams. an A is doable.

name_title: Charles Su Professor in the Engineering department at Illinois St ate University

ratings.comment: Dr. Su is very passionate about physics, although his lectures don't necessarily reflect the assignments that are graded. The lectures seem to be conceptual rather than mathematical; majority of the assignments rely on the mathematics of physics. His exams are really similar to the practice exams. Su is a fun professor and will answer questions.

Lectures are very hard to follow. He goes on tangents that are seemingly unrelated to course material frequently. Assumes you know a lot more than you actually do. Poorly explains ideas so often that I have to look up the idea after class to actually know anything about the material. He's very kind & understanding, but just can not teach physics.
Wonderful professor!

Charles was a fantastic professor. His lectures were always interesting and he always made sure that everyone was accommodated. His tests were pretty difficult, especially the final, but he drops one and the final is curved.
Likes to go on rabbit trails during class but it makes it more fun. Grades very mercifully on tests.

name_title: Dan Holland Professor in the Engineering department at Illinois St ate University

ratings.comment: I had no idea what was happening almost the entire class. The equations given in the notes would not lead me anywhere for exams and homework making the cheat sheet nearly useless. Exams were almost entirely a guessing game. He never responded to my emails about office hours. He makes up for it with the curve though. I got lucky with my grade.

Dr. Holland is very kind and understanding, physics is difficult and he undertands that. I honestly could've done better in this course but thats on me I just had other classes to focus on. If you ever need help go see him, his tests are very straightforward and if you study you definetly won't fail.

Dr. Holland is a very smart professor and clearly knows his stuff. However, he sometimes does not convey that knowledge quite clearly back to his students in lecture. Very lecture heavy and lectures can be confusing. Overall, pair this class with some Youtube videos or Khan Academy and you should do just fine. Btw, Mason is the best for lab

Dan Holland was alright. He covered everything he needed for the class, his lectures are specific but boring and too cluttered. The tests are essentially similar to the homework which is given out online with the answers on them (at least for PHY105) which helped out with the addition of bringing a 1 page cheat sheet to the tests. Could be better.

This guy does not know how to teach a STEM class. He's very nice guy and means well, but he does not go through examples carefully and goes through slides too fast. But the labs are extremely easy and short, and often gives out extra credit and grade boosters. Really great guy, loves physics but not a great teacher. Lost of multiple-choice tests.

name_title: Andrew Peck Professor in the Psychology department at Penn St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor Peck is known for his engaging lectures, clear expectations, and genuine care for his students. The class has a manageable workload, with helpful study materials and opportunities for extra credit. Overall, a great choice for a general education requirement.
It would be better to find another professor for a psychology course.

Dr. Peck is a great lecturer. He is flexible with deadlines for papers and wants you to have the best experience possible. He posts slides and study guides, and exams are purposely built to avoid being tricky. I took the class as a gen ed and I cannot recommend him enough.

Professor Peck was great. Every lecture of his was interesting and fun, even as someone taking the class just to get a gen ed out of the way. Tests might give you some trouble if you don't skim the textbook, but the study guides are comprehensive enough to point you to the important parts of the book. He also let you attend the class via Zoom.

Peck is the sweetest professor you'd come across. 
He's an amazing professor that makes a difficult course the easiest thing in the world

name_title: Bill Syrett Professor in the Meteorology department at Penn St ate University

ratings.comment: This is not an easy online class to take. If you want to actually get a good grade, you need to work for it and read a lot. The labs are extremely hard and weighted so much of your grade. He is very hard with grading. Most of the quizzes are on quizlet but are weighed less than the labs. I would not take this class as a easy online class.

This class was online, but it was set up very well. It wasn't hard if you are curious about the material, maybe 2-3 hours per week of enjoyable (imo) content. Very laid-back and a nice break from other, more intense, classes. Bill held office hours frequently, and responded to questions on a discussion post every week. Great online experience!

The class was asynchronous, therefore, I did not get to know Professor Syrett. However, he had office hours and was easily accessible if you needed help. You learn everything through readings and watching short videos. Every week, there is a quiz and short lab (application questions). You have to teach yourself a lot, but the class was not too bad.

Meteo 3 is a pretty good course and is taught by a good professor. Most of the info is teach yourself material but Prof Syrett is always accessible by email. The course is pretty simple, just weekly labs and quizzes.

There are pop quizzes weekly & the labs will take a lot of your time. Bill is an incredible guy, so incredible that you'll forget about how hard the class is. I managed to get an A but I definitely worked for it. If you talk to him he is very willing to help & he gives an enormous amount of extra credit (about 200 points worth) This class was great

name_title: David Babb Professor in the Earth Science department at Penn St ate University

ratings.comment: I've taken two METEO classes at PSU. The other with a different prof I got an A in, and with this one I got a C. Prof Babb is as unhelpful as the convoluted material he presents, all of which does very little to prepare you for the assignments. If you need help, he just vaguely refers you back to the material. Not just difficult, but unfair.

Professor Babb is great. He really tries to help you succeed in this course. He would answer any question. The materials are challenging but explain things well. Homework won't be that hard as long as you read materials carefully and take good notes. However, DON'T take it for General Education UNLESS you're extremely passionate about the weather.
Dr. Babb is a great teacher, but the material can be difficult at times, and his grading is a little tough.

Expected this to be an easy 100 course considering I have a basic background in meteorology from high school but man was I wrong. Worked really really hard spending countless of hours just to get an 80% overall.

This class was online so I never actually met the professor, but he was not very helpful. You were kind of on your own and the class was extremely hard for an online 100 level class. If you're thinking about taking this class for a gen ed, definitely do NOT.

name_title: Nancy Love Professor in the Political Science department at Penn St ate University

ratings.comment: She is very sweet and a good professor. She posts all the readings, so no need to buy the textbook. Lots of reading, but interesting material. The tests are all essays, and while she is a tough grader gives clear feedback and has clear requirements. She is understanding, takes improvement through the semester into consideration for your grade.
I took her grad class at Penn State. I am a prof now, and never forgot what I learned from her--both in course substance and in being a passionate educator. You will work and you will learn.

The lectures are so worth while, Professor Love is straight forward and always very clear. Some of the readings weren't my cup of tea, but that's what happens with ideology.  I wish we would have spent more time on the "other" ideologies. Only bad thing: her TA is inept at teaching. The Friday sections- useless. I wish we had another lecture instea

Her lectures are straightforward but allows students to ask questions Readings are important and so is section The essays exams are not super easy but not hard either, gotta make sure you provide the relevent info (regarding the question) and that it is adequate to support your position (undefined number of paragraphs) overall good class

Definitely a worthwhile class to take and Professor Love is very knowledgable.  If you're looking for a simple gen-ed, take this.  It is not hard by any means and there are only 2 exams and a final, all essays.  After the first exam, i didn't read at all - just went to class and took clear notes. Love is very smart though.

name_title: F.J.Vaccaro Professor in the Psychology department at Hofstra University

ratings.comment: Vaccaro's class is no walk in the park, but with the right prep, you can make it through. Definitely use Unstuckstudy alongside your notes and textbook - it really helped me stay on top of the challenging exams.
Class time is interesting, he's a great teacher, knowledgeable, and a very fair grader. Out of all the courses I've ever taken, he's one of my favorite professors for sure.

He is hilarious and definitely is not difficult at all.  If you want an easy A take him.  He literally tells you exactly what information to study for that specific test, so its up to you to study.  Take good notes because it is alot of information. If you go up to him during test he will hint the answer.

Basically tests you on specific little things he says in class; syllabus is not clear at all and does not correspond with the textbook. The tests and quizzes are SO hard, despite the fact that he tells you what each question is about. Be prepared to study a lot

Office hours are non-existent. He asks questions weirdly and vaguely.However, he tells you all the questions that are going to be on the test. If you show up to class, take good notes, and study what he specifically says, you are fine. I didn't read the book& got an  A.If you have a problem during a test, ask him and he'll help you with the answer.

name_title: Gary Grudnitski Professor in the Accounting department at San Diego St ate University

ratings.comment: He tries to make things as easy/clear as possible. There are PE points for going to class, but he drops 2 lowest. Drops lowest hw. Drops 2 lowest quiz scores (which are DIFFICULT!) All you need to do is STUDY the old quizzes & group exercises and getting a B shouldn't be that difficult. There is a generous curve. This class wasn't too bad.

Gary is a very clear, organized, and helpful guy. Accounting, to begin with, is a difficult subject. I think he did a pretty good job in being clear. What I didn't like was the small sections because the T.A.s are absolutely useless and my specific T.A. was disrespectful would bluntly tell me he could not help.

Big lecture, boring, not clear and he is not helpful at all. TA's don't do a very good job at explaining either. TESTS AND QUIZZES harrrdddd! Passed the class getting 78% 37% and 42% on midterms and the final. Do all the homework, it helps your grade! GOODLUCK!

Worst professor hands down I have has at SDSU. Does not care at all about his students and is not helpful at all if you ask questions. TA's are pretty useless too. Didn't learn anything in this class. Failed every test and still passed the class...... AVOID THIS PROFESSOR
Quizzes are impossible and the tests are hard too. Lecture is boring and somehow  I got a B. Good luck.

name_title: Charles Burnap Professor in the M athem atics department at University of North Carolina at Charlotte

ratings.comment: Dr. Burnap is a great professor who cares about his students. He explains well and is understanding, but modern algebra is the hardest math class I have taken aside from Topology. The best way to be successful in this class is do all hw assignments, all the extra problems, don't use Chegg, and go to his office hours. Don't skip class ever.

He is a good professor, but his tests are weighed way too much. 4 midterms 50% of your grade plus a final worth 30%. The hw doesn't help you much. He has a study guide quite similar to the tests, but still, they can be challenging (at least for me). If you struggle in the class, go to the math learning center, they are amazing!

I recommend Brittany Love for calc and stat, she is more passive aggressive but overall explains things more. Burnap is kind but gets flustered easily, doesn't answer questions or emails. 4 exams, each 25% of your grade, homework is required but not graded. Feedback could be better. Overall not bad but don't take early morning! *you will sleep*

Professor Burnap is amazing! I'm not a math person, but he made this course extremely easy to understand. Although he uploads all the lectures online, nothing beats in-person lectures. He assigns practice problems that aren't graded, but they help dramatically in forming a comprehensive understanding of the material. I would 100% take him again!

Nice professor with good intentions but he just completes example problems in class, not very much explanation of processes. Lots of homework quizzes throughout. Only 4 exams and 1 final. Exams are usually only 10 questions. If you dont catch on to math quickly he might not be the professor for you

name_title: Steven Elliot Professor in the Business department at Miami University

ratings.comment: Dr. Elliot is, without a doubt, one of the worst professors I have ever had. Not only did he not clarify the material he went over, he would not even permit you to have the notes if you missed a day. Prepare yourself for very difficult tests in which their difficulty is only exacerbated by his misspelling of words, answers and questions alike.

I went to every single lecture and still ended up with a C. Your grade is primarily based on the exams, there is no opportunity for extra credit, the homework is easy but doesn't help to review for the exams. He gives you a study guide for the exam, but even when I studied it like crazy, it did not help for the exam.

This class is difficult. Elliot is an OK professor, but not a good teacher. He is sometimes funny, but his lectures and material are difficult. SI sessions are a waste of time, do not prepare you for exams, and aren't helpful. All exams are online and proctored outside of class. The homework isn't too bad. The exams are very difficult.

Elliot is not nice and his exams do not reflect what we learned in class. The exams reflect basically our entire grade and there are no chances for extra credit. Take this class with a different professor if possible. if you do not attend class, even if you tell him, he will not share the notes or help you out in any way.

He was an amazing prof for my first even econ class. His lectures didn't seem like lectures or that he was just restating the textbooks, he made them enjoyable to listen to and made the class go by fast. While attendance wasn't mandatory, think that is because that's the only place you get the notes- he doesn't post them or even use powerpoints.

name_title: Susan Grogan Professor in the Law department at St. Mary's College of Maryland

ratings.comment: The class was held on Zoom this semester. Tests were open book/note and self-graded. Not a very engaging class, but be prepared with a news story for each class. Professor seemed friendly enough and understanding. The readings are essentially optional, everything important is discussed in class. Strange grading system (a 7 page paper worth 5 pts?).
Caring, knows her stuff, but def doesn't wanna be teaching 101. Higher up maybe she wont be so monotone.

Class is ok no power points and the topics are not really anything you will need to know or won't have learned in another class she does have experience and can give you some useful insights although she rarely ordains to do so she is pretty well-organized tests are easy if you studied and most are a self-graded

Great professor. If you go in interested in political science, you will be even more interested after you leave. While professors often make classes harder than they really need to be, Dr. Grogan makes the difficulty appropriate for an Intro class. Expect to write more, but she isn't a harsh grader.
Tests are a joke. Most of them are self graded. Make sure you keep up on the little assignments and youll be fine.

name_title: Randolph Daniel Professor in the Anthropology department at East Carolina University

ratings.comment: Dr. Daniel is very nice but his class is quite difficult. In this class in particular, he gave no homework, which is not the greatest. He gives about 5 quizzes throughout the semester and gives 10 minutes for 10 questions, which is not enough time for me and I was constantly getting 60s and 70s on them, which is why having no homework is tough.

Dr. Daniel is an overall good guy. But, a horrible professor. He doesn't give out study guides.Whatever he says will be on the test is never on the test. He's really rude when giving any type of feedback. He gives out 2 essays and, 3 tests and, he grades ridiculously hard on them. If you don't say it in the way he wants.. YOU will fail.
Horrible prof I don't even understand his lessons he is such a bot and an L mans
Either make study guides for your tests or make them easier. It's not fun
I got the feeling he didn't like me and he was kinda rude to me. Only cares about the grad students and tests are hard!

name_title: John Jones Professor in the M athem atics department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: He is the sweetest man in the world. The lectures may not be super informative, but he is always there to help if needed. The only things graded are weekly quizzes, but everything is open-note and any additional homework completed is extra credit. He was sick for the last few weeks of the year but still tried so hard to be involved. I love him!

This class was too easy. Didnt study once or do homework as its open note, on final and on quizzes. Its really hard to hear him and sometimes he doesnt answer questions correctly but a really nice guy and funny. This dude needs to buy a yacht and retire instead of being stuck in a classroom.

Professor Jones makes this class a breeze with open-note quizzes and plenty of extra credit opportunities. The lectures are straightforward, and unstuckstudy ai is a great study tool alongside the free textbook.
he is by far the best professor I've ever had, gives extra credit every week, easy quizzes, and an easy final, everything is open-note

John Jones is a very sweet old man. we used a text book sometimes but it was online for free. His teaching is not the best and class is just him doing problems on the board for us to copy down as notes but over all the class was easy. There are lots of extra credit opportunities and no homework. Definitely take him if you have the chance!!

name_title: James Riemer Professor in the English department at Marshall University

ratings.comment: I took this class online. It's not super hard and the readings he has us do are very interesting. I also really liked the sci fi series we watched at the end. I will say the 2 tests we had were very hard and he can grade very harshly and they're worth 100 points when the normal discussion board is worth 5. Very. Easy to reach out too.

There was way too much work assigned. If you want to read half a book in 4 days and write 450 words on it for maybe only 5 points go for it. There was almost always at least 2 discussion boards due every Monday and Thursday -4 a week- and sometimes 3 per date. You still had to do the same amount of work for less points which is very frustrating.

I cannot stress this enough, do not take this professor. He gives out multiple reading assignments per week that you have to write about, then respond to 2 people. He grades the literary analysis' so hard that I think it's impossible to get an A on them. He also doesn't actually explain what you did wrong on them or how to fix it for the future.

Gives negative feedback without giving suggestions, and sometimes makes three discussion posts due in one day. (300-400 words) He also grades like we are taking a 400-level English course. Don't take this class

This class was honestly a living nightmare. While I will say I learned quite a lot from the class, I don't think it was worth it for all the time I had to put into it. The amount of work expected has been ridiculous. Please don't take him for your own sanity. I had so many stress breakdowns this semester over it, I regret ever signing up for it.

name_title: Marcia Harrison Professor in the Biology department at Marshall University

ratings.comment: Dr. Harrison is really into lab, and not so much into lecture. Her lectures are kind of all over the place, so it becomes really easy to zone out. She is never really clear on what she wants you to do, although she does offer plenty of review questions for exams. Her exams are essay-heavy, and her lab is writing intensive.
very good

She really is a nice professor. However, being nice doesn't make you a good instructor.She truly knows her stuff, but she cannot convey it. Thus far, she is the worst professor I have had. She is all over the place during lectures, and it is impossible to keep up with her bouncing around. I pray the lab will save my sinking grade.

She's a super sweet lady and she really knows a lot about plants and Biology. However, the tests are almost impossible, even if you attend every lecture. She gives in-class clicker questions everyday for participation points and doesn't answer questions clearly. I wouldn't recommend taking this class, if you already find Biology to be confusing.
The tests are nightmarish and sometimes even a bit frightening and have questions from who-knows-where. Lectures are boring. Lab isn't too bad but the lab reports are horrible.

name_title: Marianne Foley Professor in the Psychology department at Skidmore College

ratings.comment: I found her teaching to be terribly unhelpful and confusing. She was not good at conveying the main points of the class and she seemed to rely on being vague. Her tests were ridiculous and she took points off on tests for not expanding enough even if you answered the question properly. I thought she was an awful teacher.

Marianne is fantastic. She really cares about her students and her subject. Besides learning about psychology, this class taught me more about WRITING than any English class ever did. This semester I've been getting A's on essays and I know it was because of Experimental Psych.
Mary Ann is an amazing prof and a wonderful person. very helpful and supportive, even years after graduating. she expects hard work, but it extremely fair.

She expects a lot! Take good notes, or else essay finals will be too difficult. But she's always willing to help you, and it's obvious that she cares about you. The class always had a great feel, and when she gets her ideas across, they are inspiring.

She's such a sweet person. Very warm and inviting; she had us all over for dinner! I wouldn't say she's a tough grader, but she's certainly no Space Cadet. She cares enough to write great insightful comments on your work. She's totally willing to give you a second chance if you prove you deserve it. Overall, this has been a VERY positive experience

name_title: Debbie Hall Professor in the Fine Arts department at Skidmore College

ratings.comment: lovely person and great professor! learned a lot in this class. very helpful in improving my design skills.

Deb is very knowledgeable about her subject matter and tries to cover a lot of information, but if you want to learn to communicate visually this is the class. I didn't know much about the programs when I started, but feel confident now.
Deb is not only very well versed in Adobe programs and current design trends but funny and helpful if you just ask. She is not intimidating at all and makes a lot of jokes.

Deb's teaching style made me lose all interest in graphic design. I found her condescending and rude. Instruction was very unclear making even the most simple tasks difficult to understand. Unfortunately, she's the only professor on the subject.

Deb is an incredible person and teacher. She really cares about her students and that is so evident in her teaching style. There is a lot of work, but when deadlines are approaching Deb comes in at night on her own time to walk around and help students for hours

name_title: Sheldon Solomon Professor in the Psychology department at Skidmore College

ratings.comment: I wish we were tested/quizzed in less generic manners than we are, but other than that he's far more decent than most of Skidmore. The main selling point for me is his attendance policy and his hands off approach. Arguably both of those are reasons to take his class to fulfill any requirement.

I like Sheldon but the reason he seems so great is because compared to other Skidmore faculty he is. The bar at Skidmore is so very low that even a halfway humorous or autonomy respecting professor (Sheldon) is wonderful & out of the ordinary. Luckily he is one of the better profs, but we need more. Tuition is far too costly to put up subpar profs

I can't say that this test writing skills are great (they're not) but I can say that he isn't ableist the way a lot of Skidmore faculty is. If you miss a class, are late, or need any accomodations he is extremely forgiving and has no attendance policy which is very helpful for students who need the extra breathing room and not be stressed 24/7

Grade is only based on a few tests. Each test is 50 multiple choice questions that are on incredibly niche topics discussed in the large lectures that attendance is not required for. Need to put in the effort even though you can slide by given lack of assignments or mandatory attendance. Sheldon is funny, caring, entertaining, and knowledgeable.

I have to agree that Sheldon's attendance policy is great and is very much up-to-par with today's society. Sadly, Skidmore is full of controlling and ableist profs (who try to hide this reality under the guise of calling it "strict"). They are more than happy to deduct points from your grade if you're late to class or miss a class. SHELDON WON'T!

name_title: Sonia Dalmia Professor in the Economics department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor Dalmia is a great econ professor who really knows her stuff. You will learn a lot in her class that proves valuable, not only in school but life as well. Professor Dalmia does her best to challenge her students and really push them to their limits. That being said, she is very reasonable and understanding if you approach her for help.

She has a fairly strong accent and has extremely high expectations. Failed the first exam but bounced back with a tutor. She is a tough grader when it comes to homework. Got pretty miserable but I pushed through. She usually teaches more advanced classes and is the head of the Economics Department. Wants you to succeed though!

Professor Dalmia is brilliant and hard working. She has high expectations of students. If you want to be challenged by a professor to do your best work she will do it. She is willing to give plenty of help along the way. Don't look to her for an easy A.

Professor Dalmia is by far one of the best ECO profs at GV. She doesn't give out grades and really makes her students work for it but you learn the material. Has an inspirational story if you can get her to share about it. Really cares about her students & wants them to be successful. See her in office hours, very helpful & will work w/ you. 10/10

Sonia is such a wonderful and inspiring professor to take. Work hard on your assignments, ask for feedback in her office, and you will be fine. She grades very hard but an A is very very possible. She challenges you but that is how you learn! I wish I could take more classes with her. Exams are tough, so be ready to be asked about anything

name_title: James Lu Professor in the English department at California Baptist University

ratings.comment:
James is my dad, who retired in 2023. I'll take the liberty of giving him his final rating here, this time perhaps as a professor of life in teaching me what he's known as a father and grandfather to my kids.

10/10.

I enjoyed it, class! He is such a sweet and kind professor. He is very understanding as well. There are only 3 essays, two of them being descriptive, and argument essays. For all the essays they are only 2-3 pages and you pick the topic for all of them. He is not a hard grader at all! If I passed you can because I hate English and got a good grade

Dr. Lu is super chill and I couldnt recommend him more! Theres obviously a lot of writing and some presentations but theyre not hard at all. He can be a little quiet especially since we have to wear masks but its not at all bothersome. The class is small so youll definitely be getting to know your classmates. Definitely take Dr. Lu!

Super caring and understanding professor. Show up, do the work and try and he gives you credit. Your classmates can make or break the class since many of the assignments and lectures are based on participation.

Dr. Lu is one of the most kind and caring professors I have ever had. His class is quite easy, yet you will learn so much about how to improve your writing and finding your own style. He is very soft spoken and humble, but very respected by his students and faculty alike. I would highly recommend taking his class if you get the chance to!

name_title: Noel Cazenave Professor in the Social Science department at University of Connecticut

ratings.comment: Please listen to me when I say do NOT take this professor, you're truly just going to be setting yourself up for failure. He's very opinionated, will yell at you for the most dumbest reasons ever. His exams seem like they'd be super easy but they are not and don't even think about doing the paper project for him unless you want to feel worthless.

This professor was absolutely awful. He tended to go on many rants throughout the lectures and would often get very angry at students its they weren't paying attention which I did understand. When we had a perp that was 1/3rd of our grade he didn't give a cleat answer causing a lot of the students to fail the paper, swell as his comments were rude

BEWARE. Never take any course with this professor. Your grade will be primarily based 50/50 on two exams. He doesn't upload much of the content online. He can be rude and will call you out in class if you seem slightly disinterested. No phones allowed. Computers allowed only by request. Very strict. Does not want you to succeed.
Super cool transparent guy, no phones or computers allowed in lecture typically. Engaging and makes you think.

Dr. Cazenave has changed who i am for the better. He is very intelligent, and the content is imperative to function in the world. Though he is a tough grader, he is very communicative about the things he is grading you on, emphasizing important points during lectures. If you attend class and do the reading, you will gain so much from him.

name_title: Steve Schlicker Professor in the M athem atics department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor Schlicker's class has a unique grading system, but can be challenging if you're not strong in math. Attend lectures, use the textbook, and try unstuck study alongside other study aids to succeed. Overall, a rewarding experience with a caring professor.

Absolutely amazing mathematician and inspirational teacher! If you don't plan to study math, he may not be for you, but as a math student I benefited greatly from his approach to the subject and his desire to inspire.
