Professor Schlicker was a great teacher. I had him for Math 124. You have no tests or quizzes. You do a reflection and resubmission for every assignment and Schliker gives feedback. Your final grade is based on a final portfolio you do and you get to choose what grade you think you deserve. He is very caring and wants to make sure everyone learns.
Just drop out if you have to take Trig with professor Schlicker.

Great professor. Teaches effectively and is always available to to give help and feedback often. No tests/exams, final grade depended on your portfolio where you prove what you learned. Workload wasn't TOO heavy, but you definitely have to do the work. Short activities due at the start of nearly every class, a few full assignments and reflections.

name_title: Angie Vanarnam Professor in the Educ ation department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor Angie is a phenomenal professor. She is kind, caring, and compassionate; going above and beyond to ensure her students are on track to achieve the utmost success. I would highly recommend taking her as a professor, you will not regret!

Angie is an incredibly competent professor--one of the best I have ever had. She takes extreme care in crafting a curriculum that allows the student freedom to explore their own interests while maintaining academic rigor. This course is great for any discipline, and I am so grateful I had the chance to grow and receive her feedback.

Had her for the online course. Was AMAZED at how Prof VanArnam was so available, including Thanksgiving weekend!  Gives excellent feedback / critique on your writing. Does pay attention to online interactions, so be engaged if in her online class.  Highly recommended, esp if you want to level up your writing game!  She's a favorite of mine  :)
Highly recommend this prof. Her class is worth the work, and now I can put thoughts on paper and sound professional. She will inspire you.
Amazing prof. I can't say enough how much I learned! Take her class. You'll work hard but you will not regret it!  She's the best GV has hands down.

name_title: Fran Kelleher Professor in the History department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I took the online class. This class was interesting and fairly easy. The online quizzes are pretty easy and the discussion questions were not bad either. There was a project that required a decent amount of research and time but other than that its an easy A or B. Lots of points which is always helpful.
I had her for an online class. She always responded to emails quickly, and offered a lot of help and advice. Good prof!
Very helpful and willing to be flexable.

Dr. Kelleher is excellent. She knows what she is talking about and knows how to teach and what topics on which to focus. Very helpful. Grades papers easily, no in-class exams, just papers. Presentation near the end of the semester. Quizzes are online and EASY. Great prof. take her if you can.

Very good prof. Take her if you can. She makes requirements clear and shes always willing to help if you need it. Quizzes are online and easy. Midterm was easy if you pay attention in class. Very good at teaching, highly recommended.

name_title: Shirley Fleischmann Professor in the Engineering department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I had Dr. Fleischmann for lab, and she was a caring professor. She would often grade the lab reports pretty harshly, but she left ample notes for improvement (just don't leave lab reports to the night before every time). Her lectures before the lab would sometimes be a bit longer than needed, but she explained concepts well.

Dr. F is extremely caring, and is willing to accommodate time to help you outside of class. Do the homework and you'll do fine. Sometimes she goes too fast in lectures, making them hard to follow. Some of her labs need work, they often lack direction, can be confusing and excessive in comparison to class material. Put in the work and you will pass

Dr. F is a hard grader. If you show up, do the work, and do the extra credit you should be fine. No one is worse than me at math and I still got an A in the class based off of the work and effort I put into the non-math assignments. Its A LOT of work but great extra credit opportunities that help a lot.
The homework level is excessive. Lectures are insanely confusing and fast paced. Avoid at all costs.
Crazy amount of homework for an elective. Bad teaching method and grading system.

name_title: Georgia Holmes Professor in the Law department at Minnesota St ate University, Mank ato

ratings.comment: One of the better professors I have had.
I liked her. If you do the work and study the material, she is very fair.

Honestly, so much of the assignments were busy work it was frustrating. Much of the quizzes on d2l you can find on google, and the assignments on Cengage felt very repetitive. I really felt like I learned to forget in this class.

Took BLAW 200 online. There is weekly assignments (like 5) and a weekly quiz. Almost everything on the quiz is from the lecture notes she posts or from the assignments, so if you do them, it's quite simple. I've emailed her questions and she usually takes 1-2 days to respond.
Lots of busy work but it's easy.  Weekly assignments/quiz's.  She wasn't very clear on some assignments.  Overall, very easy class.  Easy A.

name_title: Shirley Bell Professor in the Communic ation department at Eastern Illinois University

ratings.comment: ABSOLUTELY LOVE HER! Being a comm. major I make sure to take any class she teaches. Her tests are hard, make sure to actually read the book. Also, if you do bad on a test, be sure to meet her in office hours. She helps a lot.

Dr. Bell is wonderful teacher. She is completely knowledgeable and is willing to help her students in anyway she can. She's very dedicated to her student's success. Tests can be difficult, but if you pay attention in class, participate, and ask questions, you will do fine.

Ok Bell is an extremely hard teacher but she is the most passionate teacher I have seen thus far.  She knows her subject extremely well.  Her tests are extremely hard but if you study and go to her review sessions, you'll be fine.  And if you have any questions, she is always willing to answer them.  If you are interpersonal major, take her.

She is a hard teacher. DO NOT TAKE! her test are soo hard. Its like she tries to trick you. She tells the same stories and examples over and over again. And she get offended if u dont call her Dr. Bell (no one cares). Notes are given oraly and 1/2 exam questions are he opipion. GET OUT IF YOU CAN!

Test are ridiculously jam packed with material, and study guides are in the format of paragraphs and are always front and back. She is passionate about her study, but is unreasonable with students. I wouldn't recommend taking her.

name_title: Doug Woods Professor in the Physical Ed department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor Woods is an outstanding professor. He is so passionate about athletic training and it shows in his lectures. He makes the class very easy so its really easy to get an A in the class. If you have the chance, please take him.

Doug Woods is one of the best professors i've had at GVSU. He is a very nice guy and he is clear on his expectations. There are 3 "quizzes" which are basically exams and if you study the study guide he provides there is no reason you shouldn't get an A. Also there are 3 abstracts which are also very straightforward.  Take him if you can!
He is very helpful, understanding and also a nice guy.... i have always been able to ask him things and never be scared he will make me feel stupid. Great teacher

TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU WANT/NEED AN "A"!  Plus, you'll enjoy it! Bonus: You might learn something in the "half-hour" class time each class consists of!!! Yep, only a half-hour!  Doesn't get better than this!
Nicest guy you could ever have...take this class...fun

name_title: Yuk JLeung Professor in the M athem atics department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Absolute shit professor but a man who truly loves his dog. Had him as a substitute prof for calc last year and he spent half of the 90-minute lecture "introducing himself" except it was just pictures of his dog. Know zero about Navier-Stokes equations but at least I could give a detailed recount of the first time Bailey dug a hole in Hyde Park.

The tests are extremely hard. Many definitions to memorize, but only got about five main problems in the exams. Correspondingly, you will loss lot of points if you forgot or mess up one idea. Hard to get good grades.
3 exams worth 80% of your grade, and all the exams are extremely hard. His lectures are interesting but they are very hard to understand.
The professor is nice, but his tests are really hard and you hardly get extra credit. You have to remember a lot of definition and theorems, but this cannot assure you a good grade.

You can tell Professor Leung has a lot of fun lecturing because hes always making jokes. His lectures are pretty good and the material isnt impossibly difficult. His exams are just like the homework and hes pretty good at explaining concepts. He holds solid review sessions for exams which is uncommon for higher level math classes.

name_title: Harvey Nikkel Professor in the Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I'm not sure why Nikkel is getting so many bad ratings here. He's super kind and it's clear he knows his stuff very well. Yes, the exams are tough, but that is to be expected. He provides so many resources to help study: learning objectives, practice exams, worksheets, etc. He even allows test corrections. I would recommend him for sure.

Worst Professor at GVSU! I did well in all my prior science classes and spent a lot of time studying in this class and still failed every exam. Lectures and notes are not helpful. Take this class with another professor, or be prepared to teach everything yourslef.

Professor Nikkel is so nice and smart. But when it comes to teaching the information you need to learn for this class at a lower level, he isn't the best at it. He is available for office hours, has an altered grading scale and allows for bonus points after exams, which helps. But you need to put in a lot of work in order to pass this class.

I really don't mind Harvey as a professor. This is a hard class and I think it would be just as hard with any other prof. He allows you to do test correction for bonus points which is nice. The only annoying this is the class average was always SOOO low and he would never curve exams

Nikkel was awful. I worked so hard in his class, studied over 15 hours for each exam and still got 60% or below. His class averages are horrible because he's not good at lecturing. His OWL homework are ridiculous and a waste of time. I've done well in all my other chemistry classes except for his. Take another professor if you can.

name_title: Peter Castro Professor in the Anthropology department at Syracuse University

ratings.comment: MAX132 is a great course and Castro and his team of other professors do a great job with lectures and discussion sections. While this course can be a lot of work in terms of reading, it is really interesting and if you pay attention and do your work you should have no problem getting a good grade. Very interesting topic.
Great professor, exams are open note. Just go to lectures and take notes and pay attention in recitation and you will pass with flying colors
Failing this class is like having a multiple choice test with one answer on it and bubbling somewhere outside the answer box.

Professor Castro is an amazing teacher. He truly cares about everyone of his students. He tends to try throw in a joke or two during lectures. The only homework for lecture is to read the assigned readings which make up the exams. This has been one of my favorite classes solely because of professor Castro!

I graduated from cuse a few years ago and Prof Castro was an incredible professor and person in general. He genuinely cares about his students, their success and wellbeing. I took a few of his classes during my tenure at Cuse and his classes pushed my critical thinking, analysis and communication skills which have made me successful in my career.

name_title: Marinus Debruine Professor in the Accounting department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Easy class if you put the time in. Rambles in his videos but if you just skip the rambling and focus on the example questions you'll be good plus he aways makes himself available outside of class for meetings.

He is a very caring and responsive professor. He is very available outside of class and responds very quickly. His teaching style was not my favorite and his outlines had a lot of filler information. The class is very test heavy and the tests are difficult but doable but curved, but he wouldn't tell the right answer unless you had it right.

This is an incredibly difficult class no matter who teaches it, but Marinus does his best to teach extremely dry and complicated material. He really wanted you to succeed and did everything he could to help. Exams are hard, but fair in comparison of what you go over. Lectures, grading, and communication were clear and concise. Would take again.

Prof Debruine makes himself very accessible to students, with plenty of opportunities for tutoring sessions and extra credit. He also curves exams pretty heavily . Ask for help, stay engaged, and he will make sure you pass. I feel he just gets a bad rep because the material is difficult. Be prepared to put a lot of time and effort into this class!

The only reason this prof isn't getting a 1 is I somehow got an A in this course. Lectures were confusing, I was genuinely angry for attending class every time but you have to because he teaches differently than textbook. However, he does provide a TON of extra credit because most people don't pass the exams. PLEASE take someone else if you can.

name_title: Chris Miller Professor in the Communic ation department at California St ate University - Sacramento

ratings.comment: Interesting class, loved the content and some of the activities and assignments. However, her lectures were useless and didn't help with preparation for tests. She was often unhelpful when asked for assistance and would seem like she was talking down to you. Her grading was also quite harsh and there was little wiggle room after being graded.

If you guys are expecting a class that sounds easy, take another class. This is my only C in my entire college career. She is not helpful, her lectures are useless, and her tests are difficult. 50% of the grade is made up of one project which is very time consuming. Avoid at all costs.

what could have been a really cool class was turned into one of the hardest classes of this semester for me. she is so unbelievably vague with her guidelines, you basically do every assignment with your fingers crossed. Do the portfolio early, its hard. study, even tho the tests are open book.

Dr. Miller is amazing! If you pay attention, show interest, and do your work, she will reward. The class is challenging  but she is *VERY* helpful if you take the time to ask her. She is knowledgeable and passionate about her field. She has a very cute daughter that comes to class sometimes and sits in the back. :)

Professor has so many descriptions for her course that understanding what she actually wants is nearly impossible. Her portfolio assignment thats due at the end of the semester is a lot of work, so don't procrastinate like I did. She also has something due everyday. Professor is unclear, broad and uneducated on subject.

name_title: James Hoggard Professor in the English department at Midwestern St ate University

ratings.comment: I had this class literally 33 years ago. Based on about 190 credit hours, I learned more from his class than any other I have taken. Yes, he is a bit arrogant, but also compassionate and generous in his dealings with students. His knowledge of the human condition, and his ability to interpret literature are unsurpassed.

I adore the tragedy class, and I enjoy Dr. Hoggard's teaching style. He is very calm, very lenient, and very understand! He will definitely teach you, and his class is interesting if you love the subject. His essays aren't really that difficult, but make sure you write clearly!
AWESOME!!!
Wonderful teacher.

He was funny, lenient, and very understanding. Class won't ever be cancelled, but he never takes roll, and won't mind if you don't show up. Make sure you participate, as that gets you on his good side. He's a really nice guy, and clearly knowledgable of his subject. You should love writing, as in-class essays are expected. Final's just an essay.

name_title: Steven Klepper Professor in the Economics department at Carnegie Mellon University

ratings.comment: homework a lot. But a fun and important class. I would recommend it!
Get ready to learn. You need to know the material inside and out for this class but that's a good thing.
Tough class

Business majors get their panties in a bunch about this class, but its the only real class they actually take. Any math, cs, engineering person will find this is one of the easiest classes in their freshman schedule.

Klepper is one of the best professors at cmu. If you are a smart and dedicated student you will get an amazing amount out of the class, as he not only will teach you econ but how to apply it in a variety of current issues. I highly recommend having lunch with him (something he offers. He's the reason I wanna minor in econ.

name_title: .Meyers Professor in the M athem atics department at Syracuse University

ratings.comment: Amazing at deconstructing calc topics in ways that make it easy to absorb. He is always sure to point out common errors and his love for the subject is infectious. Would def take another math course with him.
He's just not good at teaching calc 2. Yaps for 45 minutes per class. Holds a single office hour on zoom per week, cancels it every other week.

This was the first math class in a long time that I always felt comfortable, if not excited to go to. He explained things clearly and was fluent in pointing out the common misconceptions of first-time calc II students. Meyers is clearly passionate about Math and it rubs off. I would take him for every math class if it were possible.
Great professor!
very helpful!!! he's so pacient. i love his class and he taught very clearly and easy to understand. one of the best teacher!

name_title: Paul Blank Professor in the Geography department at Cal Polytechnic Humboldt

ratings.comment: I really enjoyed Dr. Blank's class. You really get out what you put in, as there are few assignments and the exams are easy. Lecture style is very freeform, with observations and stories about his own extensive travels abroad woven in. All the readings for this class were fascinating too.

Great guy with an incredible amount of knowledge about EVERYTHING. If you stay on track with the reading (which there is more of than I have EVER seen it's pretty ridiculous) then you can ace the course. about 1/4 of the class attends because he doesn't take roll and his lectures are all over the place, but I think It helped that I attended 90%
Do the reading in his class and you'll do great. He does talk about his travels a lot; but it makes the lectures more fun.
Very intelligent but rambled alot, got off on tangents

Lots and lots of reading, ans the lectures do not match. However Paul is extremely entertaining and knowledgeable. Use his study guides for the tests and do the reading after that his lectures should just be fun

name_title: William Coplin Professor in the Political Science department at Syracuse University

ratings.comment: Very engaging and knowledgable

Coplin only teaches the honors section now. There are no grades and it's just a seminar class where you get to pursue a campus problem you're interested in. He can be cantankerous and seem silly but that's just him. Come to class, participate, and do the small assignments they ask for. He will like you and you can form a great relationship.

The major does a good job of teaching accuracy and precision, important traits for careers. PAF's focus on skill is overblown. A better use of tuition dollars is to take classes in the I-school or finance. Major doesn't teach any critical thinking, creativity, or in depth public policy. While their are some advantages, it's not worth taking.

Coplin challenges students to think. He wants to prepare students for the work force not how to study and take tests. He expects students to seek out information and be able to support their theories. If you want to be challenged and get something out of your education at SU, take a course with Coplin!

Professor Coplin is excellent to those who show up and put in the work. You will likely do a lot of cramming on the 'module' papers, and will inevitably lose points as you begin to maneuver through the class, but it is very easy to recover from if you put in the effort. Excellent class taught by an excellent professor.

name_title: Mohammaden Ould-Mey Professor in the Science department at Indiana St ate University

ratings.comment: The class was really informative. If you believe our federal government can do no wrong, this class is not for you. If you can sit back and take another perspective, you will learn a lot. Papers are annoying but fairly simple. Accent is thick, but not impossible to understand.

Difficult to understand arabic/french accent. Be very clear of what you mean when you speak in class. If I would have know that this was going to be an Israeli-Palestinian Conflict 101 instead of World Cultures and Environments, I would have taken it with a different prof. He is unclear on what he expects in assignments, but his tests are simple.

This professor is hard to understand if you are not used to the indian accent. Only 4 homework assignments and 2 exams the whole semester. If you get involved in class discussions it is easier to understand the class.
Very helpful.  Might be hard for midwestern students to understand the arabic/french accent.  Encourages students to think outside the box.  Would recommend to anyone

I think the person below is reading too much into things. Of course he talks about Islam, this is a Middle East class. Dr. Ould-Mey is a very good professor. I have learned a lot from this class.  Take it, it's a real eye-opener. He does have an accent, but I can understand him about 99% of the time.  Easy A if you do your work.

name_title: David Cairns Professor in the Geography department at Texas A&M University at College St ation

ratings.comment: Looks like a cool guy. I really enjoyed his class until I learned his cruel nature. I thought highly of him, and I am glad I got to know him before I asked him to be on my graduate committee.

Really cool guy. Almost everything on the exam is covered in the lecture. Labs are pretty straight forward. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he gives really easy pop quizzes occasionally. I would definitely take a class with him again.
great prof. very entertaining and explained all the material clearly. i would recommend him to anyone.
great teacher... interesting material. four exams (no final) and they are all short answer..kinda hard but very good prof. i recommend him to anyone!
Good, interesting class but very hard tests.  He does quizzes and lab to help your grade.  Fun class but don't expect to make an easy A.

name_title: John Peck Professor in the Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor Peck's lectures are VERY boring and long, but his tests are not hard if you study the power point. He requires you to do blogs every week that are easy pints so make sure you have the book! Also, attendance is mandatory and you will have to sign in every class period. Not always clear about grading so ask and he will work with you!

Professor Peck is very nice, however, he doesn't always tell you exactly what he's looking for on some assignments. The lectures are long but he does take attendance and it does count towards your grade. It's tempting to skip his class as he simply reads the powerpoints word for word and gives you a printout of the material.

Honestly the nicest professor I have ever had. He is so helpful and if you take your papers to his office hours he basically rewrites the whole thing for you. His lectures are long but he's very helpful if you ask questions. Be sure to study terms because you use them in almost every paper. Blogs will make or break your grade and they're easy point

He's a very nice head of our department, but his teaching style bites. He hands us incoherant packets of material and says "Does anyone have any questions?" and answers questions all day instead of lecturing. I feel like I learn nothing and just memorize for his classes. He doesn't use powerpoint or tell stories. BORING

name_title: William Giffin Professor in the History department at Indiana St ate University

ratings.comment: Dr. Giffin is a very old man. He speaks so slowly and softly that it's difficult to understand him and pay attention. If there is ANY stray sound in the classroom it becomes very hard to hear him.   The class proceeds at a middle school pace. Sure, I learned a few things, but it has less content than the Wikipedia page on American history.

Professor Giffin is a much older man that is very soft spoken. His lectures tend to be almost inaudible even if you sit in the middle of the classroom. He's a very tough grader when it comes to writing 2 of your 1,000 word essays and short paragraph exams. Be sure to actually study and read the material that is assigned by him.
Needs to retire

Honestly this class was not too hard.  He is very quiet so sit near the front.  You MUST pay attention to his powerpoint, but the tests are basically the powerpoints.  Although he is a tough grader, he is willing to help you when you ask.

He is extremely monotone, and rambles on and on. He is a nice teacher, yet not helpful at all.  There is no class participation, which makes it easy to fall asleep. He talks the whole class hour.  And he goes slow. Taking notes in this class is a MUST!

name_title: Parvez Sopariwala Professor in the Accounting department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: If you need to take ACC 213, by all means please take another professor. You will be much better off with another professor regardless of the rating. Don't take this professor, and you will be much happier with your semester.

The average grade on the first exam was a 52%...I don't know if it's this class or the department or what but students are feeling like they have no way to succeed. GVSU has a serious problem in its accounting department. If you want to take the class ACC 212 good luck, truly.

Sopariwala is a tough, straightforward professor. He tells you what's expected of you and expects just that. Quizzes weekly. Try in class and ask questions and you will understand what's going on. Accounting isn't easy but he does a great job teaching it.

Professor Sopariwala is a great guy and is super knowledgeable, he has a different way of teaching which may not work for everyone but for me it did wonders. From what felt like it was going to my hardest class turned out to be my best because of how much he cares you learn and try in his class. He is super organized as well.

Tough class. Material is important to know and he knows it really well, but sometimes it is difficult to understand his way of teaching. He is willing to help outside of class but will not make it easy, he is going to make you work for it. If you aren't required to take this class then I wouldn't suggest taking it. Textbook truly isn't necessary!!

name_title: Mike Yuhas Professor in the Accounting department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I had ACC 629 - Partnership Taxation this past spring with professor Yuhas. Expect three hours of lecture each week, and only two graded items, the mid-term and final exam. While it may be time consuming and somewhat challenging, this course no doubt helps prepare for the CPA exam and simulates an hours long exam that requires focus.

One of my more difficult but favorite professors. You'll learn a lot from his classes and he is always available to answer questions even late at night. I don't rate many professors but he was one of the best I had. Would definitely take his courses again. So far I've been in two of them: ACC317 and 318.

Professor Yuhas is really nice and cares about his students. However, this was the most difficult class I have taken at Grand Valley. The lectures are incredibly long and difficult to understand. He frequently mispeaks and contradicts himself. He rarely posts on time and had to be reminded frequently by students to post weekly lecture videos.

Avoid at all cost. Lectures are difficult to follow due to him misspeaking, repeating things in an unnecessary manner, and lack of organization. Horrible at posting online in a timely manner. Had to ask him if he was going to post lectures for the week. AND all of his lectures are from 2 years ago but "requires" the most recent versions of books.

Professor Yuhas uploads SO MUCH lecture to watch and this class is graded by 2 exams. We did not know our first exam grade until a week before the final. He uploaded our final grades to banner but still has not put our second exam grade in (the class ended 6/22 and it is 6/30). Overall very slow grader and does not communicate well with students.

name_title: O. Kimball Armayor Professor in the History department at University of Alabama

ratings.comment: I had his Ancient Near East, Ancient Greece and Ancient Rome courses at Florida. Great professor.  Hard as HELL.

This professor used his power of being a professor to the fullest extent.  He knew he could pass or fail, and with the form of texts about 400+ questions) in which the copies were faulty at best and at worse unreadable, like blurred. . .It was best not to mention it to him!!

I had Dr. Armayor back in the mid 1990's. I was in his first Early Church History Class. I thought he was just teaching the class badly because it was his first time. Then I heard that was how he taught ALL his classes. From what I've read here, it seems he will never change. However, on a more personal note, he is very intelligent and a nice guy.

he is hard and demanding. as a Pagan, I took this class to learn about the early Christian Church.  he is kinda mean, but is cool to those that apply themselves and don't ask stupid questions. one text.  do your reading and attend class and it's pretty easy

Horrible class. Horrible teacher. He didn't give the first until after the drop date and we only had 2 tests and no projects or extra credit. I highly do not recommend this teacher unless you want to learn every boring detail of Ancient Greece.

name_title: John Beeler Professor in the History department at University of Alabama

ratings.comment: Dr. Beeler is a nice guy who brings insightful information on the topics discussed in his lectures. Attendance is not mandatory for lectures but high
His lectures are so fun he is super lively and makes the content interesting! Make a relationship with the TA for section and do the readings, As long as you show up to section you weill do well.

He is genuinely the most intentional professor I have ever encountered at UA. He reads rough drafts of all your papers to give feedback before turning it in, is extremely flexible in terms of paper due dates and arranging office hours, and genuinely wants to see you succeed. His lectures entertaining and filled with humor. I love this man dearly.

Dr. Beeler is an amazing professor. He gets into his lectures and he is also pretty funny. Attendance isn't mandatory but he does not post slides, so the whole class is based on his lecturing. IF YOU CANNOT LEARN FROM JUST A LECTURE, DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE! I love his class, but I cannot just be lectured to.

I really enjoyed Prof. Beeler's class. He moves quickly and only provides an outline in class (not posted but you can email him for it). Attendance is not mandatory but you miss a lot if you don't show up. The lab was fun and had great discussions, also helped clear up questions. If you don't enjoy history or type fast, it may be more difficult.

name_title: P atrick Green Professor in the Honors department at University of Alabama

ratings.comment: This class was super easy compared to other honors classes I've taken. We had to read a new story or book every week, which was annoying (probably because I waited until the day before to start reading). We had to write response papers each week, but as long as you have a clear thought process, he appreciates whatever personal viewpoint you have.

I got an A- in Dr. Green's class, and it was a decent amount of reading and writing. His grading was unclear but probably on the easy side. But, he's incredibly intelligent and I learned SO MUCH. We only met once a week and usually got out at least 45 minutes early in a 2.5 hour class. So smart & would definitely recommend if subject interests you.

Dr. Green rocks! He's very laid-back and has a lot of interesting stories. He recommended a new book to us seemingly every week. His honors seminar on the search for meaning is a class that will stick with me for life!

Dr. Green is extremely knowledgeable. He has a wealth of experience in the fields of religion and philosophy. I've been in his class for a month now and it is VERY clear that he loves telling stories, but they are all very relatable to the subject and interesting. Also, he is slightly quirky with a weird laugh, but he quickly grows on you.

Dr. Green is wonderful. Great story teller. You will really know the material after you finish class. I took a religious studies course, and he is abundantly knowledgeable. His class requires effort, but if you put in the effort then you will be pleased with your grade as well as what you learned

name_title: Betty Mc Ghee Professor in the Psychology department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: McGhee is actually a pretty awesome prof. She is extremely nice and helpful and kind of funny. Her test are not bad as long as you attend class and pay attention.

She's really not as bad as everyone is saying. I actually like her quite a bit. Just go to class and make sure you fully understand the concepts and you'll do fine on the exams. She drops lowest exam grade and has 2 2 page papers that are super easy!

So she is not as bad as some think. I went into this class dreading it but came out with an A and actually enjoyed it. Make sure you go to class and take good notes. Her tests don't always cover exactly what she says but if you understand the concepts really well you will do fine. Her papers are dumb but that's really the only negative i have
That professor is one of the worst I've ever had.  I loved psychology before this.  Her lectures are very dry and boring and they don't help at all.

quite possibly the worst professor grand valley has to offer.Makes students feel stupid for asking questions, WILL NOT reconsider poorly written exam questions(and the majority of her questions are VERY poorly written),and good luck reading what she writes on the board or reading the tiny projections she uses on the overhead.  SWITCH OUT if you can

name_title: Sheldon Kopperl Professor in the History department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: The class is tough, but Unstuck ai helped me stay on top of the material. Definitely do the readings and go to office hours.
Arrogant beyond comprehension

I had Shel for Judaism: Scriptures and Traditions and it was one of my favorite classes that I've ever taken. He cares very deeply about student success and learning and his lectures reflect that. We visited Temple Emanuel in GR. Also, the final presentation allows everyone to present on a topic they are personally passionate about, which is great.
Shel was an amazing professor to have. He was passionate about his material and made the 8:30 time slot entertaining with his jokes.

A great guy and an amazing professor. You can tell he is very passionate about this subject and that he knows a lot about this subject as well. He doesn't give like almost any feedback on any exams or makeup exams, but they are not super difficult. You have to study because they are short answer exams.

name_title: Scott Grissom Professor in the Computer Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Very experienced and an extremely kind professor who makes sure each individual understands the content

First off I want to say that Professor Grissom knows his way around coding and will give you very helpful hints for code. He uses acadly(app for quizzes and attendance), will cold-call on a lot of people every lecture. He grades really well and fare. I recommend that you take him for this course. He is definitely a funny and interesting guy.

Good professor. Not a fan of his cold-calling style, but he knew his stuff and was a fair grader. Be ready to read, as you're going to be assigned weekly ZyBook activities/readings. 3 written exams, 1 lab exam, and 3 projects - be ready to really sit down and apply what you learn in readings/lectures. Excellent course for beginner programmers.

He was a nice guy, it's his exams that messed me up. Exams were very hard, trick questions and lots of questions were obscure Python stuff from Zybook that was only briefly mentioned. You need to get at least a 60% on all 3 exams to pass the class, you could get 100% on everything else but still fail the class if you are bad at exams be careful

he teaches python. group work every class, acadly quizzes also, group work heavy, he does all of these things to encourage attendance and to make sure you paid attention in his lectures. 3 projects which is a big part of your grade, he gave extensions for them and offered help on sundays so he was very accommodating. pretty easy grader

name_title: John Bender Professor in the Chemistry department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I enjoyed 115 so much, I had an amazing prof and was a bit excited for 116. 116 with Bender made me want to cry every day. He is very obviously an intelligent man who knows chm very well, but there is such a disconnect between his knowledge and teaching it. He expects too much for a gen chm prof. Passed because of an insane cuve 60%=B

Bender's teaching style is very old-school - he uses the whiteboard extensively, but can be vague in his explanations. Exams don't align well with lectures, so unstuckstudy AI and study groups are a must to do well.
Grade is based on 4 exams. Lecture is very easy problems, but the exams are pretty difficult. He has his unique way of explaining things.

Professor Bender is smart, but he can't teach to people who aren't chemistry majors. He both over-explains simple concepts and can't answer questions in a way non-chem majors would understand. The tests are hard, so study the old tests and the material well (do not study problems out of the book. Most are not on the test.)
john bender is not a good professor at all. he is rude when asked a question and tests on material not taught. please avoid if you can. the university needs to seriously find a replacement

name_title: David Holdeman Professor in the English department at University of North Texas

ratings.comment: Dr. Holdeman is an amazing professor!! He has great class discussions, grades fairly, and gives great feedback. I learned a lot in his class and recommend him to anyone looking to improve their writing abilities.

Dr. Holdeman is among the best UNT has to offer. It's true he's a tough grader and his test are difficult, but in terms of the depth of knowledge he provides and his very obvious passion for the subject, you won't find a better professor. I still talk about his courses and the books we read some 4 years after graduating. Couldn't recommended more.
Dr. Holdeman is an amazing professor. It is very clear that he puts a lot of time and effort into organizing his classes. He gives fantastic lectures and is very good at leading class discussions.

Holdeman is one of the best professors I have had at UNT. I had to take this class as an English major, but he made it very enjoyable. The tests are practically verbatim what we talk about in class, and he is a very easy grader. You are graded on participation though, so just talk once or twice, or volunteering to read! Taking him again next year!!

I really enjoyed this class. It is required to take for a lot of ENGL majors, and I would recommend taking Dr. Holdeman. Beware that your entire grade is based on 3 exams and 3 essays, as well as participation/attendance. The exams are very managagable, you just have to study the terms and read the textbook. The essays are decent, only 1000 words.

name_title: Larry Gleeson Professor in the Fine Arts department at University of North Texas

ratings.comment: I figured these classes would be more of an art appreciation, sort of deal; I had no idea the schooling I was about to receive. The man is a walking encyclopedia and his dry sense of humor is hilarious to those in the know. Be prepared for sleepless nights. This is what college used to be, when a degree meant something. Sincere thanks, Dr. G!
Great professor and was helpful.

I looked up Dr.Gleeson after a student asked me about my perfect written grammar. He was a hard prof, but I completely respect him, and feel like I learned more in his art history class than I did anywhere else in college. When I traveled to Europe and visited museums, I could hear his voice explaining the materpieces. Thank you Dr. Gleeson!

Dr. Gleeson is an AMAZING professor!  I sat on the back row, and never asked a question.  When he handed me my final, he called me by name.  He is very knowledgeable and very dedicated.  One of my two favorite teachers at UNT.  Every student will tell you, if you want an easy A, Don't take his class.

Excellent teacher; A true intellectual a true scholar who expects the same from his students  Probably the "hardest" teacher in the art school faculty and possibly the best. Will go out of his way to teach anyone who truly wants to learn.

name_title: Jennifer Way Professor in the Fine Arts department at University of North Texas

ratings.comment: I took Professor Way for Topics in Crafts, and she is such a great professor. I recommend her. She really wants to know her students, and wants to know your needs. Communicate with her. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it is important to go to class to understand what you're writing about in your Final Essay.

semester long research project. a semester long report. and a group presentation. doesnt give a lot of criteria. just choose a reasonable research question to answer in 3ish months. really considerate prof and easy to approach. but few assignments.

Super intelligent and amazing class. Practical in her course, only assignments were short essay analyses and you only have to do 6/11. Regardless, you get as much from this course as you put in. Participation and curiosity will help you.
I've had Dr. Way for many classes and if you're prepped to work you will learn SO MUCH. She's intimidating, but very kind and understanding if you communicate. Reignited my enjoyment of art history.

She's great! I love her attitude when she comes into class. She is VERY clear when giving instructions or when lecturing. There are a lot of assignments but they're fair. She will 100% help you with anything you need. Only tough if you bs through. She will help you improve your writing by teaching you how to go deeper into your critical thinking!

name_title: Charles Guarnaccia Professor in the Psychology department at University of North Texas

ratings.comment: This was such a cool class!! Dr.G is really funny and nice. You are put in a group and do simple group assignments every week. And you have online hw thats super easy and interesting. I for sure recommend him!!

*COVID semester* You need the book/Revel access code. If you took PSYC1630 and got the Revel ebook, you can use that same code. QUIZLETA. 2 papers but I only did 1 and got an A. One of the easiest classes I've had. One day of class per week plus revel quizzes. Quizlet is your friend. Revel - 45%, Attendance - 40%, papers - 2 @ 5%. Panopto - 5%.

Took this professor for Personality class and it was a great course to take while I took my hard classes. Must attend the class that's once a week, can do whatever you want once you finish the group work which was really easy and presenting a few times. Mindtap was were I learned it all. He is a really nice prof and the class is simple. No exams.

Use quizlet for revel assignments. Let the panopto lecture run on, you don't need to listen. Go to class everyday. You get assigned into small groups the first week and will work with them until the end. You will be expected to present twice or three times to the class on what ever the topic is that day. It ain't bad. :)
the ta is useless and doesn't grade well.

name_title: William Mc Carter Professor in the Fine Arts department at University of North Texas

ratings.comment: Wonderful man - wonderful teacher. Now that I am teaching courses I think of what would Bill do when addressing some difficult situations. Enjoyed each day in his course.
Great Instructor - fair to students - funny and really informative lectures. Great attitude and respect for people.

One of the best proffesors on campus, he's kick ass! Lectures are funny and intresting. Super knowledgable. Dr. Bill is a great man. If you ever need help or have a problem with the class, he's more than fair and helpfull. After taking his class I still remeber almost everything because he made it interesting and real and relatable. Most elective classes you forgot what you learned. Dr. Bill is the best!
He is my hero.  You work your ass off, but love every minute of it.  Makes you feel like you can do anything if you put your mind to it. A rare gem!!!  Recently retired.  I will miss him so.
Bill's lectrue style make me want to go to class. This stuff is fun and good for my mind as well. No cereal filler or additives - just pure brain food!

name_title: Timothy Montler Professor in the Linguistics department at University of North Texas

ratings.comment: I took Montler for phonology. He is a bottomless pit of knowledge. I have never learned so much from any professor. He literally knows everything about linguistics. also he is hilarious, but you have to be on your toes to catch it. he will change your life. If you want to learn, you will leave class feeling mentally exhausted.

this guy made me fall in love with linguistics. however, i you're not a left-brained, systematic, scientific type, then you'll probably not fall in love with linguistics, but he's a good teacher nonetheless.
Interesting class.
His lectures were so dry. Scientific, objective approach to linguistics.
never takes self seriously, good content

name_title: Donald Staples Professor in the Fine Arts department at University of North Texas

ratings.comment: The guys is a hack and is full of himself.  He is senile and out of touch.  He has dubious credentials and has been berating students since day one.
No Comments

yeah, he's retired. i personally enjoyed his classes. if you respected his class, then he respected you. would put you in your place if you deserved it. does he appear in the dallas' medievel times commercial?...sure looks like him. i learned a great deal from him.  happy retirement!

Fairly knowledgeable, but extraordinarily pompous.  Liked to drop names of H'wood greats he claims he knew.  Could be horribly vindictive toward some students.  He was once head of RTVF dept. before being ousted and I think he took out his anger over that on students.
Terrible! arrogant, ****, stupid! He's retired? Thank goodness!

name_title: Dan Eriksson Professor in the Computer Science department at Academy of Art University

ratings.comment: Honestly, one of my favorite teachers. He actually cares about you and your mental health. He is understanding. Gives good feedback. Wants you to do good in school.
He is nice, I learned a lot in his classes.

Dan is a nice guy. His classes are very straightforward. Do the work, do the best you can, and turn it in on time. Both classes were easy and informative. It wouldn't hurt if he was more knowledgeable in current design trends.
Thank you for the lovely semester!

Overall I was glad I took this course. The material was well written and easy to follow. Unfortunately Dan didn't start giving feedback on assignments before they were due until three weeks before the semester was over. It would have been nice to get feedback throughout the whole class.

name_title: Charles Standridge Professor in the Engineering department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: 10/10 class and prof. Extremely interesting material and I learned so much. The class was really simple and expectations were clear. Two group papers, but prof is not a tough grader. Do the work and you will get a good grade! This class made me interested in renewable energy and I would love to take the prof again. Highly recommend to anyone!!!

Prof Standridge was a great professor. I was initially scared to take him because of his ratings but I was pleasantly surprised. The class was super interesting and it grew a passion of renewable energy in me. If you are interested in renewable energy at all, take this class you wont regret it!!

I took this professor for an engineering gen ed, and it was amazingly easy. It was about renewable energy systems, and it only consisted of some short forums, true/false quizzes, easy homework, and two group projects. He graded really easily, and this was an interesting and easy class.

If this class was transformed into a person who then was able to speak and rub its own chest, Charlie would be the one to emerge from the 440 womb. If his class was recorded and put on youtube, it could be comfortably viewed at 1.5 or 2.0X usual speed. The lectures are slow and the homework is not very well put together. I ran out of characters sry

I think he's a nice guy, but he really needs to stay away from teaching.  He is not clear about anything,  1/3 of the time he stares at nothing in the back of the room, tends to rub parts of body during lecture making everyone  uncomfortable, and his lectures are so boring you feel your intelligence drain out of every open orifice on your body.

name_title: Laura Fox Professor in the Languages department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Love her but she will call you out in front of the whole class if you forgot to do your homework. Makes jokes and encourages the students to talk to each other, even if it's in English.

This class was structured perfectly. I learned a lot and I can tell that my Spanish skills improved. There was a good amount of homework for each class, but it was perfectly reasonable and very helpful. Lectures could get boring sometimes, but she is very good at explaining things and makes sure that you are understanding everything.

She's such a sweetheart, very little lecturing, pretty much every single day is an activity and the homework and activities actually prepared you for tests. Pretty relaxed grader and always willing to talk to you and help you out. Really loved her energy and I could tell she actually cared about me and everybody else.

Laura Fox is such an amazing teacher- she is so organized, caring, and understanding. Her 309 class made me understand grammar (especially Pret vs Impef, ser v estar, and subjunctive) seriously an amazing class, even given the content. Take Laura Fox!!

Professor Fox is very energetic which is very necessary for this course because of the boring material. She struggles quite a bit with teaching online though. She has not mastered how to put questions in for quizzes/tests and she puts students in breakout rooms for WAY too long. If you try in her class you should get at least an A-.

name_title: Carl Johnson Professor in the Psychology department at Central Michigan University

ratings.comment: Professor Johnson was one of my favorite professors of my first semester at CMU. He is a great teacher and always finds a way to make his lectures interesting. He does his best to connect with each of his students on a deeper level and makes you feel respected. I highly recommend him as your PSY 100 professor.

Carl Johnson is a great prof for PSY100! I took him my first semester and its an easy A, go to lecture and take notes because its mostly powerpoints. Drops the lowest exam and the exams are almost the same as the practice exam so GO TO THE EXAM REVIEW!!! Also if you need any extra points he lets you get up to 20 by doing the psych studies!

PSY100 is all about memorization and not so much understanding. Johnson is awesome. He's great at exaplinging, but if you can't memorize facts you won't pass. Go to the SI sessions, because the practice tests have the same questions as the real test. Just memorize that and the terms and you'll be fine.
Carl Johnson is the MAN. Really funny guy and is super specific in his lectures, and the class is pretty easy to excel in if you just go to the lectures.
Super understanding and willing to work with any issues you may have. Really interesting lectures given in an easy to understand format. Tests are easy and a good representation of the work studied.

name_title: Greg Klein Professor in the M athem atics department at Texas A&M University at College St ation

ratings.comment: He is so cool. Invited me over for thanksgiving

The first thing this professor asks you to do is call him Greg. Hes awesome and keeps the class alive. Attend class because he explains everything on his tests during class. His homework is not mandatory but is essential to passing the course. If you attend class and take good notes and practice the problems, theres no reason to get blow a B.

His tests are not as bad as people say; you have to know the material though. Basically if you know the material and how to solve problems, you will do fine on the tests. He gives partial credit. I went to office hours a couple times, and he was helpful. DO THE SUGGESTED HOMEWORK! It will help SO MUCH!

You must go to class to pass this course. Greg does not upload any of his "slides" because he just writes on the whiteboard in class. Tests should be easy, but he puts trick questions on them. He is a knowledgeable guy, but he did not know how to teach the material well at all.

This was his first time teaching cal 1 for bio majors and he was absolutely horrible. His exam questions were completely different from the examples he used in lecture. He gave out a couple of quizzes and sometimes they were on the exams and those where the only ones i would get correct. DO NOT recommend.

name_title: David Long Professor in the History department at East Carolina University

ratings.comment: Took this class because I thought it would be an easy A but thats not the case. Don't take this class unless you really need to. Didn't learn anything and this class brought my gpa down.
The best teacher.
this guy is a JOKE of a professor! don't ever take this guy!
This guy is ridiculous! He is so boring in his lectures and his quizzes have nothing to do with the lectures. Quizzes and tests are way hard. If you get him as a prof drop immediately.
Horrible!!!! If you ask him how your grade is in the class, he will tell you "you are doing fine" when really your failing!!! Very unorganized and mean.

name_title: Khalida Zaki Professor in the Sociology department at Michigan St ate University

ratings.comment: This is by the far the worst teacher on the planet...you can hardly understand anything she says. She makes a somewhat interesting course, DULL & BORING. There is absolutely no point in going to lecture because she takes it DIRECTLY from the book...so just read the book. She will not keep you updated on your grade throughout the entire semester.

Personally, I felt like she made a class that had the potential to be really interesting, incredibly irritating. She takes everything from lectures directly from the book so you don't even need to go to class. It makes it worse that she is REALLY biased about everything she talks about instead of keeping an open mind, which I find very frustrating.

The tests are hard to understand because they're not exactly written in regular English, which ended up hurting my grade.  It's an easy class with not much work, and the professor is very passionate (maybe even too passionate) about what she lectures on.
TERRIBLE. she makes me not wanna come to her class ever. usually i dont, just to protect my mind. horrible teaching skills and almost completely impossible to understand. STAY FAR AWAY.

The course material might have been interesting, but it was guided on statistics pulled directly from the book. Though a nice woman, I felt that a huge burden was put onto the TA. The grammar on the tests was sometimes so jumbled that it was impossible to know what the question was even asking.

name_title: Michael Brook Professor in the M athem atics department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: did not want to attend class with this professor

Bitter, hostile, angry. Openly insults students and ended class after having a meltdown for no apparent reason on more than one occasion. Work is not the worst possible math ever but if you aren't sure about the subject going into it, he sure isn't going to make it any clearer. Does not give partial credit although he claims he does. AWFUL.

For a required math class it was pretty painless as far as workload. However the class itself was boring and Brook had a tendency to be unclear in his teaching at times. No explanation of grading on exam and test questions. Also was rude to students during class.   If you can deal with him then this class is a breeze.
Boring, but fair in grading.
He's nice if you talk to him after class, but sometimes he's just rude no matter what you do or say.  Very unclear.  Very strange.  Loves to spell.

name_title: Marilyn Mook Professor in the Health Science department at Michigan St ate University

ratings.comment: One of the best teachers you will ever find.  On a par with her mother, Ada, who was the best teacher we ever found. The eyes, the same, sharp, loving and full of life.
Easy easy easy!!!  Just go to class.  Take it with a friend and alternate going to class to make it even easier.  EASY!
No Comments
All she does is lecture. I think that she could make it a little more interesting. Nice lady. Experienced. Didn't do so well on exams but that's my fault!
good prof. nice lady

name_title: Rob Palkovitz Professor in the Psychology department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Dr. Palko made the course interesting and applied it individually to the class to fully grasp the material. I believe we all learned from one another in this class and I would love to take another course with Dr. Palkovitz.

I loved Dr. Palkovitz and everything he taught, you could tell he was passionate about everything he said. However, if you don't find the material interesting and are just taking for credit, it could be hard to sit through. As long as you apply yourself and listen to what he says in lecture (don't just copy slides!), you will pass no problem.
Palkovitz is an amazing guy. The class isnt an easy A but it is managable. I loved attending his lectures. exams are all about application

he is an interesting guy, but the tests kind of killed me. really interesting material. you will have to study a lot because its hard to get a good grade on his tests and not much else goes into your grade.

He is a good guy but talks about himself a lot.3 exams and one is the final,15% of the final is cumulative, one paper. Homework assignments twice a week they're easy but time consuming. The exams are HARD, need to think the way he is in order to do well. I got a B on the first one and a C on the other. Doesnt post slides online, need to go to class

name_title: Karen Gipson Professor in the Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: She is a tough grader. will never give you full points on anything even if she has no negative feedback. She's a mess! Students constantly had email her about flaws in the course that were her fault. She didn't post the right materials, she listed the wrong due dates, she was unclear about directions, she uploaded the wrong grade... should I go on?
Such a caring professor :) Her class was my favorite, even though it was a 1 credit extra class. She really cares about her students and wants them to learn & do well. Take her!!
It's interdisiplinary studies, would take agian.
Super boring Professor, do not recommend. Very hard to stay focused during a 2.5 hour MEDITATION lecture.

Not a course that you can just breeze through. A lot of reading and writing and she is really passionate about this topic so she'll actually read your papers. She's really nice and understanding but only if you actually try, but it's a lot of work for sure.

name_title: Elizabeth Metzger Professor in the English department at University of South Florida

ratings.comment: Easy class. At first looks like a lot of work, but everything has clear instructions. No quizzes in this class. There is 3 "projects" that consist of small assignments and one group project. she gives feedback on how to improve your assignments. As long you turn in the assignments on time, you should have a good grade. :)
get ready to work. homework basically every day. no help on drafts,

Dr. Elizabeth Metzger remains high on my ll-time best professor list.
Dr. Metzger expected punctuality, regular attendance, class participation, all assignments and readings be done for each class. Being an older student, I found that her class requirements were in line with what employers require of their employees.

There are assignments due every weekday. Not kidding. Most assignments are only 5pts for completion and then the four projects are a couple hundred points each, where she grades pretty hard. Her feedback is "collective" or just common mistakes she saw in everyone's drafts which is not helpful at all. Lots of busy work.

This class was a huge pain. 4 projects that could have been fairly easy, but the instructions given on the projects were very broad. I did not know if I was ever doing a single project correctly or not due to the poor instructions. The instructor give a Collective feedback, which was totally useless when you don't know if your doing wrong. Avoid.

name_title: Dan Royer Professor in the Writing department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Dr. Royer has some funny jokes. He's a good professor and if you're passionate about accounting he's a top pick. Even though I couldn't care less about accounting, I only found his course a little challenging. He offer's test corrections on all tests (Final gets a curve). I didn't really do any of the homework and still passed with a C.
Worst experience of my college career. He does not seem to have much interest in teaching.
He does not seem to like teaching or students.

You know how teachers always say there are no dumb questions? Well Royer will tell you - in so many words - your question is dumber than dumb, and you are the dumbest. Really, if I wanted to be bullied, I'd just go back to elementary school.

I really liked Royer! He's very funny, yet a little dry so he can come off as a little rude. His teaching style involves showing you the basics and allowing you to discover the deeper techniques. He's very quick to look at your work notice whether or not you are listening to new concepts, so make sure to pay attention.

name_title: Figen Mekik Professor in the Geology department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: LOTS of extra credit in this class. Make sure to read the syllabus for extra credit criteria. Decent amount of assignments but nothing hard. Very strict on turning in things late for her asynchronous class. NO EXCEPTIONS!!
Don't let these reviews deter you. Use ChatGPT and you'll be alright. Solid easy course.

Do not take this course unless you are a geology or climate science major, even though it's online, the workload is big. Late assignments are not accepted, but there are many opportunities for extra credit. Expect a quiz, 2-3 assignments, and the occasional extra credit assignments due at the end of each week. Prof cares about student success.
TAKE! Seriously, so much extra credit, really understanding and kind! One of the best professors i've had at GVSU.
Lots of busy work, but Figen makes it easy to get an A if you just do the assignments. Lectures don't always align with the work, so Unstuckstudy and other study aids were lifesavers for me.

name_title: Amber Brown Professor in the Economics department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Amber Brown is a HORRIBLE professor. She seems very knowledgeable about economics, but has no idea how to teach it or give tests/homework on it. DO NOT TAKE HER FOR SPORTS ECON. Basically the whole class is based on a Fantasy Football Project (nothing to do with economics) and since I dont know much about football I got a D+ in her class. :(
I really liked her. The course was tough, but she's a very fair professor. Do your HW, and ask questions and you have no reason to not get a solid grade. She's a very cool lady! Would Recommend her.

She's nice but the homework assignments you have to teach yourself. Then she grades them like my middle school teachers did by marking off points for not using complete sentences and for using "it." She made the class harder than it should be
I felt she was a very good professor. If you go to class and do the homework like you're supposed to, it's easy to get a good grade. She is very nice and is always willing to help.

The worst professor I have had so far at GVSU. The homework assignments are insanely hard, she teaches the information after you have turned in the homework. She talks to her students in an INTRO course as if we should already know the information. Nothing is explained in the way a 200 level course should. I would never recommend  her to anyone.

name_title: Glenn Perry Professor in the Political Science department at Indiana St ate University

ratings.comment: ONE OF THE BEST PROF.
if you listen, you learn a lot.. the hardest part of class is listening though...

CUTEST OLD MAN EVER, WOULDNT MIND HAVING HIM FOR A GRANDPA.  BUT HIS GRADING IS NOT CLEAR AT ALL, AND HE TALKS ABOUT THE MOST UNINTERESTING SUBJECTS.  HIS TESTS ARE MORE SPECIFIC THAN WHAT HE TEACHES. NICE GUY BUT SERIOUSLY NEEDS TO RETIRE LIKE IN 1925.
he is a nice guy, but very old and clueless and needs to retire. i guessed on one of the tests and somehow got a C, but i fall asleep every day. can't wait for the final to be over.
He is ancient!  I got an A but I have no idea how.

name_title: Norbert Kerr Professor in the Psychology department at Michigan St ate University

ratings.comment: An amazing professor. Absolute pleasure to have him. Got me really interested in becoming a smart research consumer (that was the name of the course)
Hard. Boring. Must go to class.
THIS CLASS SUCKS!!!!! SO hard and dry info...have fun writing about 4 pages of notes a day (if you can keep up with how fast he goes through the slides) AVOID HIM...seriously.
No Comments

This guy is sooo boring. If you can you should avoid having this guy as your teacher. He talks and talks and talks. He tries his best to make things interesting, but it just doesn't work for him. Very long class and hard to stay awake.

name_title: Majd Al-Mallah Professor in the Languages department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I currently have Majd as a professor. Over the years, I've had eight different foreign language teachers in three different foreign languages - lots of experience. Majd is one of the best language instructors I've had. He knows what he is doing. His class is set up in a way that you should be learning material before you come to class. Miigwich.
Hard class but great professor.

I had Al Mallah for HNR 152 and 154. He's the sweetest guy, but he does give you a lot to read (beware of the Sugar Street Trilogy if you take these classes). If you want to be prepared for tests, go to class and take notes during discussion on the unit review sheets he posts. His test questions can be pretty vague and hard to understand.

Professor Almallah is easily one of the best professors that I've had at GV. His organization format is straightforward, his classes are fun, and he's great at explaining things. Highly recommend taking a class with him!

Honestly, a great class to take. I definitely learned a lot and the class wasn't too time-consuming. It's asynchronous, but he posts weekly lectures. One paper and weekly discussion posts. My only complaint is that the quizzes could be a bit difficult. It's helpful if you get in touch with your classmates (there's a group project too).

name_title: Sherry Mc Guire Professor in the English department at Boise St ate University

ratings.comment: This teacher is extremely forgetful, rarely on time, and has a tendency to lose assignments.  However, with all of that said, she introduces the material to students in an interesting and engaging way.  Personally, I'll take content over organization.  Good class, definitely recommend it.

Worst Professor I've had ever. Forgetful, unorganized and unprofessional. Took her WEEKS to grade our assignments and tests. And she was 15 min to EVERY class. Waste of my time and money. Do not recommend!

She has no idea what she is talking about. Always being corrected. Has shown up on time 2 times this semester. Loses things. Doesn't tell you what she expects from you and then freaks out when the assignment isn't done correctly. Doesn't do anything when she says she will. Took her weeks to grade our first reading response. Horrible as a professor.

Sherry is a very down to earth, entertaining instructor.  She is EXTREMELY forgetful though.  It took her several weeks for her to get the syllabus to me, which had our reading assignments and homework listed on it.  Class is super easy though and not much is expected.  Reading responses are graded on completion, not on content. Entertaining class!

Took a class from Sherry years ago and it was the worst experience of my entire education.I love literature but she made it such a heinous chore rather than something to be enjoyed.Ten years later I still shudder when I think about the pain she caused.I am a teacher and the only good that came of having her class was learning how not to teach!

name_title: Barb Saunier Professor in the English department at Grand Rapids Community College

ratings.comment: Worst teacher I ever had. She's rude and doesn't make sense. She marks you down for the most ridiculous things. I'm a straight a student and I've always gotten A's in english and I didn't in this class. Avoid her if you can.
If you're looking for an easy A, keep looking. If however, you are looking for a professor who can actually teach you something, you've found the right one.

She is not very nice at all. She's a really tough grader and doesn't explain things very well. She gives useless assignments and expects you to write like you're a professional writer. Try to avoid having her. You will regret it if you do.

She was very scatter-brained and hard to understand the points she was trying to make. If you're able to keep up with someone who jumps topics constantly keep her as a teacher, if not, I'd switch asap. She also expects the papers to be formatted exactly the way that she wants them, if you don't have them this way you're likely to get a bad grade.

She's hard, slackers beware. Do not take this class if you are looking for an easy A. She expects quality work, it's hard but I would take her again because I've never learned as much from any other professor. She teaches at a college level.

name_title: Janice Balye at Professor in the English department at Grand Rapids Community College

ratings.comment: I had her my freshman year and I truly didnt realize how bad she was until my my sophomore year. I havent had a professor as mean and in-genuine since her and I wouldnt wish anyone to take her class. I wouldnt be surprised if all the good reviews about her on here were her rating herself because I dont see how anyone could enjoy her class.
She started off very good and then after the first few weeks, it seemed like she did not care as much. Felt like she would pick certain people out and grade them a lot more tough than others.

Phenomenal professor. She clearly cares about teaching you how to write college papers, and she also teaches sentence structure and proper use of commas so that your paper will have few grammatical errors. I learned how to write proficiently, and I would take her again, she's so inspirational. But no goofing off, she doesn't play around

I love her. She's always willing to stay late and help you and she responds quickly to e-mails. She grades based on your own writing skills and has really helped peak my interest in taking more English classes. She's so kind and really cares about her students. You MUST show up to class for a good grade - but you should show up anyway.

Mrs.B is very nice and helpful. She has faith in all of her students and she is pretty fair. Her class is tough with lots of homework but when your done with her class you will be an amazing writer. I recommend her to students that have never written a college level essay.

name_title: Bogdan Adamczyk Professor in the Engineering department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I could have said he was a nice professor. If it wasn't for the fact he is so out of touch with what is going on. He doenst have any slides and takes the slides he does give you from other professors. He grades on 5 things the entier semester. homework, 3 exams and the final. Each of which is harder than the last. He also doesnt know what DSR is.

Pretty straightforward lectures. Often throws a curveball on each exam so know your concepts well- he doesn't give a lot of partial credit. Best thing is his gpa style grading scale (so a 2/4 on an exam is a C). Also, he doesn't post anything on blackboard so get some numbers so you can get the notes from someone if you miss class.

I liked Adamcyzk's class. He can be dry, but he explains the material thoroughly and his notes that he gives to you on blackboard are usually pretty straightforward. I honestly thought 314 was easier than 214. His grading scale is a godsend too. Its GPA style where he grades each question on a 4 point scale. So a 2.0 / 4.0 is a 73% and not 50%.

Graded with three exams and lab, each worth 25%. He doesn't give homework and lectures are a lot of derivations, with no real examples aside from the class period before an exam. This can be tough, but he is very thorough with lectures, so find practice problems and you'll be fine. He is a fair grader, but not the most approachable person.

Took him for 214. His lectures do a good job of explaining concepts, but with no real worked examples. Do the homework, then do it again, and you'll be fine. Try to understand concepts because what shows up on tests is different than homework. Smart guy, good lectures.

name_title: Robert Hahn Professor in the Philosophy department at Southern Illinois University - Carbondale

ratings.comment: Professor Hahn has an old-school teaching style, but his lectures can be quite entertaining. While the textbook is mandatory, using unstuckstudy as a supplementary study tool can really help you stay on top of the material. Overall, a decent class if you put in the effort.

Dr. Hahn was a terrible professor. Constantly spoke in a condescending tone to those asking for help. Yelled at you for where you sat in the classroom. Sounded like a used car salesman which really got old. Makes you buy the book that he wrote that he charges $150 for. Waste of time.

Very knowledgable teacher and does a great job teaching the material. The one negative is that sometimes he goes too fast and you lose track of what's happening and in this class you can't do that. If you have a good TA they will fill in the missing pieces that Hahn went to fast on. Overall an easy course if you go to every class and listen to TA's

weekly HW assignments, weekly quizzes, 3 exams, and $150 for the required textbooknah
this is not the 100-level class ur looking for
don't take this class if you are queer, lecture is out of touch and offensive. he can't even get the letters in LGBT right

A surprisingly unethical man to be teaching an ethics course. Choose your section wisely- TAs do all the grading in the course, Hanh actively avoids developing relationships with students
 
Uses transphobic and racist examples in class (Not so ethical now) But I guess that's just impersonal harm according to him

Hanh- update your course

name_title: Phil Kearns Professor in the Computer Science department at College of William and Mary

ratings.comment: Him leaving makes me scared for our department because he is as good as they come. His lectures are very clear and covers so many things. His projects take you to hell and back, but it's worth it in the end. Take any class with this man, he knows his material better than I know my family. Start projects early, ask him for help, and you'll be fine!

He's an amazing teacher. Although he's tough, he is the man who makes you into a programmer. If you're just for the major skip him, but if you want to learn how to really program and learn so much more take any class he teaches. ANY. He knows so much. As long as you don't waste his time, he's great to get help from.

The course is good. There is only one test - the final, and it's relatively hard. The rest of the grade is made up of projects which are done solo only. Grading is on a curve, so aim for at the very least average and you'll more than likely get a B. Attendance is not required, but  strongly recommended.

Kearns is passionate about this class, which answered many questions I had about software systems.  Several script-graded projects determine most of your grade.  Most projects are in C, and use Unix system calls for spawning processes and interprocess communication.  (Start early on the projects to get them right.)  I highly recommend this class.
Grades against other students, basically a Hunger Games scenario

name_title: Robert Mc Callum Professor in the Science department at William P aterson University

ratings.comment: Dr. McCallum is the reason I was accepted to dental school.  Professional schools put a heavy weight on organic chemistry and I was  lucky to have Dr. McCallum as my professor.   Much gratitude
He gives you his old tests, so all you need is to study from them. Attendance is mandatory to do well in the class. Gives you all the worksheets needed for exams. Do NOT bother with the book.

His class for nurses is WAY easier than I expected.  His class is pretty boring, but he is actually quite funny.  He gives you all of his old tests to study from so you feel totally prepared for every exam.  Not bad at all.
