You can read ahead if you want to, but it's not necessary because all of his exams are from his notes. He puts photocopies of ALL his previous exams online, USE THEM. Go to tutoring. He doesn't answer questions during class but he helps you with a curve at the end of the semester.

Very helpful and caring professor. He answers every question you have. His tests are NOT hard if you study and understand the material. Tutoring is available. I recommend this class if you are actually interested in learning something useful.

name_title: Margaret Sesselmann Professor in the M athem atics department at Grand Rapids Community College

ratings.comment: She is helpful and answers questions in a timely manner (for online class); she also posts extra recorded lectures to enhance the learning experience. All in all a fair grader, though the online learning area is multiple choice 80% of the time where as the tests/exams are hand written and rarely multiple choice.... so there is that small adjustment
She gives great examples. Easy to understand. Very nice if you ask a question.
she was a good teacher, there was a lot of work though!
Terrible teacher. She doesn't help when its needed. You will learn 4 different ways to solve a problem. (only need one way). Always in a hurry, to fast to clearly understand.

Margaret is very helpful and positive. She has a friendly, non-hostile personality, and made everyone feel at ease for our public speaking (as much as this is possible). I would enjoy having her for class again. While this last point certainly isn?t relevant, it is interesting; she has a very attractive girl-next-door look.

name_title: Allison Adams Professor in the Hospitality department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Don't waste your time in this class. Professor barely did anything, had to teach yourself everything. She never responded to emails and often left much confusion. Every class I've taken with her I've had problems. There are a million better HTM professors.

Actually the worst class I have taken out of all my college classes. I recommend not taking this class it was awful, especially online. She is strict on grading and the online tests we have to do each week have little do to with the loads of articles and videos she gives us. Save yourself this semester if you plan on taking this class.

Don't take her if it is just for an elective. She does NOT respond to emails, and quite frankly it seems like she puts no effort into the course. There are weekly quizzes that are graded by BlackBoard, and the things she has to grade herself she has not graded in over 1.5 months. Absolutely horrible for an online setting.
One project and one paper. Grades are arbitrary and she doesn't have a clear rubric. Hard to know what she wants, but she is looking for super specific things in answers and the paper.

Allison is very rude and discouraging. She makes highly offensive comments every single class and is extremely argumentative and confrontational. Grades short answers based on how much she likes you and won't budge should you prove her wrong. Pours her own tastings first so she can be sure to have some liquor for herself should it run out...

name_title: Jack Weir Professor in the Philosophy department at Morehead St ate University

ratings.comment: You can miss up to 5 questions(out of 12) on each weekly quiz and get a 100% if you do the out of class extra credits. Otherwise you can still miss 2 for a 100.

I should've put "more papers," but not the kind you write. Weir gives you tons of handouts that are completely irrelevant. He is very egotistical and spent the entire class talking about his travels and ability to read Greek. Completely irrelevant to the course. Monotone. Boring. Irrelevant lectures make the tests impossible. Would never take again
Weir is by far my favorite professor at MSU. I love this man. He will do anything in the world to help out his students.
Very nice and helpful professor. Highly recommend for gen ed courses. He understands they shouldn't be overly difficult but you do have to pay attention and study for exams.

Was extremely easy but as a class I kind of looked forward to taking I was disappointed in it. Weir is very boring. You would think many environmental and animals ethics would be talked about but this is not the case. Instead it mainly focuses on the basic tenets of philosophy. Extremely easy overall but did not enjoy it because it was so boring.

name_title: Donna Everett Professor in the Business department at Morehead St ate University

ratings.comment: There were cats in the background of the home office and she required cam and attendance at certain unannounced times. I was at work that is why I took online Donna!!!!

This class is easy if you listen and do what you are told. It is by far the easiest class that I have had to take for my MBA. If you listen to what she tells you to do for the assignments, and you replicate it, you will get an A.   Also, I am a female. I did not feel like she preferred males over females in any way.

This is by far the most confusing and frustrating class I've taken in the past 20 years. Even if you actively listen and participate in her Collaborate sessions, you still won't understand what she wants. Don't bother emailing her. She is very rude to students via email. As a teacher, she makes learning frustrating and doesn't answer questions.
If you just keep up with the assignments it's pretty easy.

For a business communications professor, she is very unclear with everything. She plays favorites and it is absolutely awful. She has no concept of time, and is very rude to students. She is politically incorrect. Terrible professor, never take her.

name_title: Kent Olney Professor in the Sociology department at Olivet Nazarene University

ratings.comment: He truly cares about both your education as well as your faith. He is passionate about what he teaches and has made me like a class that I had no previous interest in.

He is very old school, he don't have any assigments in class. In fact, the only assignment in the class, are the  big exams. And the exams is based off his lectures primarily, and almost never from the book.

Prof Olney is really nice and a funny prof. He is very knowledgeable about the information. The class was fairly easy. Just copy down every thing son the powerpoints for the test. The book was not absolutely necessary, there are 1 or 2 questions per test from it.. I found the book online for free at library genesis . com.

only took it because I was required to. He tries to be funny and wastes 15+ minutes talking about Ester. It was very religious-based, almost everything was tied to God in some way, even though sociology is not religious.
Olney is great! Class is completely lecture-based, but he makes everything easy to understand. Pay attention in class, skim the textbook, and you'll do good.

name_title: Andy Cottle Professor in the Music department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Hands down one of the best professors I've ever had. He's the jolliest, happiest person I've seen teach a class in a very long time. He's passionate, he's clear, he's immensely helpful during study sessions, and if you do your work, you'll ace the class with ease. It helps if you have a musical background, but even if you don't, you'll still suceed

Worst class I ever took at UD, lectures were long and dry, exams impossible, studied for this class substantially longer than all of my 400 level pre-law classes combined, barely scraped together a C+ and i played cello for 10 years, purpose of a 101 level breadth requirement class should be simple introduction to material, not to challenge Mozart.

This class should be an easy A as long as you have TIME. You need to memorize at least 10 songs before every exam, make sure you take all the notes in his class or else you won't know anything (he doesn't post his notes online). The extra credit is a must in this class and almost everyone does it.

Read the chapters he assigns, show up to lecture and write down what is on the slides. Listen to the music he assigns consistently (you can even listen to it while studying for other stuff). Four tests, all multiple choice and are straight from the exams written for the book. Make sure to go to the extra credit concerts.

go to class if you want to have a chance at doing well on exams. he covers almost everything on his powerpoints in class, and he goes at a good pace. however, reading the textbook pages that he has online really helps for some exam questions. keep up with your listening! definitely not an easy A, but he's a sweetheart

name_title: Shirley Lemon Professor in the Music department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Caring and sweet but too idealistic with high academic and personal expectations. Doesn't take constructive (or not) criticism well. If she asks for feedback for her, she only expects positive, if not, you will be told your perspective is wrong. It was a...weird experience.

Mrs. Lemon is such a great professor and coming to class is so exciting every day. Select Women's Ensemble has helped me develop my skill as a singer so much, and it's helped my confidence grow too. Mrs. Lemon always makes the class laugh and has quotes every day that are inspirational and make me feel proud to be a woman.

Prof. Lemon is just an amazing human being. She just might be the kindest teacher ever. At the start of every rehersal, she askes us if we want to share anything with the class and then offers some of her wisdom. She also has the ability to find the perfect music for the group and works with us to perfect the pieces. Values our opinions highly.
Class was fun and easy.  She did waste a lot of rehersal time though.
She's an excellent teacher; very nice.

name_title: Richard Gordon Professor in the Computer Science department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Honestly, if you just show up you'll get at least a B. Exams are online with no time limit, so you have like a week to google the answers. Only did 2 online posts about a current event. The rest of the grade came from in class work, which was super easy as long as you were in class. I didn't read a single thing from the book and did fine.

Richard is awesome! He does cuss but is so entertaining! It's a class you will want to go to. When he says daily quizzes are 'painfully easy', he is serious. Very easy discussion class. Just do the work. Online exams and 6 Google Group posts (around two paragraphs) about current events. I learned a lot in the class about forming an ethical toolkit.

Class is an easy A if you do the reading and the short quizzes.  Tests are take home, open note, open book.  So easy.  Plus he makes the class very interesting and relevant.  Very enjoyable class with a very enjoyable professor.

While this class is not an easy A, most students will end up with a B if they keep up with the work. Watch out for the final and final project because he grades those harsher than any other assignment in the class. I can honestly say that he has the coolest and funniest personality at UD. Makes noises and sings to keep students entertained.

Very good teacher, makes the content interesting and relevant to what is going on in the world. The class is easy if you just do the work and the reading. He does cuss a lot in class, which gets annoying after a while. Otherwise, excellent professor!

name_title: Ron M atson Professor in the Social Science department at Wichita St ate University

ratings.comment: A few papers, A few tests, attendance randomly taken. Really impactful lectures.

Great lecturer has very extensive knowledge of the subject. you must attend lecture since his tests cover what was said in class. the book is also a must since he puts questions on the tests that stem from articles from the book. Tests make a large portion of the grade. The short papers are easy points if turned in on time. Great professor.
Men and masculinities made me change my major! Really eye opening.
You will have to show up every class pop quiz will be count as your attendance , which is 6 times during the semester.
Loved Mr Matsons class! I would definitely take him again.

name_title: Monica Michell Professor in the The ater department at Texas St ate University

ratings.comment: Best teacher/class i've had at texas state so far. Cares deeply for her students. AMAZING class
She is a WONDERFUL teacher. I really enjoyed this class. I like being silly and fun and this was the class for it. She makes you act like your in second grade again so be ready to be silly.
Best teacher/class i've had at texas state so far.  Cares deeply, works your ass off, and rewards you for it.  If you want an easy class, piss off.
No Comments
unfair grading system

name_title: Mark Lord Professor in the Geology department at Western Carolina University

ratings.comment: Attendance is not mandatory, but I would attend because his exams are pretty hard. His exams consist of short answers, multiple choice, and fill in the blank. He does make study guide questions. He is lecture heavy but knows his subject. He's a great teacher, but grades hard and grades at the end of the semester and a slow email replier.

Lord is a cool fella that students should try to form a relationship with. He is very kind and will help you. He allows freedom but that's paired with high expectations. He's interested in making great geologists who know how to operate the way a geologist does. He's just not really interested in "easy".
Really tough grader, and you won't get any grades back until the last second. He is very passionate but buffers and lot and speaks softly so sometimes you can't hear him.

Most of the negative reviews on this page are insensitive and incorrect. Mark Lord is a geology doctorate, so he is very informed on the subject. Yes, he speaks quietly, but you should be sitting in the front anyway. Science will always require reading and hard concepts. If you can't handle those, then pick a new major. His abrasiveness is awesome.

This is the senior capstone. Lord can be cryptic at times, so you need experience with him regarding your teacher-student relationship and his teaching style. He speaks quietly so sit close to him. Very intense grading style, but it's for you to improve. He is decent at delegation and facilitating lab work. Stay involved with the work.

name_title: Lawrence Harris Professor in the M athem atics department at University of Kentucky

ratings.comment: This class is difficult and youre going to have to study outside of class. Most of your grade is based around the exams which are very hard, but the curve is pretty lenient (usually 20 points up). Dr. Harris lectures are dry and hard to follow but i felt like he wasnt as bad as these reviews made him seem. Still wouldnt take him again though.

i saw him during his office hours and he didn't like my questions so he took my backpack and literally threw it out of his office and told me to get out his office. I'm writing this here since I read other comments - it seems he is a danger to students. Looking back, I should have filed a complaint against him. At the time, I was a young student.

Dr. Harris is not the best professor I've ever had or the most accommodating, but some of these reviews are a bit harsh. He did chase a kid for leaving class early and came back out of breath. It was funny though. His lectures can be hard to follow but they have a lot of detail. He's actually a nice guy. Ask questions after class. Don't interrupt.

He won't complete problems in real-time, he is demeaning to students, he is barely competent when it comes to technology, he is unwilling to be helpful in any aspect. As far as I'm concerned, his parents should've wrapped it before they tapped it. First math class I've struggled with. Take any other professor, please.

Dr. Harris provides notes and lectures that are unclear and seem to only lean to his understanding. He uses pre-written notes which are very hard to understand and he does not thoroughly explain topics and suggests that most of this class is "basic algebra". He is also very rude and has yelled at students, 1st math class I've ever failed.

name_title: Luann Homza Professor in the History department at College of William and Mary

ratings.comment: The teacher is lovely, really passionate, and knows what she is talking about. Pretty easy class with only 2 medium sized papers. Teacher is available for feedback. Her lectures are very interesting and its not required to do the reading but you really should. Be prepared to cover the entire Roman Empire in 2 lectures.

She's amazing. Her lectures are always interesting and so are the readings (though there are a lot of them). She's a super sweet person, engages the class with the content, gives really helpful feedback, and is really accessible if you ever need her. Highly reccomend

Professor Homza is so passionate and understanding, grading criteria are clear and fair. This capstone was almost entirely discussion-based and every student leads the discussion for 1 class. You have to do the reading, but it's reasonable and very engaging. Highly recommended.

Witch Hunting was a really fun class, and overall Professor Homza is really great. She can be intimidating at times, but as long as you come to class and do the homework she'll work with you. She's not necessarily the most accommodating for students with attendance accommodations, but the class is still manageable if you're a disabled student.

Might be the best professor in terms of teaching that I've had at W&M. Her lectures are incredible, but you need to at least skim the readings. She cold calls, but won't make you feel bad if you can't answer. Two 5-6 page papers, a midterm, and a final. She's a harsh grader but is more than willing to discuss grades in detail. A great person, too.

name_title: Polly Diven Professor in the Political Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor Diven is very intelligent also very funny. she has spunk, and makes classes interesting. she makes you question things and think about the world around you. She can effectively teach and also can connect with her students on a personal level, unlike a lot of professors we encounter. I reccommend!!

she scares me. I love her as a person but as a prof, she's tough and fierce. I really struggled in her class. She's well educated in the course and provides good insights into the field but the tests were so hard and included so much to study you didnt know where to begin. Also, she will dock you major points for minor grammar issues.

Professor Diven is a no-nonsense instructor who pushes students to think critically. While her blunt style may not suit everyone, I found her engaging lectures and thought-provoking discussions extremely valuable. The coursework can be challenging, but using resources like unstuck AI helped me stay on top of the material.

Professor Diven was a great professor. However, her class material was difficult. Her tests were extremely hard and her preparation for them was subpar. READ THE SYLLABUS. In her class, the blackboard grade does NOT accurately reflect the actual grade. By the end of the semester, I had an A in blackboard and B- on my transcript.

Very strict/tough. Reading the material is crucial, exams are very lengthy and difficult. Wants participation as it's graded. Can be passive with your opinions. Will call out homework/papers/class performance for wrong/sloppy work. Respected, and knows her stuff, but has high standards for her students. Don't take class if you don't want to work.

name_title: Brent Owens Professor in the Geology department at College of William and Mary

ratings.comment: Prof. Owens is absolutely amazing. He is super knowledgeable. Some of the labs and test can be tough but there are plenty of opportunities to make up for lower grades with other assignments, and he's a pretty lenient grader. He loves to crack jokes and his students love him. Doesn't teach right out of the textbook but he does reference it.

Owens is my new favorite professor. He is very caring and allows students to explore areas in geology that they are interested in. There is a lot of writing and presentations, but none were too stressful and Owens was always willing to help. He's passionate about the subject and clearly cares for each individual student too. Highly recommend!

I loved class with Prof Owens this semester. He made class fun and I have learned a lot. He is a self proclaimed easy grader and that is definitely true. I was never stressed about turning in an assignment. We also had no tests or quizzes which was great! If you need a coll150 take it with him if you can!

Reading the Earth is a really fun COLL 150. Prof Owens does a good job keeping the material accessible to non-geology majors and in general is a really nice guy. There are a lot of papers, but none are too long. I had a good time!

Professor Owens is just a great guy. If you are a freshmen and do not not what coll 150 class to take do this one (even if you are not interested in geology at all). It's not too much work and will not stress you out. Sometimes the readings were a little dry, but professor Owens make the classes fun.

name_title: Stephen Rowe Professor in the Philosophy department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Definitely takes a while to get used to how much he rambles; a lot of times when people would ask questions, he would get off track and get confused where he started. He is a caring professor, but it's SO hard to pay attention most of the time. Yes, it's only graded off of three fairly easy papers, but at times I'm not sure if it's worth it.

No need to buy the book if you attend class and just take notes on what classmates bring up. Can be very hard to follow what he says because he tends to ramble but the entire class grade is based on three papers that are fairly simple and as long as you put in effort you will get an A.
Rowes lectures are boring because he rambles but the entire class is graded on 3 papers that are pretty easy to do well on! Hes a good ethics professor!

Rowe is fine. He most definitely knows what he's talking about and makes it apparent that he is very passionate about what he teaches. However, it can sometimes be hard to follow with lectures because he tends to ramble. The class overall was easy, and if you're having trouble, don't be afraid to ask him for help.

This class was very easy other then having to sit in class for 3 hours and do nothing. We only wrote three papers and that is literally your whole grade other then attendance. Pretty easy grader and if you dont care about ethics this is your man.

name_title: Carol Kountz Professor in the Writing department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I was a Creative Writing major taking a "Writing with Style" course, so you'd think I'd at least enjoy myself a little. I hated every second of it. She has NO idea what she's doing. She's either fumbling through folders trying to find homework, or she's rambling wildly away and ultimately saying nothing. Definitely put on the AVOID list.
I took this class first semester freshmen year and it was HARD!  She is always willing to help but assigns pointless assignments.  Really quirky and silly.  She has favorites so get on her good side.
really hard grader!!!!

DO.NOT.TAKE.THIS.PROFESSOR. I'm an English major, always been very good at writing - you think this class is easy because the assignments are a joke, only to find out that she has NO "rubric" or guidelines she can give, yet she will fail you just for fun. INSANE woman. I mean it. Turn away now, you will regret this class.

She's nice, but that doesn't make up for her scatter-brained teaching method. If you ask her a question about an assignment, she has to sit there for several minutes to come up with an answer. Seems to have no course plan or assignment guidelines. She thought her own class was canceled when she saw a sign on the door. Should be forced to retire.

name_title: Richard Lotspeich Professor in the Economics department at Indiana St ate University

ratings.comment: Dr. L really knows his stuff. His knowledge was easily passed onto me. The class is fairly simple as long as you take notes, which he provides on Blackboard as well so you can catch up if you miss something. If you take notes and do the online assignments, and look through old test material ( on Blackboard as well) you will pass the class.

Dr. Lotspeich is the best professor I've had at ISU. He's knowledgeable, passionate, and provides detailed explanations for the work assigned and grading. I find it near impossible to fail ECON 201 with him with all of the resources he provides for you. But you have to be willing to listen in class and look at resources he provides on blackboard

The absolute worst professor I have ever had. Did not notify the class of aplia until we were in class and already had assignments due by the next class. Extremely hard tests, a lot of homework assignments, always lecturing from powerpoints. He makes you look stupid 9/10 times you answer something.

Lotspeich is a brilliant man who knows economics. The textbook is online and if you talk one on one with him and use his office hours you should be fine. Only criticism is that he does go over the time.

The man is a genius. That being said, he will grade you like a genius would. Nice enough guy, but a very rigorous class. Expects 2-3 hours of independent study per hour of class lecture. It is definitely doable, but rather difficult for someone just needing an economic credit. If you like a challenge, go for it. If hesitant, steer clear.

name_title: Jing Chen Professor in the Psychology department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I enjoyed Chen's class. She was pretty funny, and explained content well. She gives extra credit opportunities and always curved the exams. The exams were average difficulty. She tells you exactly what the test will cover with the number of questions on each topic which I found helpful for studying.

Professor Chen was a sweet professor. The layout and course content were easy to follow. Although attendance isn't mandatory, I'd recommend showing up to class. Her exams were mostly topics she covered in class and not content straight from the textbook.

Prof Chen is sweet but this class wasn't for me, even as a psych minor. We read SO MUCH RESEARCH and it can be hard to understand. Her ppts aren't detailed so it can be hard to review content for exams. The exams are pretty difficult, and she doesn't really provide a cohesive study guide for them. Only take this if you're interested in aging.

She thinks the world revolves around her and that her elective is the most important class you will ever take. she is really annoying and the topics in class do not flow together. she expects you to read and memorize the book because she doesn't teach a single thing in class that is on her exams. id recommend not taking her

This class was so enjoyable. Professor Chen always brought a smile to class and never failed to make me have one on my way out of the door. She was caring, understanding, and helpful. Her office hours were always open if you needed help, too. No complaints except sometimes it was difficult to understand her critiques of projects and assignments.

name_title: Jeff Elzinga Professor in the English department at Lakeland University

ratings.comment: confusing and just not up to par.
He's tough and you really don't know where you stand in the class until grades come out but the final is as easy as it gets so all is not bad.
You gave great methods to the research process and helped me in many ways as a writer. Thank you
I didn't take any notes and got an A.
You'll work hard, but you'll learn a hell of a lot from this MASTER teacher. Do

name_title: Karl Elder Professor in the English department at Lakeland University

ratings.comment: Karl Elder has high standards. In my opinion, that is vital to learning and growth. For a professor, having high standards and expecting and encouraging the best from students is all. My experience with Karl was one of the most formative of my life. I learned to appreciate and admire his toughness, for it made me a better person. Forever grateful.

It is not an easy class, but if you work hard and study you will do fine. Some people are not  fans of Karl, but some are. He is scary at first, but if you talk to him during his office hours he is not as scary as people may think.
Prof Elder was the first professor I had a who was willing to give you everything to teach me. Favorite Lakeland prof hands down.
GO TO CLASS, and speak up in class and you will do fine.

People either hate him or love him. I was not a fan. He has MAJOR ego issues and likes to put down people. I tried receiving help from him and he just yelled at me for doing so poor in his course. I did what was expected of me - showed up, did homework, and attempted to pass the daily quizzes. Anyways, I wouldn't suggest him to anyone.

name_title: Ashok Kumar Professor in the Business department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: If you read his reviews, yes he cares and will do anything for students, but he is the most disorganized, technology illiterate, unclear, and hard to understand prof at GVSU. He created his own course/projects/objectives which don't align with the book. Many times left class exasperated about assignments/lectures. Don't need a book, as he wrote one
Very caring and good professor, don't bother buying the textbook, you won't need to use it. Gives plenty of extra credit opportunities so it shouldn't be difficult to finish with an A.

I have never met a professor that wants their students to succeed as much as Professor Kumar wants his students to. He has 24/7 availability and even gives the class his phone number. This class does require a lot of time to work on projects but I think all 366 classes do. He offers A TON of extra credit. I never once touched the book. Take Kumar!!

Do yourself a favor and do not take this class. Kumar is such a tough professor, if it is not his way you will lose points. There are many excel projects and he does not explain them well either. A lot of extra credit, but you cannot pass on that alone. There is not a book which is nice, but maybe one would help..

Kumar is awesome, make sure you do the homework and you're good. He even brought in his cat Gracie for the class to see. Cutest little guy around, I strongly recommend him especially if you like cats.

name_title: Maria Cimitile Professor in the Philosophy department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I would not take Dr. C ever again. She is a tough grader and makes you read a lot. She expects you to be perfect.

Dr. Cimitile is great. She can be a tough grader but that's because she wants you to succeed, and her feedback is really helpful. She gave us the opportunity to rewrite our papers if we wanted to. She cares a lot about her students and is passionate in our discussions. She knows if you're paying attention so stay engaged and off your phone.

Dr. C is tough, but only cause she wants you to succeed. Highly recommend her for the honors college sequence, but beware that there are A LOT of difficult readings to get through. Always there if you want to discuss something or need help, especially because some of the philosophy we read is hard to understand. Major mom energy!!

Dr. Cimitile has been my favorite professor in my 3 years at GVSU. She is so smart and cares about the wellbeing of her students. She assigns lots of readings and there were often weekly quizzes over those readings. The class is discussion based and she makes it all flow very well.
Dr. C is amazing for the First Year Sequence. She is tough at times, but because she cares.

name_title: Joyce Young Professor in the Business department at Indiana St ate University

ratings.comment: Reaching out to this professor with questions before submitting an assignment is key to success in her class. The homework can be confusing at first but becomes easier as the course progresses. Complete every single assignment and you should be fine.

Young's channel structure strategy class was the hardest class I've ever taken. She does not teach any of the material before assignments are due and waits until afterwards to tell you which chapter concepts you should've used. Her grading is tough and inconsistent and she doesn't seem to care if her students succeed. Avoid her if you can!

It's hard to pass a class when the professor teaches the material after the homework is due. If you don't set up the homework correctly be prepared to receive a zero. You can email her for help but you will get the most confusing response that leaves you even more confused.

Young wakes up in the morning and wonders how shes gonna make her students hate their lives .. if you ask for help, well goodluck bc getting a clear answer is next to impossible with her. She intentionally makes everything on blackboard a pain to open and read. She prob got her doctorate just to be called dr. I would never ever recommend her!!!!!

This was an online course, and if the online submission portal was down you simply could not turn in your assignments. She would not accept any email submissions, has no posted office hours, and all In all has been my least favorite professor at Indiana State over my last four years here.

name_title: Jill Warren Professor in the English department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor Warren is great. She truly cares about her students. This class is a lot of work, but it is fun. You tutor all semester, and it is a great learning experience. I loved this class and it taught me so much about teaching reading.

Most unorganized teacher i have ever had. She gets her due dates mixed up in between the different sections, then often pushes the due date back anyways. Often tells one student one thing, and another student something completely different on the same assignment. Just a very frustrating course overall. She will only like you if you suck up.

She gives terrible instructions. Often gets her class sections mixed up and tells us different due dates all the time. I had her for 302 and she liked me so I took her for 308. If you're willing to suck up she will like you. You can not skip her class or she will not like you and you will notice she grades you harder. for your sanity avoid her

Jill is wonderful. She truly wants all of her students to become great teachers, and she pushes them to challenge themselves. She is so knowledgeable and is passionate about what she does. She is inspirational with her stories and lectures, and the texts she chose are so helpful in learning how to be a great teacher. Most definitely take!

She can be unclear at times but just take good notes on everything she expects and you will do fine. She wants you to be a good teacher and you can tell that, so feel free to ask her questions. She loves when you come visit her during her office hours,so do it! No exams but some in class writes. Be ready to tutor all semester 2 hr/wk as well.

name_title: Mark Scroggins Professor in the English department at Florida Atlantic University

ratings.comment: He is extremely intelligent. He gives great lectures which really make the material assessable for every student. He is more than fair when it comes to grading, and he will give useful feedback on every assignment you turn in. So if you can't get a good grade in his class then you have no one to blame but yourself. I would definitely recommend him.

Milton is boring. Paradise Lost is the bomb. This is naturally a difficult course, but Scroggins is a brilliant professor. He tries to make the exams as straightforward as possible, identification and an essay. There are 2 brief papers as well, but this course is a lot of interpreting what you read. Not an easy course, but Scroggins is worth it.

Dr. Scroggins is a respected research scholar, he's passionate and intelligent. His lectures are very engaging and holds your interest. His assignments are typically 1-2 pages, but make certain the format is on point. Very reasonable grader, do the reading or you will not be able to write your papers. He hates filler and he knows if you read or not

Amazing teacher , brilliant man. I am glad I had him for my first semester ever at FAU. Intro to lit study was 3 essays no quiz no test . Teaching style is very conversational , does not sit and lecture on and on . Will go off topic is conversation leads that way . Hard but fair grader. Willing to help
It is surprising that "Dr. Weiss" does not teach Latino Literature, since he knows A WHOLE LOT about Latin America.

name_title: John Groves Professor in the Humanities department at Ferris St ate University

ratings.comment: I already reviewed this prof and they took it down. I'm writing another one, if that tells you anything. I saved this class for my last semester thinking it would be a fun class. I'm typically an A student but had to write extra papers to make up for bad test grades. Didn't help to study. Questions include films not in syllabus. Biased content.

I would not take him. There are a lot of quizzes, tests, and essays. He grades super hard on essays. I would get help from a tutor and still not do as good as I wanted. He's okay and manageable but its a lot.

Horrible. Hardest class ever. Ruined my GPA. Said America's Godzilla was just "better" on an exam, while there was a factually correct answer... 100% biased class and you have to just say what he wants to hear. Really tough grader...horrible just awful
This was one of my favorite professors. He can seem tough, for the exams are essays with a time limit. But the in class reviews before exams help so much and he gives all the answers.

Despite mandatory lectures, he offered many opportunities for extra credit, just participate in conversation with thoughtful answers for EC. The lecture before the exam, he would tell you the answers to all the potential questions. There are unit quizzes, but they are all online and you get 3 attempts-best score submits. He is an easy pass!

name_title: Donna Smith Professor in the Communic ation department at Ferris St ate University

ratings.comment: She was a funny professor, but all of your grades were based on papers or assignments. There was no extra credit, and she graded extremely strict on grammar and acidemia writing. Even papers from the writing center got 10s or 11s out of 15. Tests were very easy if you attended the lectures. Mandatory semester group paper worth 75 points.

I love Dr. Smith! Shes a tough grader, but if you go to her office hours to ask her how you can correct your papers for future papers, shes willing to do that. She gives reviews for tests and the test questions are the exact same as the review. Shes also very caring, she was willing to help me through a difficult situation. Dr. Smith is awesome

At first she is strict and doesn't seem to care but she does. When you get to know her she has a great personality and is funny. She wants her students to succeed and answers all the questions you have. She is very clear on what she wants so if you can do that you will be fine! Would definitely take her again.
Dr. Smith can be critical, but she is not critical in how she grades. She explains what you have to do to get an A and helps you improve.

Dr. Smith was amazing. She kept lecture so interesting and was hilarious. I learned so much and the final was the exact study guide. As long as you follow her grading criteria on speeches, you will get an A.

name_title: Robert Mc Glinn Professor in the Computer Science department at Southern Illinois University - Carbondale

ratings.comment: Ol' school mentality. Won't hesitate to say exactly what he thinks especially if he thinks you are not giving your best. Can be very blunt, but fair for the most part. Very knowledgeable and willing to help if you convince him you put int some work and not looking for an easy answer. You will be a better programmer when you complete his class.
One of the hardest prof's you'll ever have. One of the fairest prof's you'll ever have. He's only a pain if you don't do the work
Very knowledgeable about computer science and very intelligent.  Creative and challenging projects.  Clearly he cares about students and SIUC.

Avoid Him and his Electives!  One of the most stuborn people I have had to deal with!  Has an attitude from the start.  Cant even ask a clairification question with out, did you not listen in class.  Avoid the office visits or you will get the, "Change Your Major Speech" This Guys Got Head Problems.   Leave the School you Grumpy old man!

DO NOT TAKE CLASS WITH THIS INSTRUCTOR PERIOD,  HE WILL CERTAINLY MAKE YOU CHANGE YOUR MAJOR, UNPROFESSIONAL TEACHER, ASK ANYONE AND THEY WILL TELL YOU THAT HE IS A ROUGH TEACHER.  HE IS NOT FRIENDLY, TESTS ARE REALLY TOUGH, MAKES YOU WRITE PROGRAM THE FIRST DAY OF CLASS DUE IN COUPLE OF DAYS.  DO NOT TAKE WITH HIM.

name_title: Michael Sullivan Professor in the M athem atics department at Southern Illinois University - Carbondale

ratings.comment:
Sullivan is retiring this year, but his class was great. I had some very shaky algebra knowledge that made some early weeks very difficult, but as I went on, it really wasn't all that bad. Good examples in class and quiz/test content is clearly indicated beforehand. If it wasn't, the curve was pretty large. 
Fun guy and class if you do the work.

While I have heard many negative things about this class and Dr. Sullivan, I was surprised. While the course itself is quite difficult, if you put in the work and go to class, you will do well. Lots of homework, and tests require a lot of studying. Dr. Sullivan is very personable, and while he may be a little awkward, you can tell he cares.

Taking his classes online was difficult. He schedules his exams during the most inconvenient time, OUTSIDE of the scheduled lecture time. He literally uploads videos of him reading a notes sheet as a lecture. The concepts are complicated & difficult and he is not very helpful when explaining them unless you ask a VERY specific question. Frustrating
He is very very fast paced, skips steps within his examples because he expects you to already know it. Terrible notes and handwriting. Over 50 problems on the homework every week or few days.
Hard but very fair. As long as you go to class you'll do well

name_title: Dale Bengston Professor in the History department at Southern Illinois University - Carbondale

ratings.comment: Class was interesting. Uses 3 text books. Gave me great study guides for tests.  Recommended!

A particularly interesting course, made much more so by the prof.  His stories kept me attentive, even during the daily grind of summer semester.  His Religious Diversity in America course is a must take.  This guy's got it together.

I took Dr. Bengston's Intro to Religion class about seven years ago.  Even after going on to complete a Masters degree, his class remains one of the most profound, interesting courses I have taken to date.  Thank you.
For Bengston I would read the text in preparation for test.  He won't tell you that then he'll nail you.  Luckily he's not a really tough grader.
Got an A, this guy is very good, very easy, cool, and knows his stuff.

name_title: David Kammler Professor in the M athem atics department at Southern Illinois University - Carbondale

ratings.comment: This guy is super nice, a great teacher and the assignments take a decent amount of time but if you do them you will get an A.

He is a very considerate person and has a down to earth concern about the well-being of others. His questions will make you self reflect at times. He pays attention and is willing to give advice/support.  I think he can spot out intentions in others pretty well.  He knows his stuff and is a great resource. Overall... a guy with good character.

Course is toooo difficult. I really enjoyed and learned a lot. Very helpful. When I took the course people asked me why do you pain yourself by taking this course. But, Its really worth taking pain in learning.
Best teacher EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!
He's been teaching for so long, he's just lost it. Wont work out the problems on the board, wont bend or explain, or slow down. Makes an already hard subject even harder than it already is.

name_title: Ronald Mellor Professor in the History department at University of California Los Angeles (UCLA)

ratings.comment: Overall good
Easy A. The guy obviously knows a lot, but he's just going through the motions. The grade is based on two 500 word papers, a midterm and a final. You get study guides and lots of time to study them.

this guy is awesome. the class is interesting.  the lectures are always fun. mid terms are essays he hands out before hand and this quarter he gave us all the easy ones on the midterm and final.  he is so interesting and knowledgable.

There is a disconnect between the lecture and the difficulty of the papers and exams.  The lectures are really relaxed Mellor makes the class seem really easy.  But the graders are really tough.  Most people got B's on the first paper as a result. The lectures have no point...just read and you will be fine.
He has fun lectures, but they are not that relevant to the tests. Anything you need can be wiki'ed anyway. Some slides go by fast so you might want to bring a camera to class.

name_title: Robert W atson Professor in the English department at University of California Los Angeles (UCLA)

ratings.comment: His lectures are highly intriguing and entertaining. He is basically up there theatrically performing Shakespeare with such a passion that you can't help but be enthralled. He once abruptly dropped to his knees as he reenacted a scene from king Lear. He's brilliant.

This class is a joke! He uses his students as a platform to perform pre-written essays in 75 minute sessions. He presents outlandish theories that he mentions his colleagues disagree with him on (Romeo raped Juliet?), but teaches them as fact. Don't take this class unless you want to be brainwashed by his bizarre, egotistical notion of "reality."

Words simply cannot express how amazing Professor Watson and his class were. Due to his enlightening lectures I have developed greater interest for Shakespeare. It was the best experience I have ever made and I can only encourage any student who likes to put effort into his or her studies to take a class with Professor Watson!

Absolutely brilliant!  Apart from his deep knowledge and passion for the subject, his charismatic and passionate style during lectures made the hours fly like minutes. I was always sad when the lecture was over.  You are privileged if you can learn from this erudite and learned man!
He was ok. His lectures had nothing to do with the questions he gave on exams.

name_title: Norman Carver Professor in the Computer Science department at Southern Illinois University - Carbondale

ratings.comment: He was incredibly disrespectful to the students and behaved rather immaturely at times in his emails and communications. He seems to expect absolute respect but offers little respect to those around him. I'm going to avoid him like the plague.

Listen up. Funny guy, but he can go on tangents like crazy. Exams are 90% of your grade, so studying the lecture slides he posts and completing your labs are essential. He makes sure you know what youre doing if you want to pass. Hell rant about OSs he hates and waste all the class time though. So, have fun I guess.

Possibly just had a bad experience, but I found Dr. Carver to be disrespectful and unprofessional. Don't focus on labs because each multiple choice test question counts more than an entire lab. Limit questions or be prepared to get stack overflow type responses where you get called out no matter what type of question you ask.

Class covers some difficult content. Felt as though more specific coding examples were not offered with explanations, so be ready to try and learn as much as you can from in class. Responsive outside of class though, as long as you don't mind his condescending, borderline snarky attitude. Be ready to work for your grade!

Pretty harsh when asking questions and really knows how to make you feel dumb even if you are right; he loves to use words like "obviously" and "I do not understand what you do not see." Spent 25-35 hours on labs and got an average of an 80 on all of them. (2) Tests are less than an hour and count 80% of your grade. I have nothing good to say :(

name_title: Robert Gurval Professor in the Classics department at University of California Los Angeles (UCLA)

ratings.comment: I don't like him. I asked him to regrade my paper and he didn't look at it and just said that whatever my TA said goes and wouldn't help me learn

History teachers can get bad. He, abeit a bit boring, was really dependable and nice. He gave study guides, posted his lectures and even planned voluntary class field trips. Although some of the lectures were off topic and not interesting (he doesn't have the same interests as students...) he was a good professor.
Wonderful.
Very nice guy.
Professor Gurval brings Roman history to life!

name_title: Tom Frazel Professor in the Classical Studies department at Tulane University

ratings.comment: He's a really nice and funny guy and will help you if you are struggling. It's practically impossible to get an A since his grading scale is 95+ = A, but an A- is possible, even if you only look at SparkNotes for the readings. But you have to go to all the lectures and take notes to pass.

I absolutely loved Greek Drama, and loved Professor Frazel. The course itself is very interesting to me, and Professor Frazel is extremely passionate about the subject which makes it that much more fun to learn. He is funny and understanding of any struggles that college students inevitably face, and truly cares about the wellbeing of his students.

Nice guy, by far the worst Latin teacher I've ever had. Jumps between unrelated topics, is disorganized, and teaches the simplest concepts in a convoluted manner. Cracks random jokes making the material even more confusing, shows clear favoritism towards certain students, and calls himself "the committee". Would be better off just reading the book.

One of the best profs I have ever had. He cares about his students, gives incredible lectures, and his quirky jokes are the best. He does expect a lot of reading (that cannot be spark-noted) out of you, but the reading is really interesting. Getting an A- wasn't too hard, but getting an A seems almost impossible.

Professor Frazel really wants his students to succeed. I had so many questions all semester, and he was accessible over office hours, email, and right after class. There is a quiz every week, but if you take notes in class and do the homework, you will do fine in this class. I think he is hilarious, and I am taking him again next semester.

name_title: Gregg Dimkoff Professor in the Business department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor Dimkoff is an engaging lecturer who brings finance concepts to life through humor and real-world examples. The class is structured around the textbook, which can be challenging, but using resources like Unstuck ai alongside the lectures helps with study prep.

This was actually 380 and there were tons of work but it is required by the CFP board. ONLY TAKE IF YOU WANT TO BECOME CFP. This is not worth it unless you want to become CFP because there is so much work. However it is not graded super hard

I struggled taking this professor for an early zoom class due to his struggles with technology and longwinded stories that were hard to follow the point of for class topics. I would not recommend a zoom or an 8:30am class with this professor due to his teaching style if you want to take him.

I loved finance 331 with Gregg. He is an amazing professor who is extremely funny and knowledgable. He makes lectures very entertaining and tells lots of jokes. Be careful to pay attention in class because sometimes he will talk about a topic, but in a joke format. Read then re read text book and practice old exams and you will do fine!

Gregg is amazing. He is extremely friendly and very knowledgeable about what he teaches. The exams are difficult because they cover a lot of material and ask very specific questions. However, you will be okay because he grades on a bell curve, so your grade is based on class ranking, with 70% of students getting some form of A or B. Take his class!

name_title: Kelly Parker Professor in the Philosophy department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Really nice man who really does try to help students. I only wish that he graded on more things so my grade would have been higher. His classes are pretty much all lectures but it's a nice class to do other work in and isn't one that you need to be awake and alert for. Will probably take him again.

Wow. all I can say is do not take this professor if you are looking for a good grade. This philosophy 101 class was the lowest grade I have received in college this year. He only grades you on 5 quizzes for 15 points ALL YEAR. On top of all that, his lectures are extremely boring. He literally whispers through the entire class. Do not take him.

Terrible. Terrible. Terrible. Avoid. Avoid. Avoid. Rants in class. Horrible handwriting. Capstone project with slim guidance no organization. Do everything yourself. He grades by the project presentation, 10 page paper on the presentation, and a portfolio about the presentation. Insane. Participation points as well but just puts in random numbers.

Nice guy but just talks about things unrelated to the course for a majority of the lecture. Only one 200 point paper in the gradebook for the entire semester currently. No exams, all group project. Grades very particular and handwriting is hard to read. Take someone else if you can because this is a CAPSTONE class.

Professor Parker is a very nice guy, on the other hand his lectures are dreadful to sit through. He talks about stuff you don't even need to know for hours and you get nothing from the class. One positive though is if you take it in the fall semester, he will take you to art prize. overall wouldn't take his course again.

name_title: K ate Remlinger Professor in the English department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I had 10 minutes to get from my other class to hers, but it was a mile away, literally. I never got to her class in under 12-13. so I asked for some leeway since it counted for points and she sent me the equivalent of a too bad, so sad email. She still docked my grade by half every day. Literally acts like its junior high. Dont take her ever.
Her class was very content heavy and she grades way too harshly. She is a nice person but the class is very difficult.

Dr. Remlinger is a hard grader, that cannot be said enough, but as someone who has had her for 2+ years, she has changed for the better. She listens to her students and offers plenty of help outside of class. She is willing to work with students who meet with her and are active in class.

Very boring class and subject, we take 2 minutes before every class as down time right before she hits you with phonetics and phonology, one of the most complicated subjects to learn at GV. Grades every assignment as if its a final exam. Extremely picky about how to format the heading of your assignment, not just essays, literally assignment.

This class is all massive amounts of busy work on things you had to teach yourself. Most classes were her giving random facts from her knowledge base that were only mildly related to the required content or going over the homework. Unrealistic expectations for most taking the class.

name_title: Lawrence Manglitz Professor in the English department at Grand Rapids Community College

ratings.comment: Very intelligent and good lecturer.   If you are interested in literature the course is very interesting. Some students only wanted liberal arts credit.  They may not have enjoyed his intelligence so much.
Larry is usually discovered by his students  later during the academic year when they wish t purseu further what they so far learnt.
Inspiring man of letters
He has been my first Literature teacher and still keeps in touch. I have enjoyed his lectures and teaching much more than any other subject. Thanks Larry.From Nabi Eren
A man of letters and wisdom

name_title: Kimberly Wyngarden Professor in the English department at Grand Rapids Community College

ratings.comment: This is hands down the worse class Ive ever taken. She is a terrible teacher and treats everyone like a child. Knit picks every single assignment and just overall is a nice person but terrible English teacher. Should teach creative writing.

Professor Wyngarden expects if you take her creative writing class, you'll give creative writing your best effort; don't take it as a blow off class. You get lots of feedback from her, and she sets it up so you'll get a ton of feedback from classmates too. If you want to talk further about your writing outside of class, she will make time for you.

no extra credit, so many useless papers, and sometimes rude to students. Ultimately, she tries to "leave an imprint" on her students, but it just is annoying and weird. I would recommend taking another professor for EN 102 because honestly she is annoying. Also, doesn't use blackboard for grading which is also annoying.

She gives out many assignments at a time or back to back. She also does not give barely any class time to work on projects, if she does then she talks a lot and no work can actually be done. She is very positive and understanding. Gives good feedback and cares about every single student. She gets excited with participation and gets choked up.

She's clear about what papers you're going to have to do and what they weigh in terms of your grade, so make sure to not forget them. I forgot one paper and it caused me to get an A- instead of an A. Make sure to get the poem and short story done ahead of time. You can tell that she is passionate about what she's teaching. Overall, it was alright.

name_title: Debra Fried Professor in the English department at Cornell University

ratings.comment: She rambles A LOT. The entire class consisted of her "lecturing" which wasted the opportunity to discuss in the small class. She was fun and interesting at times, but usually very boring. Worst of all, there were very few grades. I never knew how I was doing in the class. I feel that my grade did not reflect my knowledge of the material accurately.

Debra is great.  Her lectures, although tangential most of the time, are really insightful and interesting.  She is super helpful one on one, so definitely take advantage of that.  Rarely gives back papers, but when she does her comments are attentive and good.  You can tell she has read your paper, but she won't give them back..?  Take her class

Professor Fried is absolutely brilliant! She is also extremely helpful if you approach her during the office hour. With so much credential under her belt, she has an extraordinary patience as a lecturer and often infuses the supposedly boring lecture with rare insights. She might possibly be one of the English professors at Cornell.

Haha oh, Debra... the type of professor who's so off the wall, you take for granted how insightful her lectures are. She's an engaging lecturer in a very bizarre way and unintentionally hilarious. I enjoyed her class, but it sometimes made me want to die. Regardless, she made boring rennaisance literature interesting, which is a tough thing to do.
Brilliant.

name_title: Peimin Ni Professor in the Philosophy department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Sometimes difficult to understand due to language barrier, however he is such a smart and inspirational professor. Professor Peimin knows so much about what he teaches and is super good at sharing his knowledge.

This professor is amazing and you can tell he is passionate about what he teaches. Each week there is a reflection journal, but it is not bad at all and you can do it with a partner. Overall great person and he is super inspirational, you can tell he is very smart. There are pop quizzes, but you do it twice once alone and once with peers.

Just an all-around inspirational guy. I feel like some students may have taken him for granted or maybe they were just too shy to tell him, but he really is inspirational. His way of viewing life doesn't come off as romanticized at all, and it is actually inspirational and caring. When it comes to life he might be the most wise person I've met.

I love this professor! I had him for an upper level philosophy course, you can tell he is passionate and really cares about his students! There was a lot of reading and homework, and attendance was mandatory but he gave ample opportunities to earn back points. Overall I highly recommend him!

He treats the class like it is 300 level, has attendance weighted very high in the grade book and if you miss more than two class periods your grade will suffer. He grades tough too and there is a 1 page reflection due every week that you must have a good question in order to get 10/10, otherwise it is unlikely you will get full credit.

name_title: Timothy Bulson Professor in the Communic ation department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Bulson was my favorite professor at GVSU. He was so helpful and caring. He always allowed me to makeup work when I was absent and gave us snacks and let us out early often. His teachings were so engaging, which made me actually look forward to coming to class. Would 100% take him again.

Bulson was my favorite professor at GVSU. He was so helpful and flexible when it came to making up work. The class was engaging, fun and had a reasonable amount of work. He often provided snacks and let us out early to make class even more fun.
Amazing professor that gives amazing lectures. Assignments are pretty fun and never too difficult.

Best professor I have had at GV. He care so much about the topic and his students! He is also just the sweetest man ever. The workload was more than tolerable. Although I am not a health com major, I found the class interesting.

Tim is such a great professor and truly brings his classroom to life. As he offered a hybrid model, he was very lenient and made accommodations when necessary. Being a communications professor, I would say keeping in contact with him with any questions and concerns is your best route. Assignments were straightforward and expectations were clear.

name_title: Paul Fishback Professor in the M athem atics department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Fishback can be funny, but his teaching style is hit-or-miss. The lectures can be unclear, but the resources help fill in the gaps. Lots of tests, but you get chances to pass. Try unstuckstudy for extra study prep!
Meet the learning targets. Preview assignments are graded for correctness so you actually have to try on those.

He has clear expectations for his students, but will help you reach those expectations. His lectures were engaging and we did a lot of in-class activities which I enjoyed and learned a lot from. Just make sure to pass the learning targets and go to office hours for help and you'll be golden.
Except for the unit circle, this class was dope!

Good professor, you just need to know the unit circle to succeed. The amount of learning targets I missed because I still have not learned the unit circle, despite learning about it in middle school is insane.

name_title: Mike Lofchie Professor in the Political Science department at University of California Los Angeles (UCLA)

ratings.comment: He is a great Professor who knows his material well. The readings are a must as well as going to lecture is you want an A. If not you can do one or the other. He is enthusiastic, clear, and amazing. Take him if possible.

He reminds me of the guy from the movie 'Up', only way happier.  He loves what he teaches about, and makes it seem like political institutions are the most important thing in the world.  After a quarter, i began to think so too.  Great guy, always available in office hours, and very helpful with any problems you may have.
20 years ago, but still remember him as a great prof and cool guy.
So nice! explains everything so clearly. very helpful. made me so interested in the topic of the class. I actually enjoyed lecture. he is so intelligent.
So nice! so helpful! explains everything so clearly! got an A!!!

name_title: Gilberto Schleiniger Professor in the M athem atics department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Professor Schleiniger is a really nice guy and a good professor. He truly seems to care about his students and will make an effort to get to know you. He clearly knows the material, but some examples he uses in class are too complicated to be practical. Grading is very fair and exams/quizzes always cover what we learn in class.

He's a very sweet person and does offer some help. He would constantly mess up algebra and would make it harder to understand. Grades are dependent on midterms, which are hard to get good scores on unless you fully understand the concepts. I feel like I understood mostly but still ended with a C because of the weirdly difficult formats.

Professor Schleiniger makes lectures very confusing and difficult to understand. You will have to self study for the whole class, TA office hours were helpful but besides that be prepared to learn the content on your own time. Midterms and quizzes are graded harshly.

I actually did not have Gilberto for this course, I had Raymond. I went to one of the review sessions for the second math midterm and he was absolutely amazing. He is such a nice guy. The course itself was manageable and the content wasn't too hard to learn. I would take Gilberto over Raymond, but you can succeed with either professor.

Very sweet and caring. Wants to help you suceed and better understand math. Differential is tough but if you go to office hours he will help with homework. He will help by making sure you understand the linear algrebra and algrebra side if you do not understand how he got there. Homeworks are tough. Understand HW makes exams easier.

name_title: Anthony Nieuwkoop Professor in the Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: He is the worst professor I have had here. Just reads right off the powerpoint for lecture and makes it so hard to pay attention and want to come to class. He lost 2 of my assignments and i emailed him 4 times and talked to him in class twice about it and he never fixed it so it ended up dropping my grade. 4 exams and he does curve them.

He was a decent professor but NEVER responds to emails. I emailed him over 10 times with no response (yes I used the right email). Exams are tough but he usually gives a curve. Has small easy assignments that are 100pts added together. Overall with medium effort you should get an A. Always read the chapters and powerpoints.

This class is definitely a class where you have to teach yourself. His lectures are super boring, all he does is read off his powerpoint slides and there always at least 60 slides per powerpoint. Hes a super nice guy, but not a good teacher. Your main grades are 4 tests and the final is not cumulative. He also gives huge curves on tests.

Largely reads off of a powerpoint. One of those classes where you won't do much but be bored in class. I prefer active interaction with Profs & students (keeps me awake). Memorization heavy, long exams (3 + final). Overall a ton of information you have to somehow retain quickly. (If you're premed, get used to it.) Not a bad choice for Micro though.

AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COSTS especially for lecture. As an average B student I can say he is awful. Don't be surprised to see 100+ slide powerpoint lectures and for him to read word for word, he gives little explanation for these. Your grade is 4 exams and no extra credit. Many errors on exams & no help at his office hours. NURSES-DON'T TAKE

name_title: George Lundskow Professor in the Sociology department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: In this class, everyone had to be the professor for two days and pretty much give a 75 min lecture on something they thought was important and interesting. Although it was extremely nerve racking, the prof is so nice and caring so I can't complain about much

Going into this class I did not know what to expect but ultimately it was one of my favorite SOC classes. Prof Lundskow knows how to facilitate discussion and ask probing questions... something a lot of professors lack. His discussion questions really added to the class and made it an engaging environment. I wish I could take this class again!

Professor Lundskow is one of my favorite professors! I really do believe that when people say his lectures are boring and his class in not stimulating, are lying. I found him to be fairly passionate about social issues and is very intellectual when speaking on them. You're allowed to miss twice until it affects your grade,which is super achievable

I see people on here are saying that the lectures are boring, but they aren't that bad, some of them are really interesting! And if I was getting bored I would play solitaire. There is no homework, except for a group presentation the second half of the semester. All tests were online, and really easy. I would definitely take this class again.
Decently easy class, nice prof, large group project at the end of the course.

name_title: N athaniel Grossman Professor in the M athem atics department at University of California Los Angeles (UCLA)

ratings.comment: He is passionate about Math & shows interest in the students. If you never miss class you can easily get an A. He also makes the class fun, never boring. One of my favorite professors at UCLA. Really nice, polite, helpful.

Taking his class, I felt like a light weight going up against Mike Tyson. Nathaniel Grossman was the first Math professor I had at UCLA in 1989. I came from one of the worst high schools in the LAUSD. I was completely unprepared for his class and failed.
Smart but cannot teach

Grossman is adorable :) I would go to his office for help and he was very inviting. I took 135a and b with him back in 2002. They are upper divison classes and there is a certain amount of work that you should be able to do for yourself. But I have heard  that he is difficult for the lower divisions. He is a flippin genious :) Go Grossman
Prof Grossman is a good professor.  He is very approachable and seems eager to assist students with their learning.  As I enjoyed the course, I don't know why so many peeps are bagging on him.

name_title: Charlie Thomas Professor in the Accounting department at Illinois St ate University

ratings.comment: The whole class is just copying what he writes on a legal pad. The homework is meh, not that many questions but you get 3 tries. The exams are HARD, the study guides are pretty vague, but make sure you start studying at least a week in advance. Tony Bell on YouTube was a life saver for understanding the material. Accounting is hard in general.

Amazing. The way he teaches directly corporates to homework and exams. Grade based off of 4 exams and weekly homework assignments. He's so helpful and really wants you to succeed. Remembers his students. Loved him.

Professor Thomas' ACC131 class is challenging, but with the right approach it can be manageable. The exams are tough, so staying on top of the material and using resources like Unstuck study for study prep is key. Overall, it's a worthwhile class if you're willing to put in the work.

He is a good guy and a decent professor. Attendance isn't mandatory but he does attendance quizzes randomly. Examples done in class don't really match the test, so you need to do outside work to pass with a good grade. If you take good notes, get extra help you will pass. But if you're going just to go and not take good notes you'll fail

Terrible teacher. The tests don't correlate with anything he does in class, he does practice problems all class with awful handwriting and doesn't take any time for students to write down his work. His tests are multiple choice questions that he doesn't talk about during class he just expects you to know them. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS

name_title: Brian Ackerman Professor in the Psychology department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Dr. Ackerman's class is one worth taking. We had 9 short papers and 2 terrifying exams-- this class was by no means easy. However, I learned SO much. He gives you a new perspective that you will apply to all future psych classes (and all other classes) Yes, this class might not help your gpa, but you learn a ton!

Absolutely love this professor. Do not skip class as he does not use sakai and writes all notes on a projector (or have a friend give you good notes). Have to pay attention to what he says in class. 2 exams and about 9 papers (second writing course) but the exam questions are USUALLY the same as the paper topics. Really gets to know his students

Literally thought I was going to have to withdrawal, but I am SO glad I didn't. Dr. Ackerman will change your perspective on life. That being said, don't take this class unless ur willing to work. 2 all essay exams and 3 page paper due every week. It's all memorization so take good notes and study consistently. Going to office hours helps as well.

It seems impossible at first. u need to go to class everyday&take good notes-i recorded him on my phone which I HIGHLY recommend. 2 exams on a lot of material. I got As on both purely by memorizing. He grades papers hard but they don't really matter(i got cs on them). In the end I'm really happy I took him. u actually learn in his class. just study

He's brilliant and hilarious, but this class is not easy. You have to learn his way of lecturing. It's sometimes hard to follow him. VERY tough grader, and the 2 essay tests are way harder than the writing assignments. He is extremely picky about what he wants from his students. That being said, I learned a ton from his class and am glad I took it.

name_title: Marie-Christine Delbeau Professor in the Music department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: awesome! great passion for music, really hilarious but relatable metaphors/similes, always willing to help!
Great teacher!!

Awesome professor, completely dedicated to music, understanding of classes getting in the way of practice, helpful with any and all problems, gives great advice. She has the BEST metaphors/comparisons ever.
Great professor, love of music allows her to be a fantastic teacher. Definitely presses you to play your best, but the push has made me into a better musician

It is a pleasure having professor Delbeau as an instructor.  She has helped me progress so much as a piano student.  Very encouraging and also helpful.  I have much more confidence in my playing and I have learned how to have fun with the music that I play.  She is a performer and a teacher which makes her teaching so much more efficient.

name_title: Spring Davidson Professor in the Accounting department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: She was very nice and pretty clear. Easy class, just do the work. If you go to talk to her she is helpful, but she is a bit of a stickler for the university's rules, so don't miss an exam.

Took for MISY160. She shows up late every single day. and i mean EVERY day. a little forgetful and confused, attendance is not mandatory or necessary by any means (except when you are learning access/excel, or the class before an exam). but she is nice. definitely take if you would like an easier A or to learn how to make a spreadsheet

Attendance isn't mandatory. A lot of material to cover, so her lectures are vague. Definitely need to read and take notes. She puts up practice quizzes and uses a lot of questions on those for the test. A lot of homework, but it's relatively easy, just takes time. Excel and Access exams are open book.

spring is a very nice lady who doesn't care if you show up.  Her test are long and ridiculous and all there are so many unnecessary projects that are just a waste of time and are there to help you learn the material but they don't.  You just really need to know your stuff to do well in this class.

One of the best professors Ive had a UD.  So laid back, I actually took a class that conficted with hers so she let me take the tests when it was best for me. I don't know what the fool below me was thinking, he was probably one of the students that got plagerizing which is hilarious because all of her tests are open book.  Take her!

name_title: Mehdi Razzaghi Professor in the M athem atics department at Bloomsburg University

ratings.comment: He was alright, we met over zoom and it was very hard to pay attention. His lectures are very boring and  I found it hard to stay focused. Pearson assignments weekly, all tests are on Pearson. There were three total exams (including midterm and final). If you think you can pay attention, I recommend.

I honestly think he was a great professor. He really knows what he's talking about and I found him to be very helpful and easy to understand. As long as you participate and go to class you should be fine. He assigns hw every week, and the exams aren't too bad as long as you know what you're doing.
he was amazing

You are able to watch "videos" that consist of prof talking and PP on screen. if prof is pointing to show you something, you actually can't see it. textbook is useless as the prof wrote it so if listening lectures do not help, text wont either .If given the opportunity - I would take this class in person, with a different professor.

I took him online for stats. The class was just videos of him lecturing over slides. He definitely makes himself available to students, but it was difficult to understand him with the low mic quality and accent. Exams were very hard and I learned more watching YouTube stats videos than his lectures. A nice guy but this was the hardest class ever.

name_title: George Milner Professor in the Anthropology department at Penn St ate University

ratings.comment: Love Dr. Milner but this class made me want kms.

This is class was amazing. I learned so much information by the end of the semester. If you want to do well, get a copy of Tim White's The Bone Manual and go to lab hours. Also, try to participate as much as you can in class.

Really knows what he's talking about. He's such a nice person. Although lectures can sometimes be dry, the course material is interesting and the labs are helpful. Tests can be challenging but they are curved so that like half the class gets As. Highly recommend going to TA office hours.
Terribly hard class, but he was a beautiful man and always helpful. He's gorgeous. I love him. He should teach forever.

This prof knows everything possible about skeletal archaeology!  He has study days in class where you can study with your friends with the material.  He hands you the notes so you only have to use the text has a reference.  He truly cares about his students understanding the information.  Make sure you go to labs.  If you do--you'll ace the class!

name_title: Alex Joffe Professor in the Anthropology department at Penn St ate University

ratings.comment:
