Gave me multiple Academic Integrity Reports a week.

Absolutely loved this class.
One of the most hilarious professors ever
i'd heard about him being cool and all and it was right
he's still great
had reputation for being really hard grader but a really good teacher.

name_title: Michelle Craske Professor in the Psychology department at University of California Los Angeles (UCLA)

ratings.comment: Michelle Craske announced that she herself is a white supremacist twice in front of a group of students each time so I suffer feeling terrorized a year later.
Not really supportive. Got nowhere with her after a long time.
Extremely knowledgable about anxiety disorders-if you show willingness to learn and grow-she will support you all the way!

I am now in grad school in another state but I still use the text and remember what a great prof she was.  She is not boring, just low-key.  Approach for help and she will. Loved the class. Taking a grad version of it this coming Fall.
Dr. Craske may seem hard to approach or too quiet and shy.  But approach her any way and you'll find that she's amazing!

name_title: Mary Antony Bair Professor in the Educ ation department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Mary is a great professor. She truly cares about her students and their learning. I would strongly recommend her for anyone needing the take 660. There is a good amount of work but she makes it manageable.

Mary made research seem attainable, simple, and clear. When my head was buzzing with ideas she said a few things and sorted it out for me. Blackboard was a great resource, full of the examples and checklists and structure I needed. There area always chances to revise for this class. Quizzes are take it until you get 100%. The point is the learning.
omg she is the best prof ever!
One of the best professors I've had, undergraduate or graduate school.
I would suggest this professor to anyone, he wants all to succeed.

name_title: Tim Strickler Professor in the Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Loved taking Dr. Strickler for my capstone class! He was so laid back , and he really taught us a lot about life beyond college. He had amazing life stories, and he would always have food waiting for us when we walked in for a snack. You read one book the whole semester, and write about 4 papers. He is such a good prof, and I hope he knows that!

Strickler is such a chill guy, he's worth getting to know. However, his exams are DIFFICULT and they are the only things contributing to your overall grade. You have 4 lecture and 4 lab exams all weighted equally. Lectures were very boring, but he gives you all the notes ahead of time so you don't have to worry about missing anything

Great professor, probably the smartest I have ever had. Always keeps the class entertained with fun random facts and cool t-shirts. Only down side is that your entire grade is made up from 4 lecture exams and 4 lab exams, all of which are very difficult no matter how much you study

Great teacher.  Definitely knows his stuff and is willing to help anyone who asks. His lectures are long but he gives you notes so all you have to do it highlight the main parts. The class in general is a hard class but if you put in the effort it will pay off.
Awesome prof.  It doesn't get much better than Strickler.

name_title: Bill Hosterman Professor in the Fine Arts department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Bill is a kind person. But he doesn't budge on the attendance policy. No matter your circumstances, you will be marked absent if you don't go to class. And by 6 absences, you're out and withdraw or fail. But besides that, he's a good professor when it comes to feedback on your drawings. And if you are struggling to draw something, he loves to help.

very good drawing teacher. class was sometimes a bit boring because he would just kind of talk for a long time, but he said useful things. gives good feedback and works with everyone individually. genuinely wants to see everyone do a good job and will help you if you're not quite getting something. overall nice guy.
Taking this class really improved my drawing capabilities. Bill is a tough grader, but gives great feedback on each piece and you can tell he genuinely cares about your progress in the class.

He's great at giving constructive criticism to anybody of any skill level. I'm not much of a drawer myself, but he definitely helped me improve a lot. His grading is a little tough, but a lot of the criteria is fairly easy to meet if you at least show that you're trying. Attendance is very mandatory. Would take if you want to improve your drawing.

Bill is a good guy and gives very good feedback, but he's a harsh grader. He talks more than any other professor that I've known and his demos end up being 30 minutes longer than they should be, but it's good information and he makes it pretty interesting.

name_title: Rick Weis Professor in the Fine Arts department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: This class was online, but I really enjoyed having him as a professor. He gives good feedback, which can become a little confusing at times, but easy to email any questions. Not a heavy work load, just do everything on time and you'll be set!

I took this class online and it was asynchronous. I had a pretty easy time with it and I was going into this class with very little experience. You definitely have to work hard on the projects. The projects can be a bit confusing at first but he gives very good feedback. Make sure to email him and make edits based on his feedback.
Rick is a good teacher to have for 2D. you get to be really creative with your work. he is a nice professor and really likes to have a conversation with students to get to know them
Awesome prof!!
Great prof and artist

name_title: James Magee Professor in the Political Science department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Have taken several classes with him.  He is by far the best professor at ud.  There is a reason he has received 3 teaching awards.  Cares about his students  and wants them to learn.  His classes aren't for slackers.  Put in the effort and you will be rewarded.
He's robert california from the office and its incredible.

By far the best professor I've had at UD and my favorite teacher of all times. He is extremely passionate about the subject and is insanely intelligent and captivating. He makes you want to listen in lecture, and tries to help you understand as best as possible. I've taken like 3-4 classes with him and I absolutely love him!

This professor is irredeemably rude. He takes a few minutes every class to try to convince people to drop the class and has repeatedly stopped class because someone was texting, going on a 10 minute tangent about how that student was wasting time. While I learned a decent amount, Magee's unjustified sour disposition ruined the class for me.
He's super nice he makes the class interesting I want to take his class again

name_title: Dave Saunders Professor in the Computer Science department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Bad lecturer. Gets lostrealizes he's wrong often, any example code usually had errors in it, and very hard to follow. One time he taught us depth first search incorrectly. Good online textbook. Daily homework problems & some for extra credit. 1 midterm and 1 final worth 40% of grade. Nice guy and fairly helpful in office hours.

Nice guy but, not a good lecturer. Makes mistakes during lectures, backtracks often, and sometimes mumbles and lectures to the board. It's hard to follow sometimes and not the most interesting.  He usually curves tests.

Lab, not class, attendance mandatory. Labs are extremely difficult, not to mention boring. This course seriously needs to be revamped. I hate the textbook. An online book that he often mentions did something wrong or doesn't like the explanation given. The code for labs is always wrong so take a later lab so you don't deal with this headache.

Saunders is a pretty nice professor. He knows what he's talking about, but talks in a monotone voice that can make it difficult to listen to in lectures sometimes. Doesn't curve exams too much but the final was the exact same questions from the first three midterms.

Read the textbook and you should do fine in the course if you have a decent understanding of Computer Science ideas.  Very stressful lab and HW assignments as the difficulty is not hard but they rarely work from the start.  Helpful in office hours.  Hope for a good TA.

name_title: David Gulick Professor in the Criminal Justice department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: There are no strengths to this  course. The professor doesn't give lectures and basically tells  students what chapters of the  textbook will be on the exams. I feel like I paid $3,000 in tuition just  to be told to read a book. I was not 'taught' a single thing by the  professor and this was a complete  waste of money. (horrible with emai

Hard!!! I took the online course and there are no lectures or anything. He just tells you to read the chapters in the textbook. I could've saved a lot of money on the class. I could've just bought the textbook and taught myself. Study guides are provided which are basically the same questions as the test and somehow, the test is still really hard!

Most amazing prof ever! Absolutely love Gulick! I prob wouldn't recommend taking him online because he's fairly unresponsive and helpfull to college students, but ellecent experience that he will teach with. Most amazing stories ever! In all fields of CJ.

Took the online course and I all I can say is ridiculous.  Exceptionally slow to answer e-mails and the answers to my questions weren't even answered.  It's like he reads the e-mail but just responds with whatever is on his mind.  Stay away from this jerk.
Gained absolutely nothing from class. Slow to answer emails, will not meet with you to discuss exam. Exams have errors that cost you points, which he will not correct.

name_title: John J.Pitney Professor in the Government department at Claremont Mc Kenna College

ratings.comment: Funny, sharp, direct, & dedicated to teaching and his own studies. Always accessible for wisdom & advice. Great presidential impersonator. Dislikes arrogant, competitive, & ass-kissing students. To do well in class, write powerfully but not verbosely; remember brevity is the soul of wit. My writing became much more succinct, incisive, & analytical.

I am currently enrolled in his MM and American Politics Class. This is the most rewarding and interesting class that I have ever taken. This is a challenging course, but I do not care what grade I receive in this class. He is an AMAZING professor & does provide course secrets during office hours. Prof Pitney, Thank you for giving me the world.
Every class was a great experience. Office hours can be a bit intimidating/awkward but Pitney's a genuine person who wants you to succeed. Hard work is necessary to do well.

Professor Pitney has become an incredible mentor for me and is someone I respect deeply. He is deeply passionate about whatever he teaches and imparts this knowledge and passion onto his students. He holds office hours almost every day. Beyond the classroom, Pitney is extremely dedicated to securing internships and jobs for his students.

Professor Pitney was an incredible Government Professor, a great guy, and an engaging lecturer. The workload is manageable, and he has clear expectations for papers (be sure to read Strunk and White). Professor Pitney is constantly making references to CMC alumni, which makes the class especially interesting and relevant.

name_title: James Nichols Professor in the Government department at Claremont Mc Kenna College

ratings.comment: so. boring. thats all. got an A- with moderate effort. prob could've gotten an A if i was more motivated to actually do the readings
he lectures for almost the entire class so if you don't wanna do readings/particpate it's great but can be boring. not a tough grader but there are in-class essays for the final exam. easy A.

Great guy, insanely smart. But class consisted of him sitting in a chair talking about an old book for the entire class. The books were not interesting, and the class was very boring because we just sat there the whole time hearing him speak about Plato, Rousseau, etc. Easy grader on papers if you put in the effort.

Professor Nichols is super nice and very wholesome! There is a lot of reading, but you can get by without doing very much of it. He does talk a LOT and doesn't foster as much discussion, but I think the latter might also be because people stop doing the readings a few weeks in. He does appreciate participation and gives great essay feedback!
Very chill class and teacher, very easy grader, but talks for most of the class and does not really foster discussion.

name_title: Jerry Hendricks Professor in the Social Work department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: The class for me was not very engaging and all over the place, however, in the end it was easy to get an A. He is a nice man and the project at the end was interesting.

There's a big project that was interesting but Jerry is an awesome guy who really cares about social work and his students. I would 100% take him again and probably will. Lectures are a bit boring but I can't complain!
Good at making a 2-3 hour lecture not feel so long. The tests make sense and basically allow you to prove you paid attention and know the material in a very easy way.

Professor Hendricks is a great teacher. He based his lectures on his own stories and experience in the social work field. The only downside of his class is that it was all out of 100 points. It doesn't leave any room to miss a quiz or assignment. It's important to read the textbook because all the quiz information comes from the book.

We had a group project & paper, 8 short quizzes on the book, and 2 exams (the final you can opt out of if you have a high enough grade). He tells you exactly what's on the exams. His lectures are boring but this was an easy A. Group project sucked but it's easy to do.

name_title: P atty Stow-Bolea Professor in the Social Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I've taken her for three classes. This is a wonderful learning experience and a great professor to have it with!
Rude, arrogant, and has agendas more important than teaching.

This is also a 651 (I think)if they were a MSW. I was just a BSW. This was an out of town Cross Cultural Service Learning at the Saginaw Chippewa Reservation. The experience was fantastic and other than one "bump" I highly recommend the class and Prof. Bolea-Stow.
An excellent role model.
SW 600 was taught almost exclusively by the students. One Big presentation, some class discussion and a few writing assignments. If you did all the assignments I don't see how you could not get an A.

name_title: Jim Sanford Professor in the Law department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Sanford's lectures were fine but the final exam often asked if he had mentioned certain things in his lectures and expects you to have memorized his entire lecture for the final. I wish the final tested us on class topics rather than what the lectures/professors say. Do not recommend this teaching style!

His quizzes were much harder than they needed to be and relied heavily on memorization from his lecture and many questions were difficult to find answers even with open book. Many questions asked are dumb and not pertaining to the material only "did he talk about". Lectures were not helpful at all and he just read verbatim off the outline.

Quizzes and exams ask the dumbest questions. Over half of the questions are "did he ever talk about __ during this entire class." Lectures are so unnecessarily long, and he expects you to memorize everything he has every said in them. No matter how small or irrelevant the point is. It seems like he cares more about memorization than learning.

I had Sanford for the second half of my BUS201 online portion and he was a fine professor and all I just didn't like the class, its online so that was nice but it was just long video lectures and online textbook. But its not too bad and the professor is consistent and helpful if needed.

I had Professor Sanford for the online section. The class really only consisted of hours of lectures and a corresponding quiz every week. I personally thought that his lectures were pretty stale and not engaging. However he does know the content, and if you just pay attention this should be a pretty easy class.

name_title: David Olagunju Professor in the M athem atics department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Professor Olagunju was my favorite teacher this past semester. His lectures are straightforward & he does lots of worked out examples. The homework isn't mandatory but I found it invaluable. Gives study guides & help sessions before each exam, & whenever I went to his office hours he was extremely patient & helpful. Hope to have him again someday.
His tests can be tough, but he truly cares about whether or not you are doing well if you show up to class.

Best teacher i've had here. explains every topic very well in class and prepares you very fairly for each test and the practice exam he gives is same stuff just different numbers basically in the actual test he gives.

Learned So much in his Math351 class. I had already taken the class with Angel the previous semester and it still seemed like I was taking this class for the first time. Great professor. Looking forward to taking Math352 with him as well.

Easily one of the better math professors here.  He's very easy to understand, tests come right from what he taught, he's very understanding about not knowing how to use maple, and will let you use a calculator instead if that's more simple.  I would really recommend him and wish that I could take another class with him.

name_title: P atricia Deleon Professor in the Science department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: I found her so difficult to understand and that she did not communicate information well. She also went so fast, and for someone who is bad at science, made it so  much more difficult. I also found class boring and noticed she would get mad and frustrated when we did not know the answer.

Hard class if you're not into science. I swear a lot of her tests questions weren't even  discussed in class. People who are good at biology will do great, but if you're like me and the opposite of a science major than it will be hard, but read the book because it helps a lot. BTW she calls everyone rude and her outbursts when people talk is funny

Deleon is meh. Her lectures are a rehashing of exactly what's in the textbook, and she tends to repeat exactly what she said a sentence before, only rewording herself.  Pretty boring, unengaging lectures, but the course isn't too hard as it's a 100-level.

Dr. DeLeon has had many years of experience in the field, and she is extremely knowledgable. She's also really passionate about Biology, which made the long lectures easier to attend. Sometimes she gets confused reading off her own powerpoint, but she's old, so I'll give her a pass! Collects homework at beginning of class and lectures posted online

Professor DeLeon is super passionate about biology and human heredity, but if you are not really into science, I would not recommend taking this course, because it can get a little confusing at times.

name_title: Richard Holland Professor in the Science department at Southern Illinois University - Carbondale

ratings.comment: Great professor, tests are hard, but he cares about his students, and he truly wants everyone to get a very good grade in his class. Many extra credit points are added to tests and a curve at the end of the year. I loved taking this course, and I would love to take another course with him in the future.

I had Dr. Holland for College Physics I & II at RLC, and at first it was very difficult. As I got more used to the course, it was manageable. His tests are open book. The homework isn't for a grade, but the problems are very similar to the test. He gives in-class extra credit and you are allowed to work together. Labs are an easy A.
Tough.
Made class very interesting and was always funny. Learned a lot from him.

I did horribly in the 1st half of physics and hated it. Then I took the 2nd half with Dr. Holland and have a new appreciation for physics. He makes the subject interesting and easy to  understand. He also has an obvious love for physics that shows through his teaching, rubbing off on his students! Highly recommended.

name_title: Robert Daly Professor in the English department at University at Buffalo (SUNY Buffalo)

ratings.comment: I don't think he was supposed to teach my class but he did. There was 8 or so books we had to get for the class so try and thrift those. He wasn't clear that we had to read the whole entire book before the class we began discussing it and the lectures were just him going over the books.

Definitely the best teacher I had at UB, If you don't take a class that he teaches then you will have a bad time. Truly the beating heart of UB and the man is a literary genius with some funny stories as well.

He is a really nice guy that really cares about his students. He's looking for everyone to do improve throughout the semester. Only stressful part of the class was that the second exam included materials from the first exam and second. It's do-able and he's really nice and understanding if you cannot complete an assignment on time/ come to class.

Dr. Daly is by far the best professor I've ever had.  His class taught me not only a lot about literature, but a lot about life.  He keeps lecture interesting with personal stories of his and interpretations of American literature.  Exams and essays are straightforward, take a class with Daly and you will be in for a treat!
Dr. Daly is a fantastic teacher.  You'll learn more about english from his class than all your other classes combined.

name_title: Kenneth Takeuchi Professor in the Chemistry department at University at Buffalo (SUNY Buffalo)

ratings.comment: One of the most interesting, entertaining and amazing professors ever. Relates what you learn to modern day issues. Glad he came to Stony Brook! He is hysterical. Best chem professor ever!

Tremendous professor. Enjoyed every moment of class. He knows what he is doing and better yet enjoys what he does making his class enjoyable. The down side is that he is leaving the University, he will be missed.
His lectures are super fun to attend, and it is inspiring at the same time too. He also organized his notes really well. I got an A because I went to all his lectures.

Takeuchi is very enthusiastic about chemistry and really wants his students to do well. His lectures are provided online so you can print them out and follow along during class. He's willing to answer questions. I felt like he was more organized during the first half of the semester and rushed a little towards the end. 2 tests and a final.
This man is a chemistry god. His lecture helped my grade go from bad to good. Very helpful and easy to approach as well.

name_title: Gaspar Farkas Professor in the Science department at University at Buffalo (SUNY Buffalo)

ratings.comment: Dr. Farkas is the best professor I've ever had. He teaches so well and makes learning interesting, doesn't fill his lectures with unneeded/untested info, gives you a ton of resources to practice and see how the exams are presented. He genuinely cares about his students. I didn't kill myself to get a good grade and understand material in this class.

Use his study guides like they are a religious text. You really need to know everything. All lectures are recorded so you can rewatch lectures and even listen to previous years lectures. 
Fair grader. You should be able to pass the class if  you stay on top of the material. If you fall behind- it will take an act of God to help you catch up.
Really tough class but he really wants his students to pass.
One of the best

He is so smart that he forgot what it's like to be a dumb college student therefore lectures are dense and fast! Entire grade 3 tests that are about 30-35 Qs (inappropriately short to gauge student knowledge). This class blocks students from PT school when they are smart enough to get in anyways. WARNING: Take elsewhere!! Studying is NOT enough...

name_title: Randall Shortridge Professor in the Biology department at University at Buffalo (SUNY Buffalo)

ratings.comment: 50% random conspiracy theories, 25% ranting about UB being out to get him, 25% content. He shared an article claiming females retain all the sperm of every lover they've ever had and when I called him out on it, he had not even read the ABSTRACT of the paper he had on screen. Literally posts exam questions beforehand. Easy asf but TERRIBLE quality.
Very nice guy, class is easy as you only have to do 5 online labs through labster which are very easy and not very time consuming. 100% recommend

literally the BEST prof ive ever had at UB. makes lecture so simple, tophat for participation. exams are easy and he gives us exactly what we need to prepare for it. funny professor too. always makes the class laugh and smile. I would take him 300 more times if I could. 100% recommend!

Just make sure you come to class and it's a easy A. I don't know why other ratings says he is a not a good professor. He gives us the test questions in advance and have quizzes in class which he gives us the answers too.

I took his virtual BIO 129LAB this fall semester. We had a single virtual lab every other week for a total of 5 labs the whole semester. Very straightforward and simple. Do the simple labs and you will pass; lucky to have this class my first ever college semester. Never met him in person but when I emailed him, he emailed back within 10 minutes.

name_title: Gregory Crowell Professor in the Music department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Dr. Crowell is an amazing professor for each of the music theory courses. His lectures are well-prepared and detailed; he does not fail to expand on each of his points. His office hours happen 3 times a week, so help is always there if you need it. He allows you to revise homework that was already turned in for a second chance the next class.

So an easy class to pass. Show up and do the weekly assignments and you will get an A. Professor Crowell is a very caring person and is a very easier grader. I would highly recommend the course and professor

He is a super sweet professor and clearly lays out the work for the weeks. Usually consists of a quiz, discussion board, and journal entry. Super easy choice for an art elective and he grades quickly. No group projects. Must use online text since quizzes are embedded in it and it helps with midterm and final. He is older but did well with online.

I would definitely recommend this class to anyone considering it as a prerequisite. Every week there would be reading, a journal, discussion, and sometimes a quiz that was always very easy. There were only two exams that we very easy as well. You do not need a previous knowledge in music to get an A in this class. The professor is very very nice!
Great professor, he is so kind to students. Attending his class was the highlight of my week. 10/10 would recommend for any course!

name_title: Teresa Beck Professor in the Medicine department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Great professor and class but start on your program plan early!
Awesome. Will go the extra mile for you. Class had a lot of work (papers etc) but she gives you plenty of notice and is flexible. Amazing person. Will even help you get all of your classes in order

Great prof.  Class is laid back, easy....no exams or quizzes, but you do need to show up (counts towards grade).  I only read the book the first week.  If it is not to late sell it back... 2 papers due and one group work project, but is is easy.  TAKE HER!

I loved this class. She's an amazing lady, great teacher and very funny. Class is really laid back and comfortable. She's there to help whenever you need her. She knows her stuff and can teach you alot of things about success and health care management. Very compassionate and loves to teach.
This is the best prof around...Teresa genuinely cares about her students and has real life experience to relate to her students - I would not have made it through my 3rd year without her support!

name_title: Richard Joanisse Professor in the Sociology department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Crazy professor and so fun to be around. Really makes the course interesting and funny.. If you try, pay attention, and NEVER HAVE YOUR PHONE OUT IN CLASS, you'll be fine

He's insane...but one of the few smart professors I've met. Sure, you write a paper every day, but it's a summary of the reading. Not hard, gives 90 percent of the class A's, provided they do the work. I'd recommend taking society and self just to hear Joanisse go off on tangents twice a week.

Requires A LOT of writing - for every article you read you must write a critique and a journal.  At the beginning of the semester we read 4+ articles a week, which was way too much work.  After talking to him as a class, he reduced workload to 1-2 articles per week.  No need to take notes in class, as there aren't any exams.  No textbook either.

Joanisse is an all-around great guy. He is brilliant, but sometimes he goes on brilliant tangents and it becomes very very hard to understand where he is going with his speeches. For HNR 233 you are expected to read dense articles, process them, and spit out two papers for each class period. It is VERY easy to get lost and overwhelmed.

Very fun guy. Had him for junior seminar and for honors social science. Pretty considerate of students if you reason with him about homework. Very engaging, exciting, likes to "act" in class. Randomly barks things and scares the heck out of his students! He seems pretty brilliant, it's surprising he's not renowned w/ published articles, etc.

name_title: Bobby Martindale Professor in the Accounting department at Dallas Baptist University

ratings.comment: Extremely disrespectful to students, I should not have to send my graded exams to another professor for a re-grade/check and informed that he is wrong. Asking questions is essentially a death sentence for this prof and homework is beyond tiring. Be ready to study twice as much in this subject than any other. Recommend someone else with patience
Rude and inconsiderate. I enjoy accounting, but did not enjoy her class or her teaching at all.

If you are not an accounting major, and have no desire to learn about accounting. do not take this woman. especially this class. if you are an accounting major and know what you're doing, then i would. she knows her stuff, she's tough though.

She gives a very hard time and doesn't even make it worth it. Sometimes she herself wouldn't know what she is talking about. She would ask questions and not know the answers. Very unfair grading. Would not even tell what she wants from a student.

Have taken teacher for 3 dif classes, tax part 1, 2nd acct course, and cost accounting. She is tough but completely worth it, I got an A+,B,and C- but I rather get a B knowing I have a good und of the sub than getting a good grade with no knowledge; take her she'll push you where you didn't think you could go.

name_title: Jim Scott Professor in the Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor Scott is one of the nicest professors I have ever had. His lectures tend to get slightly off-course, but he is fully willing to help you in any way he can. He is a wonderful person and I think I have truly benefited from having him as my kinesiology professor.

He tries his best but nature of class makes it challenging. A ton of terms and body directions to memorize. 4 tests, final is easiest one. He also gives free points for work sheets and 42 points for attendance. Can manage a B

Jim Scott is probably one of the nicest professors you'll meet. His lectures do have a tendency to get off track, but overall a good professor. He's retiring soon, so take his class if you get the chance. I think he could have involved more subjects in the class to make it more challenging. You will also need the textbook for this course.
Great guy, always willing to help, and just very knowledgeable overall.
He's a really nice guy, but his lectures are boring and dry. He doesn't really answer questions and is rather vague about his expectations.

name_title: David Bernstein Professor in the Psychology department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. Worst professor ever. Don't try to ask him any questions because he will assume he knows what you're asking before you can even ask it and in the end, never answers it. He gets so off-topic and overall, I learned nothing taking his class. His grading system is terrible and he's full of ambiguities. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.
Awesome course! You have to read the articles and be prepared for class and write concisely and intelligently. If you do that you'll have no trouble doing well
he's very condescending, especially if he decides that you are not a competent student.
Bernstein was pompous and incoherent.
He is a good teacher that is very understanding.  I highly recommend the class if you are willing to put up with a lot of writing and reading.

name_title: Michael Saler Professor in the History department at University of California Davis

ratings.comment: I feel bad writing a bad review bc he is very knowledgeable clearly passionate about the subject. However, passion doesn't make up for a lack of teaching skills, and Saler has almost none. He is awkward, his lectures are all over the place, and just beyond outdated. Get ready to put in twice the amount of work you would for a regular HIS class.

Michael Saler was a funny, interesting lecturer. Some of the readings and essay assignments were challenging, but he was available outside of class to discuss them. The reading load was heavy but manageable and grading was fair.

Professor Saler is an amazing professor. He took time to discuss readings with me outside of class and cares about his students. Really great lectures, but they are detailed so take good notes. Grading was very fair.

Would not recommend Saler because he does not care about his students. He does not provide any leeway. Though, if you do the reading youll pass the tests. Participation is mandatory and class is extremely boring

Extremely knowledgeable in artistic and intellectual history. Highly recommend taking his courses if you want to challenge yourself and learn more about philosophy. There's a lot of reading but all the books are interesting and highly relevant for the time period he covers.

name_title: Paul Trout Professor in the English department at Montana St ate University

ratings.comment: Very fun professor
Nice enough.  Class was boring, but not hard.
I have a handful of teachers that I'll never forget, and be eternally grateful to. He opened up a world for me that did not exist before taking his class.  Thanks Paul hope you are well.

I took a number of classes from Professor Trout in the loved them. I sought to take as many of his courses as possible because I always learned so much from them even if I did not always receive an "A" in the course. He was always very helpful with both course work and mentoring -- he assisted with both internship and grad school chooses and apps.

He complains that no one is contributing to the class discussion when he dominates the class with his comments. By the time I dropped the class I was so sick of hearing about his book. Just to let you know; I asked him if he fished and he told me that he did not violate animals in his totem. He was completely and totally serious.

name_title: John Putz Professor in the M athem atics department at Alma College

ratings.comment: I feel very fortunate to have had Dr. Putz for so many classes. Now that I am in grad school, I appreciate his teaching even more. I remember more from his classes than anyone else's. He has a way of making it stay with you. The best of all was his geometry class. He teaches you to write and think the way he does--with impeccable logic.
He is a very good professor, highly intelligent, and very witty.  Although he sometimes borders on arrogant, his sense of humor does make class interesting.

Go to class!!! The material is tough and although he is a great prof who gives good lectures and is very helpful, you have to listen to them to understand it. It helps to do the homework as well. Exams are fairly tough but are always perfect replicas of the homework.

This is the best class I've ever had. Every day I looked forward to it. Dr P made it interesting and fun.  He has a good sense of humor and relates really well to students. After this class, I decided to major in math. I've had 3 other professors in the dept and I will definitely take as many of my classes from Dr P as I can.
Dr. Putz is a great professor.  He is always there to help & makes class very interesting! He knows exactly how much time he needs for each part of the class and never lets us out a minute late.

name_title: Murray Borrello Professor in the Science department at Alma College

ratings.comment: Dr Borello is hilarious. His lectures were super fun and always kept me entertained. He is impossible to reach outside of class, so ask questions in class.
Bro does not even talk about geology or anything related to class waste of time

Really funny guy which keeps lectures entertaining. However, lectures are disorganized, expectations for assignments are unclear, grading feels disorganized, and if you email him or talk to him about something important he will likely forget the entire conversation the next day. Overall, really nice prof though and wants to help his students.

He is very funny during lectures but often goes on tangents that don't pertain at all to the material. Open notes and internet for most of the exams/quizzes. He encourages you to do you own research instead of teaching you the material which often causes wrong answers on exams since the questions are so specific and unique.

Borrello has an amazing reputation on campus but is one of the worst professors I've ever had. He is funny in the lectures but then gets on tangents about stuff that doesn't relate to the class. He tells us to Google the exam answers then will get mad when we don't understand the material. He expects us to all be experts in a 100 level class.

name_title: Kurt Saunders Professor in the Law department at California St ate University - Northridge

ratings.comment: He's a great professor with very clear and detailed lectures. He's knowledgable on the subject. He expects participation in class discussions. He doesn't give homework and you are only graded on exams and participation. He's overall a really good professor and would definitely recommend.

not a bad guy but grades harshly. says there's a curve at the end but if someone gets 98-100% there's none. 3 tests determine ur grade, get anything bellow a B on any of them u don't get an A. U can get 100% on 2 of them and will still not get an A if u get a C on one. really bums u out. lecture on first day of class, no days off. have to committed

He's a great professor. Getting an A isn't impossible in the class; you just have to train yourself to get into the reading mode and really understand what you're reading. If you're organized, it won't be impossible. His classes are overall enjoyable. He gives a lot of real-life examples so you know what his exams are like.

The professor is just great, he knows his material. You MUST come prepared to class by doing the readings (a lot) and its easy get behind if you don't. His tests are difficult but are open book/open note. If you are coming to class consistently you should be fine. He's funny and kind!`

He's really kind and honestly amazing. Everyone can do well in his class, but it requires reading. His multiple-choice questions are difficult, and they mostly come from the reading. He's also a great, funny person. People may down grade him, but it's because there wasn't correct studying done on their part.

name_title: Andrew Blaustein Professor in the Zoology department at Oregon St ate University

ratings.comment: Dr. Blaustein taught the second half of BI211. He taught the material super quick and probably spent a second or two on every slide. While the material is easy and he presents it in a funny mood, it is too quick and I feel like I didn't learn much from him. Just make sure to pay attention whenever he says "this will be on the test."
Super great, extremely clear on what will be on final. Hes very passionate about what he teaches and is by far the funniest prof Ive ever had

Dr Blaustein can seem very rude and intimidating at first, but by the end of the course you can tell he actually enjoys teaching students and loves talking about his own research areas.  His lecture slides are really sparse, and what he presents doesn't match what is on canvas.  His whole portion of the class is based on the final, but is fair.
Great professor however, you MUST go to class and pay very close attention to what he talks about.
The lectures were very interesting and Blaustein is hilarious. He lectures on stuff that is relevant to life and current issues.

name_title: George Wynn Professor in the Marketing department at James Madison University

ratings.comment: Showed no interest in his students.

I liked this professor enough to take him again for MKTG 450. While he is a talker & sometimes plays favorites,he REALLY cares & helps you if you're straight forward and follow his class policies. DO NOT LET YOUR CELL PHONE RING, he will throw you out. He's definitely old school,retiring next year
If you're a girl def take him, If you're a guy don't bother.  Shows immense favoritism towards a few people in the class and disrespects the rest of class.
He doesn't teach you what you need to know in class, but just read the book and you can get an "A", he's a very nice guy, he loves teaching and loves talking to students.

This professor is horrible - he teaches absolutely nothing - all he talks about is Texas and anything concerning the oil business.  His tests are hard and the class is the most boring you will ever attend.

name_title: Michael Smilowitz Professor in the Communic ation department at James Madison University

ratings.comment: Too much off topic of the lecture
He is extremely horrible and unpredictable. Never grades your work on time   I highly recommend to change your professor if you have a chance

Took this class as an elective and I'm not sure I would recommend it to others. Smilowitz means well but seems very opinionated. He tends to tell stories that never end and just left me confused. Maybe he would be better to take in the afternoon because the 8am did not work for me! Two tests and a cumulative final.
Extremely smart professor. Listen, take good notes, and keep up with the work. I would recommend the online class. Really great guy.

Smilowitz is an amazing professor. He want his students to do well but doesn't give any hand-outs. Go to office hours, even if you don't need help. He knows a lot! Even at 8am he keeps things entertaining and moving quickly. Highly recommended.

name_title: Anne Gabbard-Alley Professor in the Communic ation department at James Madison University

ratings.comment: one of the better professors at JMU.  She know her material.  She had a great sense of humor and cared about students.
She taught me more about communication and life than any other professor i have ever had.

To all of the undergrads that are whining about her being mean/unfair/cold/etc- welcome to the real world- I took her in the early 2000's and she prepared me for what could come my way once you leave the bubble of JMU- not everyone you report to in life is going to be warm, funny, friendly, or even have your best interests at heart- I owe her alot.
The best ever...sorry she's leaving us...

Anne is the best prof I've ever had. She is witty and blunt but knows her****. She is extremely intelligent and loves to have fun in class. I have learned so much from her, not only academically, but about life in general. She is my favorite professor of all time and I wish I could have her by my side to help me through the rest of my life.

name_title: Carlos Aleman Professor in the Communic ation department at James Madison University

ratings.comment: nope. he was so bad. I was shocked that I did well in this class. He doesnt grade anything till the end and his instructions are unclear. He will cold call on you and wont stop asking you the same question till you answer it how he wants you too. the class is super interesting but the way that he taught left me more confused then when I started.
DO. NOT. TAKE. SAVE YOURSELF!!

If there is ANOTHER option for 248 take it! I have had more panic attacks in this one class than I had in my last two years at JMU  Will pick on students at random and will not let them say they do not know the answer. Does not leave room for students to express their own ideas, and you will leave more confused than when you first showed up.

Never take!!  He doesn't know what he's doing, instead of teaching, he talks in circles, and you never understand what he's trying to say.  You leave the class more confused than when you got there.  He gives no clear direction on major assignments, and when you seek help, he gets mad that you don't know what you're doing.

DO NOT TAKE! the anxiety that flooded through by body walking into this class was crazy. he cold called on people and wouldn't allow them to say they dont know but if they didn't get the answer right he would be mad. he doesnt give clear instructions for projects. you also dont know your grade throughout the semester

name_title: Wendy Reffeor Professor in the Engineering department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Dr. Reffeor is a solid prof. I took her for the entire statics series (209, 309, 409). Beware you will receive an ungodly amount of homework. She gives the most homework out of any professor I've had throughout college. The good news is if you put some work in and ask questions about things you're not sure of, you will have no problem on the exams!
Co-op prep is a joke. You'll get an A with any professor. Prof Reffeor is funny and makes the boring lectures more interesting, but just do all the assignments, and you'll get an easy A.
EGR 289 is a very easy class. Dr. Reffeor gave great feedback on resumes and cover letters. She also gave great advice on finding a co-op
The class itself isn't difficult, but you'll have to manage deadlines. She makes her office feel welcomed and makes you feel heard. I have a high respect for her and she makes me laugh.

One of my favorite professors I have had so far. She understands that students have other classes, and has been known to push back tests if she doesn't think you're ready. Her lectures are really organized and easy to follow. Lots of example problems. She is very helpful both in class and in office hours. Highly recommend!

name_title: Janet Brashler Professor in the Anthropology department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: If all you're looking for is a professor who cares about the subject, look no further. If you're looking for a professor who explains her grading, you may want to reconsider. She rarely gives full points, doesn't explain why. She squeezes a lot into each week because she's not given enough time for such a broad, complex topic. She does her best.

Great professor even though I'm not an anthro major. She makes everything straight forward for her students by posting powerpoints and having good office hours. She even has a pretty cool policy sometimes where she makes says (more to herself I think), that if she doesn't get the papers graded, we don't have class

I enjoyed professor Brashler. I didn't think she was difficult. If you attend lecture she posts her PowerPoints online, her exams were easy if you did the reading and she was always helpful. Would definitely recommend.
Helpful, but a very difficult grader. Avoid taking if you simply want a blow-off course.
I have never read so much and learned so little.

name_title: Joan Borst Professor in the Social Work department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Easy online issues class. I spent 20 minutes on a short assignment each week. One paper about disease of your choice and one group slideshow about assigned illness, but she grades everything super easy. Final exam was 10 points, all simple questions that required no studying.

Didn't reply to any emails. Takes forever to grade things and half of the assignments are hidden in folders. If you miss 1 assignment, it will affect your grade a lot. Don't recommend her; 82% in the class is a C+. Easy class but it's very repetitive and boring. Take for easy credit but don't plan on getting any help or getting questions answered.

Her class is easy but her grading criteria is terrible. It takes 96% to get an A so if you miss a SINGLE assignment your grade goes down to an A-. She takes forever to grade material and respond to emails. There is an essay and group project that were relatively easy. As long as you don't miss an assignment and put in some effort you'll be fine.

Super easy class if you need an SWS class I highly suggest you take this one. Very easy A. Take it online all you do each week is one response or discussion board. One exam at end but so easy open note. And one project which is just a powerpoint slide with a group I finished mine in like 30 minutes! TAKE HER

I took Borst for an asynch class so naturally it was pretty easy but she is super sweet and basically gives full credit for everything as long as you put a little effort in. There is one easy assignment every week that goes along with a video or article and sometimes a discussion board. One group paper. class is an easy option for issues credit

name_title: Noel Boyle Professor in the Philosophy department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Gone, but too bad.
Great guy. He is really funny and grade pretty easy. He is really interesting.

Extremely passionate about philosophy.  The discussions are interesting for the most part and he is very open and interested in students' opinions and thoughts.  A little tough on the 400 word essays. Doesn't really take attendance, but class discussions show up on the exam. Overall, I would recommend him.
He looks like a cave man.  And he is a very good guy.  Very fun professor.

Very unhelpful and lazy. If you are used to writing normal papers this class will mess you up. His guidelines for grading are a little cloudy and I never really knew what was going on.  I went to almost every class but I am still lost. Probly more the subject than the prof, but I did NOT enjoy the class

name_title: Edward Mc Devitt Professor in the Business department at University of California Los Angeles (UCLA)

ratings.comment: Calculators are not allowed in the exams, good luck :)
Very great lecturer. One of the better Econ professors at UCLA. But the classes are pretty difficult. Notes and practice problems are the best way to study for exams.

Tests are hard and get easier after the first one.  Best lectures, very clear and concise.  Do the questions, they are like the test.  My econ prof now is horrible and just shows slides and doesn't work out the problems.  McDevitt is much better and is the best econ prof I've had so far.  Didn't realize it until now

OK, this guy is one of the best speakers I know.  Very clear, interesting, and easy to understand.  However, his tests are tricky with a crappy curve.  You need to know calculus and obscure econ concepts from earlier classes.  40% of questions he never went over in class or modified extremely.  Always trying to trick you.  Tough graders too.
Great teacher very understandable lectures. Tests are very hard but they are curved and if you study his lectures and study guides you won't be surprised when you take the test.

name_title: David Ravetch Professor in the Accounting department at University of California Los Angeles (UCLA)

ratings.comment: Ravetch is a good lecturer and engaging but the way he grades is super harsh for no reason. He's also really unclear about what he wants for assignments and homework and will then dock you points for not doing things that he didn't clarify. In person he's cool but honestly this class isn't hard but he makes it more difficult for his students

What a gem! Ravetch will always be one of the best professors I have ever encountered. He made accounting fun... wait is that even possible? Yes! He is that good! One of the most memorable experiences at ucla was his class.

Took 2 classes and he is the reason I am not a CPA. Guess what? I shouldnt be a CPA. Hes easily the best professor you can get in any subject. Why? Because he will be passionate, do everything he can to help you learn, and he will teach you how to be great. If you want to fck around, go take someone else's class. I got A- and C for 1A and 120A.

Very difficult tests that challenge you to fully grasp the material. Really cares about student learning as opposed to getting grades. Very funny and encourages students to seek his help outside of class.
try get his past exams it will help you ace the class

name_title: Iris Firstenberg Professor in the Psychology department at University of California Los Angeles (UCLA)

ratings.comment: This professor is awful, she explains one thing in class then makes it 10x more difficult on the exams, her practice exams don't reflect the difficulty nor the material on her real exams, I would not recommend taking her for anything, the amount of work you have to put into this class is insane, its more than in pretty much any other class

I hated 100B, she designs the trickiest exams possible..its very hard to get a good score even if you know the material well. Also the grading in this class depends a great deal on your TA, if you get a good TA you will get a good grade, if you get a bad TA then you're screwed. I suggest you take another teacher for 100B, they are likely easier.

It is incredible how you can read the book, do the practice exams, and still do miserably poor on the actual exams because the exams are created to trick you. They want you to fail. Make sure you know how to decipher cryptic messages because there is nothing clear about this class. The professor needs a lesson in proper email etiquette; super rude.

She called me a lady, which is nice.  The class is way better than some other courses I have taken in the psychology dept.  She also wrote a book, which is also super.  The psych major is impacted, so it's rough out there, but I do recall this as a better class I had taken.

I took the 1st midterm yest. & let me tell you it was designed to trick u. She gives a disclaimer saying "students claim its harder than the practice exam and thats bc people take it w/ the key and they are in a different state-of-mind during the real exam," but NO. That was RIDICULOUS. I get its curved but whats the point if she TRIES to trick u??

name_title: Jean Turner Professor in the Physics department at University of California Los Angeles (UCLA)

ratings.comment: Great teacher, she is very friendly and always ready to help
Very nice fun teacher, class is easy and hwk is fair

One of the best professors I have ever had at UCLA. Very knowledgeable, willing to help, and very fair. I can say this with the utmost confidence for those who cannot follow her lecture; perhaps astrophysics is NOT for you. Highly recommended Professor! A+++
Reading the material isnt enuff.. u must kno the material inside and out like an astronomer does. if not for the curve i wouldnt have passed the class at all.

name_title: William Rogers Professor in the Psychology department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I-side stuff is definitely what his focus is, but he still does a good job clarifying O-side. Really funny guy, great to talk to during office hours. Exams are multiple choice and pretty easy. Two projects seem like they're asking a lot, but he assigns them at the beginning of the semester and they aren't due until the end. Take this professor.

I loved this class. I even decided to take I/O Psych so I could have another class with him before I graduate. Go to class, it helps a ton. I didn't buy a book and didn't miss it. Study for exams. "Group" project is not terrible. There was a presentation for it as well.
definitely the guy to take for 400 if you can. never thought id look forward to coming to a stat class. loved the drawing of the USA, what an artist! lol
This class will challenge you, but hes fair. Smart, funny, and flirty sums it up for me. Likes to talk about random off the wall stuff like movies and tanks, which was awesome.

Wonderful humor and personality. His emails are hilarious! The difficulty was all over the place though, and depends I think on who you had for 300. Some parts were really easy like ANOVA and others like obleque factor rotation (huh?) and time series are like Phd level stuff if you google them. But I learned a lot, I guess and had a little fun.

name_title: William Rolnick Professor in the Physics department at Wayne St ate University

ratings.comment: great professor knows his stuff. you have to attend class he gets frustrated if someone comes late. exams are streght from lecture notes and they are easy if you study. i went to si and did great. if you are lazy don't take his class. if you want to learn go ahead
great professor knows his stuff. you have to attend class he gets frustrated if someone comes late. exams are streght from lecture notes and they are easy if you study. i went to si and did great.

He is a great teacher.  All tests based on lectures not on textbook, although he does recommend reading it for further understanding.  However, if you want to learn material not just regurgitate it on a test, take someone else.

Seems to be disorganized, but did improve throughout the semester.  Test questions are very easy and come straight from his lectures.  He grades on a ridiculously good curve. I did have to attended some SI sessions before the tests, but definitely an easy A.
Hey, I had his Conceptual Phys class back in winter 2007 and i was one of the only people in the class to actually make to his boring class, except once. He only likes Phys/ Math Majors.Avoid him

name_title: P atricia Worthy Professor in the Law department at Howard University

ratings.comment: When I took her class I was told that she generally fails one student each semester.  Despite all of my efforts, I was that student.  My work was impeccable.  She told me to accept that I was a failure.  I was and am not.  She in my opinion at the time that she was my instructor, was not at all fair, unbiased or reasonable.

Professor Worthy is a very knowledgeable individual in all of the legal classes that she teaches. She is extremely diligent, thorough, and proactive with the level of assistance that she provides students inside and outside of the classroom. Be ready to learn, read, and work!
If I could get through without having to take her class again, I would. Knows her stuff tho. Just treats her class like the only class.

Very thorough in her teaching. Commands the attention of the class and introduces law students to the importance of preparation and research.  Not very fair. Favors men by far. Retains a large percentage of final grade for subjective grading (class participation), of which the favoritism factors in.
commands the room.  overdoes it for a 2 credit class, though.

name_title: Paul Goggans Professor in the Engineering department at University of Mississippi

ratings.comment: Your grade is 60% pop quizzes and there's 15 of them. They aren't easy. Goggans just doesn't seem to care much for how his students do and has no problem failing people. I'd say I don't recommend him, but he's the only teacher in the semester. Good luck.

Terrible teacher. Pop-quizzes, which have trick questions once a week, adding up to 55% of your grade. Doesn't care how anyone does in the class. There are no tests, just quizzes and the final is 35% of your grade. The lectures are very dull and the material is presented in a terrible manner. Not advised

Worst proffesor I have ever seen. The course is easy if you work on it. What makes the class hard is the twist questions in throws in quizes and test. 60% of class grade is based on 15 pop-quizes. No curve. Boring way to give lecture and presentation and top it off a daily class. ENGR 362. A 3 credit hr course should have more been like4.
Piece of****
An evident bias towards struggling students and a clear lack of support.

name_title: Atef Elsherbeni Professor in the Engineering department at University of Mississippi

ratings.comment: Literally reads off power points that were taken straight from the book.... Also never tells us whats on the test
terrible lecturer and the group project is a joke
Very good teacher that allows you to reach him at most times.  TA was also very helpful when questions can not be answered due to teacher being away.
No Comments
No Comments

name_title: Laura Eisenman Professor in the Educ ation department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Interesting class.  You work in groups and do independent work.  Papers, exams and projects.  Kind, fair and smart.

The professor is kind-hearted because she is willing to help her students succeed I believe this professor made me feel happier coming on this campus because of her loving personality. I wish this woman was given more attention because EDU professors are always the best

Such a sweet and kind professor. She is really passionate about the topic. Many people take advantage of her kindness in class, which stinks. Be prepared for tons of group work, sitting at tables, collaborative notes, and group video presentations. Generally easy gen ed for history breadth - would recommend Eisenman a hundred times over.
She is so sweet and passionate about her subject. Always happy to chat with her students about anything and if you put in even an ounce of effort your gonna get an A.

I love Dr. Eisenmann! I loved taking her DIST250 class and would definitely take another one of her classes again! This is one of the best classes I have ever taken and the discussions are very informative. You really learn a lot about disability and social justice in this class! There is a lot of group work but some individual assignments.

name_title: Raymond Rocco Professor in the Political Science department at University of California Los Angeles (UCLA)

ratings.comment: The most prepared professor I've had at UCLA. He expects a lot from you, but only because he expects a lot from himself. He is always open to discussing topics outside of class and office hours and teaches in a way that makes you interact with the material in a real-world sense. Best teacher I've had at UCLA, hands down!
Not a hard prof, but a large amount of work is required to do well, along with mandatory attendance

He is a truly awesome human being. If it wouldnt be for him I wouldnt have come to consciousness of the value of life! Very helpfull and is always encouraging his students! He is very anal for his essay assignments, but it definetly pushes you to work hard for your grade.
Had some interestig stories!
Really interested.  straight up an optional midterm and a final (15 pages)

name_title: .Gardner Professor in the Accounting department at University of California Los Angeles (UCLA)

ratings.comment: Professor Gardner is transparent in her lectures.
Ms Gardner is a great teacher and knows her stuff!!! I had a blast taking tax with her.

Study the course reader not the book.  Her tests are right out of it.  Know your stuff.  Lots of questions on the test.  Sterling is too long and time consuming.  The stock project was graded harshly.

Don't bother with the book.  She only tests from the course reader.  Her tests have a lot of info so better know your stuff.  I did not like the Sterling project-too much time consuming.  The stock assignment was graded hard by the TAs.
She is entertaining. Some may feel uncomfortable with her dirty jokes.  She tells her real life experience which is good to know for students who are into the accounting field.

name_title: K ate Palese Professor in the Fine Arts department at San Diego St ate University

ratings.comment: Class has numerous art projects, a couple of group lessons, and a final notebook. 3-hour class that consisted of a short lecture, followed by work time on that project. You can work on all the projects at home if you didn't finish in class time. Really nice teacher who gets to the point and is somewhat easy on grading. Definitely take it again.

Kate has an interesting personality. Her comments are always super funny and maybe not very professional Id say lol but it keeps the class entertaining. This class is truly NOT hard. SO many projects but mostly EASY! No book, but plan to spend about $100 for supplies thruout the semester! Always willing to help. Pro: her pups in classroom! Yay!!

Pros: Very knowledgeable about art & art history, will help you with your work if you need it, very outspoken about opinions which can make for interesting class period. Cons: Always late.. Can come off a bit judgmental at times, not the easiest grader, her grading criteria is every project is worth 4 points. Even the final.

This is not a hard class, and she is not a hard grader. Just show up to class and do your projects. This was one of my favorite classes and I had a lot of fun doing the art projects! The puppet final took a lot of time but I think my classmates and I left the class proud of our work. There's no textbook but you have to buy your art supplies.
It was not an easy class, but it was one of my favorite classes of the semester.

name_title: Tom Wright Professor in the History department at University of Nevada Las Vegas

ratings.comment: Took it SP14 online...He wasn't even the instructor. He had his teaching assistant "teach" the class. It was an interesting class alright, but I think they should have had the discussions just due on Sunday instead of your post on Wednesday and a reply due Sunday. AND the teacher assistant I had was not all that nice, stickler.
Had numerous classes with Dr. Wright years ago. Clear, articulate, more than helpful, humorous, and a true mentor. He is a stickler for grading, and yes, he reads your assignments.
Not too bad of a class compared to other UNLV History courses.

This was a great class on the history of Mexico. If you want to learn more about Mexico?s interesting and complex history from a true Latin American intellectual, Dr. Wight knows how to make the topic interesting. He offers extra credit assignments and remains flexible with students.

name_title: David Dickens Professor in the Sociology department at University of Nevada Las Vegas

ratings.comment: EXCELLENT QUALITY - The best at UNLV

Outstanding professor! The best on campus. I think there was someone who rated him poorly but I will bet that they are a dumb ass student who can't make it on campus, so they whined like a little baby.

Dr. Dickens was a gem of a teacher trapped in a sea of mud that is the University of Nevada, Las Vegas. There are some teachers that leave an impact on you, and he is one of them. I will always hold his memory in my heart.

For a college course in the year 2022, this is not a course that will help students learn content.  Two exams is not fair to students that attend class every day, but aren't good at test-taking.  This is the only course I have taken in 4 years that does not have any opportunity for the students to show knowledge of the material.

He was alright.. He gives two exams and you are really forced to make sure you understand the material correctly. I found him kind of hard to understand and relate to during lectures, but others really like him.

name_title: Hedda Fish Professor in the Educ ation department at San Diego St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor Fish's RWS100 class is a mixed bag. While she's a nice person, the class structure and grading left a lot to be desired. Lack of feedback and unclear instructions made the essays a struggle. However, using unstuck study and the provided textbook helped me get through it with a decent grade.
Perhaps the worst teacher in the history of the San Diego area. When you type in her name on bing, AI reports she is a bad, maybe worst, teacher in the San Diego area.

I think she's at retiring age... She doesn't really give feedback and gets her instructions mixed up a lot. She didn't know how to use Zoom. She takes attendance which takes half the class time. Class is just reading what you wrote for homework. I had a really busy month so I skipped 1 of 3 essays and got a B. Her TA does most of the work.

Prof Fish didn't know how to use zoom at all. I get tech could be difficult for elderly people, but we have been online for over a year. The homework was easy but if you don't show up to class, you get 1/2 credit. She was a super tough grader on essays. Our TA did literally everything so shoutout to her.

You wont learn anything in this class. Attendance is mandatory but all you do is tell the class what you wrote in your last hw assignment (no feedback either, literally pointless). Essay prompts are extremely confusing and she does not explain what she is looking for. Also, toughest grader ever and gives like two sentences of feedback on essays

name_title: Steve O ates Professor in the Educ ation department at Northern Michigan University

ratings.comment: Steve is a caring professor that truly loves his profession and because of that, he demands that the students are focused on the materials and learn what is being taught.  His tests at times are demanding, but if you pay attention in class and participate, I found them rather fundamental.
Absolutely terrible. Completely called me stupid. Did not like his class at all. Has no business teaching teachers how to teach when he doesn't do well himself.

This professor is amazing.  He really cares about his students and the classes are jam packed and quite interesting.  I wish Dr.Oates taught more classes, because I would be really excited to take them.  I definitely recommend this professor!!

Phenomenal teacher! Honestly, he's the best professor I've had the privilege to take a class with yet in my college career. You really get a sense of how you want to teach through his classes. It's all discussion based so if you talk in class and do the work, you'll do fine.

Steve teaches in a way that requires the learner to discover the information on their own. Because of this, I felt that I was able to grasp and own the information for myself.  Also I felt like he valued the opinions of the students and he let us collaborate our ideas.  Its the best class I've had and it opened my eyes to new ideas about education

name_title: Roger Hammer Professor in the Health Science department at Central Michigan University

ratings.comment: Good but detailed

If anyone left a below average review for Dr. Hammer, they aren't taking their degree seriously. Dr. Hammer is hard on you and wants to make sure you know your content. He is silly and occasionally condescending but truly means well because that is how you get pushed to learn. Take his course, in the end you will appreciate it. He's incredible

Its time for Dr. Hammer to step aside from his old school style. Dr. Hammer is intelligent and knows a lot of valuable information. But is not great at teaching, disorganized, random and a weird guy. Dr. Hammer also thinks the human body is as fragile as a paper clip. The human body is resilient, time for the program to step in a new direction.

I took this class a couple years ago but he is not a good professor. Dr. Hammer is very smart but makes students do a lot of weird things and makes everybody feel dumb. I would not take another class with him if I had the choice.
Great teacher. Very kompetent, well prepared and structured.

name_title: Max Maloney Professor in the Philosophy department at Christian Brothers University

ratings.comment: Straightforward grading and solid teaching method. Not much more one can ask for.

He's a nice guy, but I just hated the class. The exams feel easy, but when you get the grade back you'll be upset. Study way in advance because there's so much material (3 days is not sufficient, apparently). Don't bother with the text because everything you need is in his lecture slides, which are posted online, and explained further in class.
Hard class but if you pay attention and actually do and pay attention to the homework, you can pass pretty easily.

He likes to hear himself talk. But he doesn't like to hear himself talk in the vernacular. I spent half of my time trying to figure out what he was even talking about.  He overcomplicates things.  And don't waste your time emailing him for help. He won't reply.
Max is a really intelligent man.  Unfortunately, sometimes it's hard to remember the fact because of his frequent usage of "uh" and "um."

name_title: Melvy Portocarrero Professor in the Spanish department at Bradley University

ratings.comment: Take her for this class.

Dra. Portocarrero is a difficult grader, but she gives great feedback. If you speak with her one-on-one, she will help you figure out what you need to work on for your essays in the future. This class was difficult, so make sure you practice your grammar.

Melvy is super nice. I was a little intimidated at first, but once you get to know her she is the best. The class is heavily graded on 3 essays, but if you know your Spanish and prepare for them you'll do fine. She also lets you do corrections to get points back on the mistakes. You need the book for homework assignments, and it is grammar stuff.

I have mixed feelings about her. Some days she was kind and helpful, other days she would humiliate you in front of the class and tell you to "go back to Spanish 101" It is nearly impossible to get an A. This was the only class I cried about this semester. Because of Covid, we had to use LockDown Browser which was the most stressful thing ever.

Class is entirely in Spanish. Three very short online assignments MWF. Quiz every/every other Friday. Quizzes on grammer/conjugation, tests on that + vocab & culture. If you can understand conversation in Spanish then its easy. Class is just going over grammar and mostly quizzing the class for whole period.

name_title: Laura Garfinkel Professor in the Communic ation department at Bradley University

ratings.comment: She is probably the best teacher I've had here at Bradley. I needed to change my topic for a speech and she gave me her house number to call her on and to talk. No teacher I've ever known is that genuinely nice and cares about all her students. I completely reccommend this class with her. Such a great teacher.

Ms Garfinkel has been one of the most helpful, understanding teachers I have ever had at Bradley.  She is extremely willing to help with assignments, and extremely prompt at answering emails/questions.  An absolutely upstanding women and teacher, highly recommended.
Probably one of the easiest classes on campus, as long as you're fine with getting up in front of the class every once and a while. Super nice Prof.
Really nice, pretty easy grader, crystal clear, easy A.

Professor Garfinkle is so nice. She trys to make class fun by being really energetic. She is crystal clear is all the thoughts she conveys. Very fair grader on speeches. Always willing to help. Great teacher. Super easy A.

name_title: Esther Page-Wood Professor in the Business department at Western Michigan University

ratings.comment: Very willing to help you out as long as you put the effort in. Final project was not too bad as its a progression of the whole semester.

She's Actually A Very Knowledgable Professor! She's very nice and willing to help.  Her only downfall is she doesn't give you study guides or main topics to look over for the first two exams.  But if you read the book you will score high on in class quizzes and the e-learning assignments are very easy.  Study very hard for your exams or u will fail
Very nice lady, very well-taught class. She expects a lot but you have to learn everything on your own. Assignments and quizzes are not too hard at all.
She is really great. In class discussion was vigorous, and she had high expectations for my class, which was nice. However she didn't expect anything we couldn't do/she didn't prepare us for.

she's pretty easy... if u know the vocab words you'll at least do half way decent on the tests.  in class quizzes are also really easy if u pay attention.  she can be a little boring but overall not that bad

name_title: Dean Campbell Professor in the Chemistry department at Bradley University

ratings.comment: While I appreciate Dr. Campbells enthusiasm for teaching, this class is very frustrating and difficult.  There's a quiz every other lecture so be prepared for that. He chooses the most difficult problems for the quizzes. If you go to him he will help you out as he is available via zoom almost every night.

This class is difficult, and he doesn't give you the help to succeed. There is a quiz every other class and when everyone fails it he gets upset and says he's disappointed. The PPS sessions are supposed to be extra credit but they go in as normal grades. Half of the lectures is him talking about useless information. Do not take this class with him.

The class was hard but fair. Campbell was dedicated to the class, and always tried to connect it to environmental issues going on outside the lecture. Non-chemistry majors might have a harder time with certain assignments, but it's not impossible.

I appreciate him showing he cares, but he's a little too much. This class is difficult and time consuming, and you will be worn out very quickly. There's no breaks, either, as three missed classes will lose you a letter grade and there are quizzes every other day. Don't take this class if you don't have to, but if you do, Campbell isn't half bad.

Dr. Campbell very clearly cares about the subject and his students. 3 exams and project w/ a few small homework assignments. Lectures are very entertaining and he often has demos. You do have to do a lot of studying on your own, but that's expected.

name_title: Lewis Carlson Professor in the History department at Western Michigan University

ratings.comment: This is a Gentleman, his class on WW2 was amazing, he was a neutral individual in all aspects of the subject, I learned a lot, Thanks professor. 5 Estrellas!

Dr Carlson has very high expectations of his students and is very helpful if you are putting forth an effort to succeed.  I personally took 3 classes from Dr. Carlson, worked my butt off but, I absolutely loved the classes and him!

Have him for an online class.  His lessons seem unclear.  He grades as if you are writing at a PhD level and just tells you that you need to write better but will never guide you on areas that you should focus.  His comments back are rude.
