He wrote his own book and uses it for his class.  Terrible for online class, no help.
Worst professor ever.  Had him for an online class. He thinks his class is the only one you have.  Expects 30+hours on his class alone.  DO NOT TAKE HIM EVER!

He's straight-forward on what he wants done. His lectures are also right to the point. I found him to be helpful, to the point of letting me borrow his VHS tape so I could write a paper on it.  Be sure to speak loudly and clearly when addressing him, he seems a bit hard of hearing.

name_title: Dennis Anderson Professor in the Inform ation Systems department at Pace University (all)

ratings.comment: Very moody and acts like a know it all since he has done a lot of things in his profession. Not very friendly toward people who do not understand class content. Highly suggest not taking his class unless you do not need any help in anything discussed in the class.
He is very MOODY. Easy Grade,but he thinks he's smart.
No Comments
sucks!...but for this course, better than Prof. Lawler!!!

He brings in speakers, some of them were interesting but you dont learn much. He does not help you in any way on your paper. Don't bother buying the text book, he never uses it. As for the required writing style and template required to complete the paper, just google for it.

name_title: James O'Connell Professor in the M athem atics department at Pace University (all)

ratings.comment: I made the mistake of taking this class because I'm usually a great math student and thought I'd be fine despite all reviews I read about him. DON'T MAKE THIS MISTAKE. Loves to go on tangents about an imaginary party in Brooklyn and how the Chainsmokers and Ariana Grande are the greatest artists. He doesn't use email either. Your GPA will DROP!!!

He's very rude to students. Makes mistakes constantly. Cannot provide any extra explanations beyond the textbook. He talks down to students. He misplaced one students test and told her that she didn't give it it. when a student had a complaint about a quiz he said loudly in front of the class that "your just upset because you didn't do well."

For someone who doesn't pick math up fast, I would not recommend. He doesn't spend much time explaining problems, he'll refer you to look at the text book for more information. He takes attendance everyday. Everything he does on the board is what is on the exams.  Take notes and start a class group chat for exams!!

He's a really sweet older gentleman. I'm not good in math and I did really well in his class. Just show up take notes and review them for the test and you'll get good grades. I appreciated his method of using colorful chalk on the board to explain topics. Definitely recommend for anyone not good in math.

He only sticks to what the book says, so if you have a question, he cannot answer it. It is like he is deficient in his own teaching matter. He messes up a lot and rarely notices until someone calls him out for it. I DO NOT RECOMMEND.

name_title: John Norman Professor in the History department at Western Michigan University

ratings.comment: 2 papers, 2 exams, 5 or 6 quizzes, and attendance and attentiveness is mandatory. He is very intelligent and passionate, but he goes off on tangents, says 'um' a LOT. As an ED major, I have to say that he doesn't *teach* his subject as well as he knows it. Pay very close attention during lectures; take notes. The texts are very helpful for exams.

I enjoyed the class a lot. He is very intelligent, with a great sense of humor. If you take notes and pay attention then you should do fine. 7 quizzes, mid term and  a final. I didnt do great on the quizzes but still got an A in the class.

Interesting class and very knowledgeable professor. Can be really hard to follow as he uses um, uh, and fumbles over his words a lot and he goes off on minor tangents now and again. If you go to class, participate and discussion and do not disrupt the class you shouldn't have to hard of a time.
My man! But horrible class

I don't know why everyone says they had such a hard time in this class. If you go to class pretty often and take notes you'll be fine. Just don't text or basically disrespect him while he's lecturing.

name_title: Clinton White Professor in the Accounting department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Professor "Skip" White is solid. He gives good feedback and is very pro-student. The final is optional. Lectures are dry with lists of definitions. There is a quiz based on reading materials every week. Group projects are relevant, though a bit tough with few in-class examples. Overall, I'd take another class with Prof. White.

Skip is a nice guy, but the teaching style was not helpful on homework, or group projects and overall this class just became a repetitive annoyance irrelevant to future career use. The final was optional though so make sure you work hard during the semester.

really nice guy once you get to know him from getting help on the projects in his office hours, which you have to do because he won't help over email, but the lectures are super dry and the material can be very boring for the most part

really nice guy, wants you to succeed so going to his office hours about the projects is super helpful because he goes through the answers with you. attendance is mandatory or you wont have any of the notes or know how to do the projects, do well the entire semester because at the end of the course the final is OPTIONAL!!! Very nice guy all around

I have never been so confused about a course in my life. Lectures were pointless and never went into depth with topics. Topics on exams are very random. The tests are only 4 short answer questions. You don't know the topic, you are screwed. The projects will help your grade. It will be confusing at first, but go to him and he will give you answers.

name_title: Gabriela Pozzi Professor in the Languages department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Dr. Pozzi is an insanely smart woman with a great fashion sense. However, ONLY take her class if you are genuinely interested in Spanish literature and language. You will make serious progress in your reading and comprehension and understanding of historic literature. Show up to class, participate, and put in as much effort as you can. Love her!

She really wants her students to learn the language. There is a lot of reading and answering questions, but if you do that, you will be fine. Although she says they are quizzes, they are really exams. Utilize what she gives you for the exams. Great prof who cares about her students and who really knows the subject she teaches.

Dr. Pozzi knows what she's talking about and is passionate about what she teaches but she is not always the most clear. She is a very hard grader and wants the paper written her way. She gives good feed back and will help over email or in her office hours but I did not enjoy the class. The amount of reading expected was very heavy!!

Lectures are EXTREMELY boring. Grades participation. I have more HW, reading and essays due in this class then any of my other 5 combined and its ridiculous. Really tough grader on essays and discussion forums. 2 5-7 pg essays, 1 8-10 pg essay, & 8 forum discussions which you will have to write a lot for if you want an A on them.

It's obvious to me that a lot of the students who rated this professor were lazy. She is an amazing instructor. She has helped me in my writing with very specific feedback. She has a great sense of humor and is very kind in class.

name_title: Diane Salinas Professor in the M athem atics department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Very good teacher. All you have to do is be in class and do homework to pass.
She managed to do a great job of making stats interesting, and made it possible to actually pass the class with a good grade
Deffinately the Stats 215 teacher to take
Great professor, down to earth, tries to make stats easy and fun.
Very fun class.  Made stats seem easy.  Down to earth, her only mistake is being a notre dame fan.

name_title: Philip O'Mara Professor in the English department at Bridgew ater College

ratings.comment: Prof. O'Mara is old school, but in a good way.
I will never forget his breaking into song when we read "Down by the Sallie Gardens." Love ya, Phil!

I had no idea what was going on the entire class. Maybe it was the random latin translations, german translations, or te fact that you cannot ask a question or make a comment without him telling you that you have no idea what your talking about or he responds to the question with an answer that makes no sense to the common man.
The best part about his class is the faces he gives you when he first opens the door to the class. He doesnt teach any english, and teaches you about everything except english. You cant get an A
Very smart, This guy can talk about almost anything. He will an answer any question.

name_title: Denise Krause Professor in the Social Science department at University at Buffalo (SUNY Buffalo)

ratings.comment: This class pushed me in the best way possible. I've taken several courses at UB, and this is the first one where I learned something meaningful. If you're not ready to handle a course this rigorous, then honestly, you may not be prepared for this program or the field itself. Denise is great!

Worst experience with a class ever. She gives the most vague instructions and then takes points off for... not doing what she literally never asked you to do? She is completely unreasonable and the administration couldn't care less. Skilled social worker? No, because you need empathy for that. She has NO EMPATHY. Awful I wish I could rate negatives

This professor has no empathy or a care for her students. Family/personal emergency? Doesn't matter to her. She expects blood, sweat, and tears in every word you type or say. Thinking about emailing her for a break from her dictatorship grading? You can, but don't expect kindness. You can't do anything wrong or you will FAIL.

This class is rigorous. Denise is a skilled social worker and you will learn a lot. I found her feedback invaluable and felt empowered to improve my skills. The assignments are a lot, but my advice is use LOTS of literature to support your own critical thinking. Through this approach, you'll develop a point of view as a SW, which she wants to see.
Absolutely unfair grader. She is not a realistic or understanding teacher. Her directions are very unclear. Her work load is unreasonable.

name_title: Holly Hoffman Professor in the Educ ation department at Central Michigan University

ratings.comment: Holly was amazing! I would 100% retake her. She was kind and caring, and she brought in snacks all the time. We did have weekly chapter quizzes that were for 10 points each. To pass them with 100%, you need to know some of the key information from the textbook, but overall, they weren't too hard. I would 100% recommend taking Holly's courses!

HOLLY IS THE BEST!! She is so much fun and energetic. She is an easy grader as long as you just try. There are weekly reading quizzes that you can work on with a group. Her lectures are so much fun and usually involve some form of learning interaction such as bingo/jeopardy/trivia. I recommend taking HDF303 with her even as an elective!

I love Holly. Her class is fun and if I had to take an 8 am, I'm glad it was hers. Her feedback is clear and she is always open to questions and discussion. The assignments are easy and kind of fun. I would definitely take another one of her classes and recommend her wholeheartedly. 10/10!

Holly is the most wonderful person and professor you will have for lifespan development. The class is so easy and there is hardly any homework assigned. Walking into the class, you can expect to laugh, smile, and stay engaged. Holly is such an understanding person and she cares more about you as an individual than a student. Great professor!

Professor Hoffman was so incredibly sweet and caring. She grades well and gives critics where you need them to allow you to grow, this does result in very little changes depending on the type of writer. She is so much fun and I really enjoyed her.

name_title: Kirk Korista Professor in the Science department at Western Michigan University

ratings.comment: The only assignments we received were 5 practice questions a couple days before an exam of over 60. It would have been more helpful to get 5 questions after each lecture. Constantly went 10+ minutes over class time, and I work so I would have to miss instruction due to his lack of preparation. Difficult to deal with, big ego, don't recommend.
h t t p s : / / w p . m e / p i i D k - d E

Here's the deal. Tests will be your biggest grade, for an intro class, the concepts are very complex and confusing. The lectures are indeed long and boring. Somethings may catch your eye, but how he teaches, is confusing. Easily one of the hardest courses I have taken (note: my major is not related to science.) while at WMU...

He doesn't know how to teach the physics classes! It would have been better for him if he was an astronomer in any of the observatories instead of a professor. None of the students like this guy. You cannot teach physics with a degree in astronomy, I think he should only teach astronomy courses but not core physics classes like Phys-3300 (ThermoD).

This class required a lot of work, but the pandemic changed the way classes were. He made a great effort to make the lectures interesting and funny. Like people have mentioned, it is difficult to study for the exams, as it is applying the concepts that he teaches, not memorizing and restating facts. Overall, good for learning, bad for testing.

name_title: Mark Mills Professor in the M athem atics department at Central College

ratings.comment: One of the best professors I have ever had!
I loved him as a professor but being involved and taking the class I was so stressed and the homework putting stress on my mental health definitely caused issues of focus.

By far the hardest course I have every completed in my life. I don't comprehend math very easily and if you are the same then just be aware this class will be a NIGHTMARE. Tons of homework and very tough grader, the amount of time outside of class for me to pull off a C damaged my mental health. He is kind though and tries his best to help

Dr. Mills is an amazing professor, he teaches very well at a good pace with plenty of examples of how to do each topic. I have had him for easier and very tough classes and all of them were clearly explained and I learned a ton. He cares a lot about his students and is very accessible if you have questions. He is an amazing professor and person.
He is such a helpful professor and really cares about the grades of his students. He's probably the most dorky person I've ever met, but in a good way. He rocks!

name_title: Dennis Devlin Professor in the History department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Be prepared to bring a book. He's so BORING!

Professor Devlin is an interesting character-I think we covered a part of history he really likes this past semester and his enthusiasm grew on my class. He is a hard grader, only uses lecture to convey information. You don't have to do the reading because all the info he wants he lectures on really. I'd recommend him but it depends on the person.

Devlin is a hard grader and although I wish he would use more than just lecture to get notes and information to us, he is a good teacher. Although I haven't done well on the 2 papers this semester he graded, it's motivating me to do better the next 3 semesters I'm in my honors sequence. Quite honestly I love this sequence more than any other class!

NOT A GOOD TEACHER, all test are essays and no extra credit aviable. Half of the class left at break everytime. He needs to retire. Gives you bad feedback and will not help you when asked. Plus he shows up late every week!

DEVIL.  HE SHOULD NOT BE ALLOWED TO STILL BE A PROFESSOR.  End of story.  Useless.  Boring.  Hasn't updated a lesson plan in at least 30+ years.  Still using same thing, same note pads with the same boring notes.  Tests are near impossible.  He is quite jerky, arrogant, and bullheaded.  Does not know as much as he thinks he does... "Run awaaaaay!"

name_title: Ann Keister Professor in the Fine Arts department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: She's a really nice professor who tries her best to help you out.  I enjoyed 2D Design with her.  She does what she can and is moderately easy-going about due dates. Only thing is she's a little slow with technology.  However, I would still recommend her.

Ann is a sweetheart but a hard grader. She is sometimes unclear about what she wants in a project, but she is heavy in demonstrations so that makes up for it. I'd take her again, despite her being a hard grader.

She is alright. Sometimes inconsistent with her grading. (will tell you to change one thing one day and then something different the next) Also she is not as familiar with the programs that she works with as she should be (ex: Illustrator).

I love Ann.  Love her so much that I had to take her twice in one year.  Sure she is sometimes forgetful and flustered but she helps out a lot.  Ask her anytime to critique a project and she will tell you what you should do to get a better grade.  I think her own art is beautiful as well, very talented.  My fav prof at GV by far.

Where to start...Don't expect to breeze through the class.  While the concepts are fairly simple, shes demanding when it comes to "craft."  As far as her teaching ability, there is none.  Shes horrible at explaining things and knows nothing about computers.  She once asked me what CS2 was!!

name_title: Dick Hall Professor in the Business department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: ok guy, fair, open note (not book) tests, but class avg. was stil 81% work somewhat and get an A-

This guy has no clue of what he is doing. If you want to be bored to death looking at a power point for the entire class - he is great. If you actually want to learn something AVOID him - he is worthless. No interaction at all between him and the class.
If you go to class the before and on quizzes days thats all you really need.  Material and lecture are pretty dry but as mentioned earlier, easy A
totally worthless, easy A

Great professor overall, if you miss a quiz, he will let you take it during his office hours.  Open notes on test and on final, lets you use all notes.    Does not take attendance.  1/2 of the class was always gone.  Test are right from book

name_title: Harold Drake Professor in the History department at University of California Santa Barbara

ratings.comment: One of the best history teachers I ever had. Each lecture was a gem.
He is an excellent professor!  I learned so much and I didn't know that the assassination of Caesar could be so funny.  I was lucky to have him before he retires.

Drake was a great professor -- interesting lectures, well-organized, helpful... but certainly wasn't an easy class. There's a ton of reading involved, which is crucial to the 2 essays you write in the class (most difficult aspect of the class). Midterms and finals aren't as hard, but they are in essay format and will be impossible if you haven't re
No Comments
Drake was awesome, my favorite professor by far. The class is challenging but he is really entertaining in lecture and the content is interesting.

name_title: Mary Connolly Professor in the Computer Science department at Saint Mary's College

ratings.comment: A true living saint. She loves St. Mary's and all her students she really wants you to succeed. One time I was taking a test and she could see I was questioning if I was right or not and she made the comment "I really like the look of that graph" would take her class again just to have her as my professor again

Mary Connolly is the most caring person I have ever met. She supposedly retired a few years back, but I am so happy that she was able to teach this course. The course was not an easy one, but if you go to her and ask for help, it is easy to get an A. She cares a lot about her students and wants everyone to succeed.

She is a great professor. She was always available for help outside of class if needed. The tests are really hard but everything else was easy, especially since she will walk you through it, just ask.
She is not a good teacher

She's an amazing teacher!  I was new to computer programming and she understood most of the students were new to the content.  She's super encouraging and helpful!  I came to her multiple times to help with my programs and she responded quickly to my questions over e-mail!  The tests were tough, but if you go to class, you should do well.

name_title: Ben Rudolph Professor in the Business department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: One of the most useful classes I have taken, largely due to the quality of the professor.  Involves real-world companies with current problems, and his brutal honesty always keeps lectures relevant and entertaining.  He will be retiring soon, but I would strongly recommend taking one of his classes if you get the chance.

He's a great professor.  His lectures are interesting and well paced with tons of interesting stories and videos.  He gives weekly reading and geography quizzes which aren't bad but do mean you have to read your books, however his exams only cover his lectures.  If your at all interested in marketing I would strongly recommend him.

Professor Rudolph was great!  He was absolutely hilarious and that made the class fly by.  He gave a lot of great examples for each concept being covered.  He showed some pretty interesting videos as well.  This professor is extremely experienced and knowledgeable in the field of marketing.  Take him if you get the chance!
Classes are entertaining.  I really WANTED to go to this class just to hear what Professor Rudolph would say next.  It really made me interested in marketing.

This professor is very blunt, rude, and borderline offensive.  On the other hand he is realistic and very honest.  In this class you can real marketing exposure by visiting actual companies and you are treating like a consultant.  The project and exam is a breeze.  Would take again.  BTW, You won't use the book at all.

name_title: Thomas Willey Professor in the Finance department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Willey doesn't teach anything, he just does the work and hopes you are following along. He doesn't explain how to do any of the work he assigns. The whole class is based on a simulation game that he also doesn't explain. The whole class is always confused and the way he runs his class makes no sense. Waste of time and money

This professor is the worst. Listen to all the bad reviews! I promise you will regret taking his class. Practice exams DO NOT align with real exams, the Fin Game makes no sense, he rambles endlessly, and he teaches nothing in class. He makes you email him everything and will not give 100% participation even if you did everything. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Avoid! Coming from a student with a 3.9 GPA, I struggled to even pass this class. Lectures & practice problems don't relate at all to the exam, & going to class is pointless. You'll be confused on the simulation the entire time with no help. Cases weren't too bad, but he will take points off for grammar & organization even if there are no mistakes.

Please save yourself and take anyone else. Nothing he lectures about or gives as handouts will be similar to the exams. If you do well on the cases, he will give you a 90 or 95 with no explanation as to why you may have gained or lost 5 points between cases. He's a nice guy and is very willing to fix mistakes, but you won't learn much here. Beware!

Willey is a nice guy. However, his lectures are the most unorganized mess I've ever seen. Taps through stock slides from years ago while following random rabbit holes. Second half of class he goes through problems, nothing like the exams. Exams are impossible, but  answers on Chegg. Doesn't know how to use excel (even geomean). You won't learn.

name_title: Mike Kasperlik Professor in the Science department at Grand Rapids Community College

ratings.comment: Mike always has connected to the students.  He has an approachable personality and makes the lessons hit home.
Rad tech student. Class of 2003. He was the most easiest going and funniest Professor I have ever had. Most importantly of all he was your friend also.
Great Great Teacher!! He was awesome!!!!
Great teacher!  loved his class and recommend it to anyone who needs med term.  Kept me interested with his stories.  Had a good personallity and was very approachable.
Great class. He knows what he's talking about. He's fun and helpful at the same time - I wish he'd rub off on all the other teachers out there!

name_title: Arthur Campbell Professor in the Fine Arts department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Professor. Campbell was one of the kindest professors I've ever had. Even as a science major, I deeply enjoyed this class. He is one of the most knowledgeable professors at the university and makes learning fun through many interactive activities. I highly recommend him to any student!

The class is an easy A and he makes it clear that you can pass just by showing up and doing the work. The worksheets are easy, the answers are given. He also gives out extra credit by going to concerts. The exams, he gives the answer to prior to. The class isn't hard and you really don't need to try. Show up and do the work, simple and easy.

Dr. Campbell was great. He talks a lot but it was ok. We also listen to a lot of music. Grading is super easy. There are 10 participation quizzes. Which is 50% of class grade. 25% is on a presentation that is really easy and the final exam is 25%. He gives the final word for word before hand so the class is a free A and it was kind of fun.

Possibly the most influential teacher that I've ever worked with. He is encouraging and kind, yet always realistic in his expectations. I always look forward to clarinet lessons with him, and I am never disappointed with the wisdom that I glean from his teaching.

Dr. Campbell is not only a phenomenal clarinetist, but is a prolific teacher as well.  He can acclimate himself to work differently with people(because everyone is so different!).  He doesn't sugar-coat, and is very honest with you about your overall performance.  Under his guidance, I've not only become an excellent player, but a professional one!

name_title: Stan Krohmer Professor in the Liberal Studies department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: He is a funny old guy. Very easy class compared to the other sections, just read short stories and discussed the meaning of them, occasionally writing reflections. Not difficult at all. Basically just talk the entire class period. I encourage you to take tally of how many times he will say "uh" during his lectures. Funny guy.
Loved Krohmer's class. Overall a great professor, he just wants to see students giving an effort in their writing and in class to apply the topics he teaches

I would never take his class ever again. Class time was beyond boring all I did was other homework in it. He lectures for the entire class period about irrelevant things. His lectures are boring and he rambles on and on and then expects the class to participate.

Krohmer was a hard grader but a decent professor. Sometimes his lectures were great and sometimes it would be a struggle to stay awake(DO NOT FALL ASLEEP. This one guy did, and Krohmer roasted him in front of the class and proceeded to make him leave). Also, if you miss more than 4 classes you automatically fail. And he's a stickler on attendance.

Krohmer is really down to earth. He is kinda like a philosopher so be ready for deep thinking. He talks a lot during class and you don't really do much besides just chill and listen to him talk about life. This class reminded me of a learn how to do good in college class.

name_title: David Griffith Professor in the Anthropology department at East Carolina University

ratings.comment: Honestly I stopped showing up to class early on and still managed to get a B. You'll probably enjoy his class if you enjoy learning about Anthropology. Personally, I find it boring so I just didn't care. I don't recommend skipping though, he didn't like that.

Extremely nice guy, go to class or watch his online lecture and you will do well. Have to write short daily journals after the class is over, and turn in with every exam. Exams are straightforward and made of only a couple writing questions, he is very passionate about anthropology which makes the class enjoyable. Would recommend for a WI credit.

Okay, so I'm not going to punish Prof Griffith for having a horrible grad TA SPRG 13, but yeah, better communication would have been nice. Loved taking Dr. Griffith though. Funny guy, very smart and very helpful! Go to class, look over the study guides and you'll do just fine.
Great guy. Generous on grades.
interesting class, take notes and study them and you'll be fine, read book for additional info. They're both really nice..you'll enjoy this upper level class.

name_title: Michael Cotsell Professor in the English department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: So the class is only 2 papers, both of which you can revise for an A. The other grade is a final exam which is online, at home 3 question close reading that you can use your notes to take. You do not need to buy the textbooks because all the readings are on google. Just go to class, a volunteer to read every once and a while. He is a sweet man.
Knows a lot about the class material and is really helpful. Sit in the front and you will hear him fine. Easy A and great professor.
Love him! So cute and a very caring professor.

Amazing professor! He does talk quietly but just sit near the front and you'll be fine. He's actually very interesting if you make the effort to participate and do the readings. I highly recommend going to office hours because he's really easy to talk to outside of class. Cotsell is the man!

Dr. Cotsell has easily become my favorite professor. He has the best sense of humor and I really enjoy how laid back his lectures are. The class is based on 2 essays and a take home exam, and as long as you show up and participate as best as you can, you will be more than fine. He's also extremely helpful during office hours!

name_title: Doug Walker Professor in the Communic ation department at Asbury University

ratings.comment: Wonderful, wonderful, God loving man. Do you work, be sincere, and don't try to cheat the system and you will get a good grade. He isn't a push over, but he does have a huge heart for his students.

Do your work. Do not wait till last minute with his projects. He wants to help you succeed but it is up to you as an individual to seek help when you need it. He is a hard grader, but with that said his expectations are clear right from the start. Give it your all.
The nicest guy who's not afraid to fail you. Do the work and you'll be fine.
Horrible teacher

Tough, but eminently fair. Do your best on every assignment, or you'll end up missing on some major opportunities. There is quite a workload for this class; lots of projects, but only one or two tests, and no quizzes. Lots of reading, but he doesn't check it. Ultimately, do your best and you'll be fine.

name_title: Fred Coolidge Professor in the Psychology department at University of Colorado Colorado Springs

ratings.comment: Very inconsistent. Rude and demeaning. Expects you to know things he never taught. Entire grade based on a few assignments. Did I say inconsistent?

Prof Coolidge is a fantastic professor who enjoys the subject and thoroughly enjoys when teaching his courses. I have a computer science background, but I took evolutionary neuropsychology and abnormal psychology under him, and I did not want to miss any lectures. I absolutely would take more courses with him.
I love the stories that Prof. Coolidge shares during his lectures -- really helps in remembering the content!

I don't know what to say. This online class was less than beneficial. He seemed like he would be great in person... I have zero idea what being taught. Make a friend do the online quizzes together. Awful. But an A. Now what for the next stats class. Terrified as I have no idea what happened in this class.... Beware.

I'm not sure Prof C is just radically different in-person, but his online lectures are captivating and easy to understand. The quiz questions come straight from the questions at the end of each chapter of the book and the book itself is very easy to comprehend. I am awful at math, yet found this course and its concepts incredibly easy thanks to him

name_title: Erika King Professor in the Political Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: She's not a bad teacher, I just don't like how boring class was. I'm a major in psychology and I always dreaded going to her class because I felt like it was a waste of time. However, lectures are usually short (45 min) and you can go in, grab nametag, sit through lecture, then leave. She crams a ton of info in too quickly and leaves me drained.

Very insightful and interesting lectures. Tries to tie almost everything into modern day topics. Can be dull in terms of course material, but she does her best to make the constitution bearable. Very sweet and welcoming.

Dr king is a really nice person. Class is very fun if you are interested in talking about politics. She really has a passion for this class. She loves students who participate and speak up in class. She is high expecting in grading. Overall a good prof whos a very nice and caring person. Would definitely take a class with her again.

The Capstone with Dr. King was great. She really tries to open the class up to topics that we are interested in, rather than lecturing us on what she think is relevant. Sometimes, this lent itself to the class falling of the rails with very crazy class arguments, but most of the time it was very fun and insightful. Great, respected professor.

Very knowledgeable on Media and politics. Her lectures can be long but she loves students who participate. She has quite a few SMALL papers and then one large research paper. All the papers are pretty easy and come straight from the readings.

name_title: Gary Huey Professor in the History department at Ferris St ate University

ratings.comment: Finished this class above 100% due to the amount of extra credit he hands out.  i would get extra credit just for showing up. also has a zoom option for his class which comes in handy. his main textbook you dont really need if you pay attention in lectures, but it is helpful.\if you actually try theres no reason you shouldnt get an A

Gary is an absolutely amazing professor. He treats everyone with the most respect and he's just the sweetest guy in the world. His lectures may be a bit boring to some people, but he's so knowledgeable about his topics and I love listening to his lectures.

Professor Huey is a caring instructor who wants students to succeed. The workload is manageable, with open-note exams and extra credit opportunities. unstuck AI is a helpful study tool alongside the textbook.

He is the absolutely the best professor I have ever had. Tests are all online, class isn't mandatory and he does a zoom link so you don't have to be in class.  Great personality and loves when you get to know him!!
Such a sweet old man. He makes it impossible to fail. 100% recommend him!

name_title: Jim Dunn Professor in the Science department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: Very easy class, watch the lectures and you will do great. Professor Dunn is very passionate about what he teaches.

If you attend lecture you will pass class. Make sure you take down notes of all of his examples because those usually show up on the quizzes and make sure you study the quizzes because those end up on the tests. He has a very sarcastic personality and is very blunt which is why I found him very funny and loved going to class!

I really enjoyed Professor Dunn. He was super supportive of his students and helped me a lot with projects when I had questions. Even met with me so I could get clarity for my forest paper and how to write it correctly. I learned a lot from this class, and he is a lot of fun and laid back. Get to go outside a bunch too!

He was very disorganized, but he posted study guides for the exams that basically spelled out most of the questions. His lectures were interesting, and he had lots of personal stories that helped make concepts easy to remember. This is why I would say it's a "show up & pass" class; if you paid attention during lecture, most of the info would stick.
He is an incredibly tough grader. Very unorganized. Confusing to follow in class. Doesn't really give you any help.

name_title: Mary Kilgallen Professor in the English department at Ferris St ate University

ratings.comment: Two classes.  Notice most low reviews complain about homework, or required attendance.  Some about quizzes - these were easy if you just did the assigned reading.  Essays - easy to get a good grade if you did the essay.  Attendance - well, of course you have to be there.  I actually learned from her, instead of just getting a grade.
A great prof if you pay attention and do the work

had to withdraw (out of state cost me even more) from her class i hate her but my favorite thing she said one day was there are 6 parts of speech no there are 8 and i know that because of the 50 pages i had to reed in a night between classes while writing an essay

She's horrible. I used to love English and then I took her class. I was out one day ('cause of the flu that went around) and she practically bit my head off when I went and asked her for the work. She makes you feel retarded if you ask for help. DON'T TAKE HER IF YOU HAVE ANY OTHER OPTION.

I am not one of those people who cares what a professor looks like. All I care about is that they teach what I need to know, so I can do well on the tests. I don't care how boring the material is there is always a way of making it intresting and she just doesn't do it. I wouldn't never reccomend the teacher, not even to my worst enemy.

name_title: Alejandro Saldivar Professor in the M athem atics department at Grand Rapids Community College

ratings.comment: The class itself is very hard and there were quizzes every week, but if you study hard, ask questions, and do the homework you will be fine. I will say, more than half the class dropped by the end of the semester. But if you hold on and stick through it you will find that his personality will truly come out and he cares heavily about your grade.

I had a really great time in his class, but you have to work for it. The class is very hard and you are only graded based on quizzes and the final exam. Since my class was online everything was open note, no time limit. Very fun and his lectures were helpful. While is teaching style works for me might not be the best for everyone.

I loved having professor Saldivar for precalc and calc,is method worked for me and I enjoyed the class. Explains everything, loves the subject, good at not making people feel stupid for questions. Very nice honestly, wish I could have had him for calc2.

Grades were based on test and quizzes. Test and quizzes are based off of the lecture (mostly doing examples) and HW; there would be hints to the answer too. There are extra credit in tests and quizzes which is probably the reason why I got an A in the class. He is a funny and nice teacher too, but I get nervous when I come to class.

Like many others have said, Prof. Saldivar is a tough grader. He does give partial credit on tests, however it is minimal. There is quite a bit of homework but if you do it all you will likely do fine in the class. Prof. Saldivar seems to care about his students and is clearly passionate about the subject.

name_title: Nancy Forrest Professor in the M athem atics department at Grand Rapids Community College

ratings.comment: The professor was so caring and explained math problems very well, I have never been good at math until I took this class.

Professor Forrest is a caring instructor who makes the material easy to follow. While the ALEKS-based class has a heavy workload, she posts helpful notes and is always willing to provide extra support. unstuck ai was a great study tool that complemented the course.

Professor Forrest is one of the sweetest, most compassionate professors I've had so far. I did not end up performing well in this class, but it was completely nobody's fault except my own; she would tell these adorable math-related puns! I cannot put into words how much I loved her this semester. I'd be honored to have her as my professor again.

I LOVED Nancy Forrest. This is basically an online course since she uses Aleks... it is really important to keep organized- do not slack off! Group projects- I thought I would hate them, but they weren't too bad. Occasional projects (they are easy). Tests are the review tests on Aleks but shorter. Pretty easy class with a PHENOMINAL math mom. :)

This class is basically an online class if you have ALEKS. I will say this and I mean it. DO NOT SLACK ON THE MODULES. trust me. professor Forrest is easily one of if not the best professors at the college. She is very open and wants to see her students succeed. But if you don't take the modules seriously you simply wont do good. Shoutout math mom

name_title: Ming Wang Professor in the Science department at Grand Rapids Community College

ratings.comment: Professor Wang lectures FOREVER leaving little time to do lab, and is hard to understand. He is VERY condescending and hostile when you ask questions. Says your lab looks correct but marks off points when he grades later. Overall, he creates a hostile learning environment that leaves students discouraged, confused, and unmotivated.

**Take a different prof** As a person he is nice, but as a prof he is not good. He spends about half of lab going over tiny details, which leaves us no time to do the lab. He calls you out in front of everyone if you don't know how to do something. Also, he says your work and packet look correct but then takes points off when grading.

Prof Wang clearly knows the material very well, and he grades our labs in a very detailed manner. But he doesn't know how to teach. He reliably talks for more than half the class, is not accommodating of anyone who doesn't entirely understand the material, and ultimately creates a very hostile learning environment. Don't take this prof.
Not willing to answer questions, there is always some sort of push back from him like its a bother.
labs are very forgiving. Light work load. Can seem arrogant or condescending but really isn't. Always willing to answer questions in class. Just make sure you actually ask them.

name_title: Barbara Wallace Professor in the Fine Arts department at Dallas Baptist University

ratings.comment: Dr. Wallace has been the most discouraging professor I have had yet in my college career. I came in doing ok, but the second I began to struggle, she told me numerous times that I was "drowning". She plays major favorites; if she doesn't like you she'll make sure you know it. She expects you to know everything, and if you don't, you're screwed

She's really a good teacher. If she likes you, you'll do alright. But you have to work hard for it. If she doesn't like you (usually just because you struggle a little more and need extra instruction) she's pretty standoffish.
Super sweet, great at communicating material in a well organized and easy to understand manner.

A few other people have already said this, but she told me to quit as well. Avoiding her classes throughout my music degree was practically impossible, so I changed my major. Coming into college, I loved music. Taking her class made me dread it.

Do NOT take this professor. She is rude and demeaning. On the first day of class, she shared with us how her husband learned to speak fluent Russian in only six weeks by speaking nothing but Russian. Dr. Wallace expects the same commitment from her students, giving no mind to the other five classes we are taking. Be prepared to overwork yourself.

name_title: Steve Mullen Professor in the Religion department at Dallas Baptist University

ratings.comment: Dr. Mullen is by far the best professor I have ever had. I wish he taught full time and not just as an adjunct, but I'm very happy he was able to retire. One of the best men you'll ever meet.

Loved the professor. Took him for an online mini term and was extremely time consuming. Learned a ton, but it was a lot of homework, four lessons a week, midterm, research paper, and final all in a four week class. Extremely knowledgeable and very easy to work with. Loved him, just get ready to work. Not an easy class.

Make sure to read the book!!He gives out a 3-5 question quiz over the chapters. His tests consist of study guide that he wrote (it's like $20 in the book store) and random facts that he says in his lectures. Overall, he is a good prof, he cares a lot. Also, I think he might be one of the better RELI teachers. Quizlet is your best friend.

Dr. Mullen is rated so highly because he is truly an amazing person who loves what he does. Extremely high quality professor but I worked my butt off for a C which was upsetting. I thought it was a difficult class and it was the only class I didn't get an A in. Take it only if you have extensive knowledge of religion and read the text book!
He is amazing, interesting lectures, has very good knowledge of what he teaches and is very good at teaching it

name_title: Curtis Smith Professor in the Languages department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: I really loved him as a professor. He's very passionate about the language and the culture altogether. Definitely wants you to succeed. He seems like he wants all his students to be as obsessed with Chinese and China as he is though so that can seem a tad overbearing. Study hard and try your best and you'll do fine.

I have to agree with those who have taken Smith for their Asia Civ sequence. He is extrememly hard to understand when it comes to essays and a tough grader. He's passionate, but spends too much time on Chinese poetry. Secondly, his student-teacher relations are fairly tense, he doesn't reach out and remains cold throughout the semester.

For a CIV sequence, he is a terrible professor. He's clearly very knowledgable and passionate about his subject, but cannot teach it in an interesting or easy-to-study way. Three hours of endless boredom in his class. Waaayyy too obsessed with Chinese poetry, he talks about nothing else. Also, incredibly tough grader on papers-pretty unreasonable.

I took him for my civ sequence, so skip my review if you're taking him for a language.  He's a really nice person, but the class is hard.  This civ sequence was harder than the others, from what I've seen in my friends, and he grades papers really hard.  It's hard to understand what he wants from you for the papers.

You jump right in translating everything; there is a lot of time dedicated to this particular class. He expects you to be absolutely in love with Classical Chinese, but he keeps his expectations with the quality of the translations realistic. Sporadically puts things on blackboard. Answers questions if you ask, though, and is understanding.

name_title: Quentin Williams Professor in the Science department at University of California Santa Cruz

ratings.comment: Quentin is a great teacher! He's funny, very knowledgeable and in general his lectures are very to the point and clear. Lectures are not recorded so I HIGHLY suggest just going to class, powerpoints are just pictures so unless you go in person you will not understand the material.

Quentin in spirit is a wonderful teacher who cares about the subject he is teaching and I really respect him for that, but like many of the other teacher in the department you will likely have some difficulty working with him if you have accessibility needs because of how he conducts tests. Additionally his tests on ambigious details
Professor Williams is very funny and makes the class fun and interesting. It's just the material is pretty hard, you need to work really hard for a good grade.
Pretty tough class but it's very interesting. Tough exams but there is usually a curve. Take notes on as much as you can :)

Class taught with Zachos, they're hilarious. If you can keep up you'll realize he doesn't take tangents it's all related and important, though not necessarily to the question you're solving at that moment. Quant qns are HARD until you cut the fat & they're simple. He's the head of the dept, I dare you to figure out who's his spouse without asking.

name_title: Malinda Mc Murry Professor in the Science department at Morehead St ate University

ratings.comment: Challenging lab with clear expectations, but the professor is helpful. Use unstuck study and stay on top of the work to do well.

As someone who had all A's in everything but this lab, I fought for the B I got. She will tell you that she's there to help, but she doesn't respond very well to students asking for help. She is an EXTREMELY particular grader, you will get points off for stuff as stupid as how you write your letters and if she thinks they are capitalized or not.

McMurry knows what she is talking about however she isnt very good at teaching it. The Biology 234 had many long detailed lectures that took hours. If this is your only class that might be okay but with 4 or 5 other classes it makes it impossible. On average you would need at least 4-5 hours a day to study for her test and/or exams.

Ms. McMurry was a great lab instructor. She explains everything in depth and will go over something with you if you don't understand it. Her exams were difficult but if you study for them you should do pretty good on them. She does except a lot of you and their is a lot of homework to go along with the class. She does do quizzes before every class.

Do NOT take this class. I am good at biology and chemistry and her class is impossible. It was fine for the first two weeks then you're taking quizzes over 6 hours of lecture every week with 70 question exams that are nothing like the past quizzes. She WANTS you to fail. Dropped and taking it through community collect.

name_title: Richard Raspet Professor in the Science department at University of Mississippi

ratings.comment: Gives traditional cramming tests. A student can pass easily without understanding the material but, remembering notes and previous tests.
Great Professor, loved it
Great Professor
No Comments
very ignorant professor. doesn't know much but pretends he does.

name_title: Randy Ross Professor in the M athem atics department at Morehead St ate University

ratings.comment: He is a stereotypical college professor. For me, his teaching style of give instructions then do problems worked, but it isn't for everyone. I learned a lot in the class. The class is weighted on tests so be prepared to study.

Please by all means stay away. Was absolutely horrible with both homework and teaching. I took 152 enhanced which is for people that struggled with math and the whole class consisted of teaching calculus to students that started from below the bar and expected them to understand it. You only had a day to digest a chapters worth of content, a day.

This class was average, it wouldn't be so difficult if he hadn't uploaded just papers with notes as "lectures." You basically have to teach yourself the math because you won't get an online lecture or video walking you through the steps. Also, if you don't finish an assignment/quiz on time, you automatically receive a 0 and cannot make it up.
Great math professor. Easy grade with minimal effort. Online you can easily use quizlet or Chegg to help you with your homework and exams aren't hard as long as you are doing the work.

this professor is really good for someone who is not the best at math he helped me understand things better than I ever could before in math, but watch out for the exams as long as you know what you are doing you will be fine!

name_title: Pamela Gardner Professor in the Educ ation department at San Diego St ate University

ratings.comment: Very good teacher.  Listen, take notes, be on time and the class is totally reasonable.  She is strict on APA so make sure you do it correctly.  Also, for tests...study her powerpoints & don't worry as much about reading the book
Pam is the Best! really helpful & she is an easy graded. Do your work & go to class for her in class activities and you will get an A. Really interesting class as well! highly recommended.
Professor Gardner's class was very interesting. Class is mandatory because she gives 10 in class activities during the semester randomly. She was really nice and understanding.

she is a very nice teacher, but her classes are not very relevant to the tests. the questions for her tests are from the texts test bank, therefore the test is from the text but also from the random side notes she states in class. there are easier teachers you can take for CFD 270.

Pam is unbelievable! She is one of the most influential teachers at SDSU. She makes class fun by showing a lot of great videos and is always willing to answer any questions the students may have. She posts her lectures on BB so don't buy the book. Her class is fun and she always finds a way to make her students come first! MUST TAKE!!

name_title: David Bush Professor in the Psychology department at Villanova University

ratings.comment: you get to hear interesting storis about his past. Thats all. No structure to class at all.

I had really hoped to learn something in this class. His stories were all outdated.  I didn't learn a thing. Assignment for a paper was very vague; found out just before due date from classmate that he changed the assignment for her, but didn't tell entire class?! Luckily class was only 1 credit. Can't imagine having him weekly for entire semester!
Don't enter the HRD program
He does ramble on about nothing! He's nice, and the books are ok, but I couldn't learn a thing from him. I doubt anyone could.
He's got tenure. He likes you. He rambles on about nothing. Absolutely nothing. He doesn't say one useful thing in class. The books are fine, but forget learning anything from him.

name_title: Lori Jager Professor in the Communic ation department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: This professor spends a lot of time talking about her personal life instead of lecturing about the ciriculum. Her lectures will not prepare you for the coursework, plan on reading the textbook and referencing it.
The workload is manageable, but the professor can come across as condescending at times. For study prep, Unstuck AI and the textbook were helpful resources.
Very nice lady. Work load is manageable. I would have enjoyed this class more if it was a 93 for an A instead of a 95.

Required a textbook but hardly used it. Came off condescending when you asked questions. Took awhile to respond and wasn't helpful. Exams were easy but got marked down multiple points is your answer was missing one thing she was looking for. Assignments and projects were lengthy and hard. Not the worst professor but avoid taking her if you can.
rude and unhelpful

name_title: Stuart Sweeney Professor in the Geography department at University of California Santa Barbara

ratings.comment: The class should just be called "Surfing" - actual geographical concepts only take up a few weeks and it feels like he had to add content on surfing history and wave science just to fill the rest of the quarter. Overall a pretty average lecturer but it's exactly what you'd expect from a surfer - very laid back and yet very knowledgeable.

Sweeney is my fav professor. Super cool surfer guy. 3 writing assignments at the start of the quarter. 2 midterms and a final. Content is super interesting but you def have to study. Honors section was the best part we just watched surf movies. If you can take this class, take it. He also rounded up my grade alot which I appreciate. Great dude. !!!

I love prof Sweeney! there are 2-3 midterms and a final, but ours was not cumulative. Tests are 87% of our grades so you really have to study. The stuff you learn about it super fun and interesting even if you don't surf! he also rounded my grade a lot which was really helpful. lectures and sections were not mandatory. highly recommend as a GE!

Super nice professor who clearly wants his students to succeed! Passionate about surfing and shares his own anecdotes/loves hearing student's stories. Plenty of extra credit opportunities and lectures are pretty interesting...would definitely recommend!
Get the books on time and use a planner for the reading and papers

name_title: P at Gibbons Professor in the Science department at Washington University in St. Louis

ratings.comment: sucked
Lacked enthusiasm in teaching

I found it very difficult to follow explanations from the instructor. I was able to get by during the first two units based on knowledge I had gained from my AP Physics class in high school. Unclear explanations and mistakes in problems by Professor Gibbons left the class reserved and nervous about answering questions. The book was not helpful.

I sympathize with Professor Gibbons, but he is a little too old to teach. He is really not clear, sometimes he can't even understand our questions. The course is easy enough so it wasn't a total disaster. But for anyone without prior physics knowledge I suggest you find another section for 197 ASAP, because u will be stuck with him for 198 as well.
Good teacher, friendly and available. Class is both easy and interesting. Does not take attendance. I don't see why everyone finds his class so boring, I had fun.

name_title: Lee Newton Professor in the English department at Bradley University

ratings.comment: Awesome professor!
Lots of time to do assignments. Lots of guest speakers.

This class was basically a stepping stone for freshman English majors which was very helpful. There was only three assignments and they were all helpful outside of the classroom setting. Lots of guest speakers who were helpful for all different career fields. Professor Newton is the reason I even am and English major and encouraged me to do more.

An amazing professor and mentor. He is everything anyone would want in a professor. He pushes his students for their best, yet is very understanding. Feedback is the perfect blend of constructive criticism. If he does have favored students it really does not affect those he does not know as well which is rare in the english department. Take Him!
Best Professor at Bradley by far.

name_title: Claire Etaugh Professor in the Psychology department at Bradley University

ratings.comment: I loved having Dr. Etaugh for this class, the subject matter was interesting and she made it fun to go to class everyday. There are daily quizzes but if you do the readings you will do completely fine, I would recommend this class to all Psych majors and WGS minors

Get ready to read. Won't pass if you do not read chapters clearly. The quizzes are hard and you take them every single class day at the beginning. She is supposed to be a "woke" teacher but definitely used some derogatory terms. Asked us to tell the whole class about our body image. Seems like she would be a nice lady. The class periods were boring

This professor had us put if we wanted our body weight to be larger or smaller on a board in front of the class. She also doesn't use canvas and you are required to calculate your own grade. The information taught in the class if useful but the teacher made me uncomfortable.

Etaugh has to be one of the nicest professors in the Psychology department. She usually doesn't give any tests or quizzes, but you will have to go to class everyday because your grade is based on daily quizzes over the assigned readings.

This was by far one of my favorite classes at Bradley. I highly recommend taking her!! She is so nice and this class was extremely interesting and eye opening. It was also super easy. The only grades were short quizzes at the beginning of every class and 13 journal entires. The short quizzes also had an extra credit question too.

name_title: Brad Andersh Professor in the Chemistry department at Bradley University

ratings.comment: He is def. the best professor I have ever had at Bradley in the science department. He truly cares about his students and does everything in his power to make sure we understand the material. Always available outside of class and hosts q+a sessions every week. Take home assignments instead of in class quizzes. 10/10 professor + would def. recommend

One of my favorite profs at Bradley. Perfect prof to introduce o chem. Very accessible outside of class, with office hours, q&a sessions every week. It is clear he wants his students to succeed, understand material, and be prepared for o chem II. Take home assign. allow for learning material w/o pressure of in-class quizzes. Would 100% recommend.
Dr. Andersh has a tendency to pick on certain students. He is also a very harsh grader and often would grade my take home assignments harsher than other students.

Dr. Andersh is one of the best professors on this campus. He cares so much about his students and making sure you understand the material. He is super funny and actually makes class enjoyable. It's a tough class but he makes it worth it. 100% recommend him.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Explained everything so clearly, and he gave exam reviews that were really helpful to go to. I would highly highly HIGHLY recommend taking class with Dr. Andersh.

name_title: Ted Sundstrom Professor in the M athem atics department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: He's a nice and incredibly intelligent man. The problem is, he's sometimes mumbling and rambling for the whole class.  He means well, but his abundance of knowledge gets the best of him.  He goes off on tangents for each problem, and has a hard time putting what he means into words. Always happy to answer questions thoroughly though. Overall okay.

Wouldn't recommend taking this solely as a supplemental writing class because there is a lot of math and work. As for math majors, he is a good math 210 especially when he uses the "flipped classroom" method, one section per class is easy to cover and you do in class problems. Kinda funny guy, GO TO OFFICE HOURS for portfolio problems.

He's a nice guy and really means well, but he is an awful professor.He doesn't explain the material well at all and just tells you what it should be, instead of teaching you.  I found myself having to go through the book and teaching myself what we were learning. He's always happy to answer questions though.

Good professor, he was very helpful if you asked him. Sometimes he explained things that didn't make sense, but was always willing to clarify if anyone asked. Fairly easy grader and humorous at times. I would defiantly take one of his classes again if I had the choice.

Terrible prof, does not explain things well and expects us to understand everything and work ahead and still somehow understand everything. Not a fan of him. Very boring to listen to, as well. This is an SWS class but there is way too many little assignments due at each class. Hard to keep tack of everything that is due...

name_title: Travis Longcore Professor in the Geography department at University of California Los Angeles (UCLA)

ratings.comment: Travis is a goof-ball, which made his lectures so easy to pay attention to. The material, although heavy at times, was always presented in an engaging way. I took this class to satisfy my GE-F and it was extremely do-able, not math heavy at all. Plus he bought us coffee on the last day of class.

I had Longcore for a GE class at USC. I've been interested in maps but this class takes maps to a different level and changed the way I think essentially every time at any map of any sort. He is nerdy funny and makes class go by so quickly. He even bought coffee for the whole class. He isn't looking to fail you. Pay attention and you will get an A.

Well let's just say he's not user friendly.  I daresay his education leaves a lot to be desired.  Knowledge of content is fine.  Not ready to help though.  Of all the PhD's I've dealt with over the years, he comes across as one of the more arrogant.
No Comments
Great class and professor.  Pay attention and you will be fine.

name_title: Burnaby Munson Professor in the Science department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: I love Munson. He was in charge of PChem 1 lab, which sucked but not because of him. He always tried to help you out and correct any mistakes. The TA's were honestly harder graders than Munson was. 10/10, so sad he is retiring. (Beware of a lab final, it's easy but kind of a secret)
surly facade, but he's a caring teacher that loves what he does. one of my favorite profs of college.

Munson's lectures are more confusing than they need to be. However, if you have a background in chemistry it's fairly easy to do well in the class. Do well in lab and study off of old exams and you should be fine.

Don't buy into the grouchy old facade he puts up. Once you warm up to him, he is really nice. He really cares about everyone. But his lectures are really long and confusing.  He speaks his own language, "Munsonese." Do well in lab, it'll boost your overall grade. Exams are really similar to old exams so make sure you go over and study old exams.

Dr. Munson's class was really challenging, especially if you don't have a very strong background in chem. His tests are really hard, but he and his TA's are very willing to help. DO WELL IN LAB and you will be able to pull off a decent grade. He is a bit confusing and his lectures are boring, but he is a very kind man who wants you to succeed.

name_title: Shangyou Zhang Professor in the M athem atics department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: There were 34 homeworks, 34 quizzes, 6 exams, 5 MATLAB projects, and 24 labs. Lectures are hilariously bad because he'll write something on the board and say there's nothing to teach. Like one kid pays attention, and he corrects him on to do basic math. He'll randomly say 'attention', but nobody understands. HOW IS SHANGYOU ZHANG A PROFESSOR AT UD?

Quizzes at the end of every class. Lectures are exact copies of posted pdfs on his website, along with extra explanations of theory and key points that might be looked over on the lecture documents. As much as I hated the time commitment to the class, I believe that it genuinely allowed me to learn the  many things discussed through the course.

If you need to do math426, wait until he isn't teaching it. He needs to go through training on how to conduct a class because he has no idea how to lecture. Especially if you need to do math428, you won't get proper understanding of math426 to do that next class if you take it with him.
UD will really hire anyone, huh?

I'm going to put this bluntly, this guy should not be teaching. This is a matlab based class and we do everything by hand. Everyone looks at each other in shock when he fails to explain certain things or incorrectly adds fractions. It is a disgrace that I am paying for this class.

name_title: Joseph Salerno Professor in the Business department at Pace University (all)

ratings.comment: For sure a gem for Pace University, great professor. For sure take his class. It's not easy but you learn a lot and very knowledgable person

Professor Salerno was a good teacher. Understood subject matter thoroughly and showed relativity to real world. Kept class up to date via email, but doesn't respond if you personally email him. However, there is no need to personally email because grading criteria and due dates were explained thoroughly and well in advance. Enjoyed subject.

Good professor. He clearly knows what he's talking about. Pay attention to the midterm. He doesn't curve so it can really impact your grade even if you get a perfect score for the final exam. Take advantage of the extra points offered in class earlier in the course because they become more challenging and less frequent as the course progresses.

Not the best , but not the worst. Everything is from the book and the slides. Pretty straight forward. Exams are average , few tricks though. The language of the test is very different from his lectures , so kind of tricky. Make sure you are prepared to play some bingo on some extra points he gives out in class for after chapter questions.
Salerno is arrogant and irrelevant.  He cares more about getting published than teaching. He ignores emails and grade on a whim rather than productive feedback. Useless, should retire.

name_title: Jay Custer Professor in the Anthropology department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Custer is very, very passionate about the subjects he teaches. His lectures are very basic (mostly him reading off of slides with elaboration), but he manages to make them enjoyable and entertaining every time. Your grade is based on two min. 1000-word essays which are graded fairly lightly and require no sources.

The only grades for this class are a midterm essay and a final exam essay, and he isn't a harsh grader at all. I find the lectures interesting because he's very passionate about archeology and it's almost like a story-time when you listen.

Class is made up of a midterm + final paper with optional extra credit essays. Lectures were really interesting and he pauses a lot to ask if there are any questions! Good/various prompts for essays with 2-3 weeks to write. He is clearly knowledgeable about the subject. Very straightforward and chill :)

Professor Custer was great, he offered amazing lectures with only a midterm and a final for grades along with extra credit opportunities. Assignments were clear and prompts were interesting to write about. He was open to different perspectives and always gave us opportunities to ask questions. Very engaging, but no in class discussions. Great class

This class was very interesting and definitely my favorite this semester. You really have to pay attention during lectures, but if you do, the work is easy because he says the answers to everything in the lectures.

name_title: Jennifer Thomas Professor in the Psychology department at San Diego St ate University

ratings.comment: Difficult but very interesting class, I learned a lot. Great lectures and often engaged students. True fashionista. Provided amazing study sheets before tests, but they were still definitely difficult.
She never answers emails , her hw has nothing to do with the exams. super lecture heavy so don't miss class, and if she gives you a Incomplete she'll ignore you and let the school deal with it.

Graded primarily by quizzes/exams, HW doesn't matter by much. Quizzes phrased strangely occasionally, exams sometimetouch on subjects you never went over. Sweet woman, but gives nothing to apply the things yourelearning. Essentially, if you arent the best at obtaining information in auditory form, don't take this class. Pretty standard curriculum.

Thomas is by far the best teacher I have had at SDSU. The subject itself is somewhat challenging, but she projects the information in ways that are easy to understand for any student. Her lectures are structured neatly and she's clearly very informed on the subject. She also records all her lectures, so physical attendance is only needed for exams.

One of the more passionate professors I've come across, super engaging, and made it worth it to attend class. Would love to take her again as the way she teaches is super coherent, engaging, and she'll explain something again if someone indicates they don't understand it. Tends to run until the end of class but not over.

name_title: M att Kinservik Professor in the English department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Nice guy but tough grader. Doesn't use canvas which is frustrating and makes it unclear what your grade is. Lectures were interesting. Novels were probably my least favorite part of the course but as long as you participate in class discussions it's a good class.
I took his dystopian colloquium. Lectures were interesting but grading on papers is tough and only a few things make up the total grade.

I took his dystopian realities colloquium. Overall, super nice guy and very caring. He is a bit of a tough grader and the course is very reading intensive. Grade is also heavily based on participation. Lectures are discussion based. But he is very willing to help you when needed.

I took his Making Shakespeare colloquium and thoroughly enjoyed it. The class is entirely discussion-based, so you gotta participate. Only a few papers (nothing compared to other honors English classes) and they're very straightforward. He's very relatable and a reasonable grader, and I would definitely take another class with him in the future.

Matt is  tough grader at first but gives good feedback. His classes are very discussion heavy but sometimes enjoyable. He gave us multiple group project but that could just be for my specific class. He a solid english professor with a good sense of humor. Many papers assigned but they were never over 6 pages.

name_title: Alvina Quintana Professor in the English department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Woms332 with Dr. Q was interesting and actually pretty easy. She was very sweet and easy going with deadlines and taking her class did not require too much time. If you skim the book before class and participate in class you will get full credit. Plus anything you say isn't wrong so I highly suggest taking this class !

This class was terrible. Most people are taking it as an elective and Professor Quintana takes it way too seriously. Writing assignments due everyday and she never answers your e-mails. Do not take if you are looking for an elective it is the ultimate waste of time.

DR. Q ROCKS! This class is 100% discussion, you take no notes and take no tests. Weekly readings and Sakai assignments. A great and enlightening elective. Watch a film every class, mandatory attendance. Very easy A if you go to class and read (books are great). Final paper is reflection and "quizzes" are straightforward. She gives tons of EC too!

3 books, 3 quizzes, 10 weekly writing assignments based on readings, must go to class, participation is KEY, definitely has favorites, a lot of chances for extra credit, half class watch movie, half class discussion of movie and reading, decent amount of work but EASY material,, do work and get A
I absolutely love this class and Dr. Q! She is absolutely incredible and such a sweetheart. Definitely my favorite class this semester. Very interesting subject matter and never a dull moment.

name_title: John Crum Professor in the History department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Amazing

Most influential professor I've ever had. He's a fair grader, and all the exams are taken straight from the readings/lectures. Classes are lecture based, with little to no assignments except exams for final grade. YOU NEED TO STUDY AND GO TO CLASS! He's so wise, knows the material and has so much knowledge to offer about history and life.

Really good teacher. Tests are super easy are taken straight from lectures and reading. If you are really good at history you don't even have to read or take notes. Lectures are always interesting and he is very funny.

Lectures whole class: pay attention, lectures are needed to add information to tests. Tests: Gives 20 vocabulary words, you define 10. Given 4 essay questions, anwswer one using background knowledge (lectures) and information from the books. Study Guide: Gives MULTIPLE (over 50 most times) vocabulary words to be defined using the BOOKS
Dr. Crum is awesome! Be ready and study for tests though. He always gives extra help and feedback if you need it.

name_title: Kelebogile Setiloane Professor in the Science department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Her exams are very specific and test you on tedious details that are within her slideshows. The slideshows that she presents in class are super dense and she is just reading off of them. She doesn't actually know what she is teaching and is not consistent at all. She cancels class very often. I would not recommend her at all.

Class constantly canceled, but OUR attendance is a major portion of grade?! Exams for a conceptual class are 50-question scantrons feat. info that was mentioned in passing. Trivial exams that do not relate to cultural awareness at all. I did not learn anything I did not already know. very sweet lady, very bad professor.

Very nice, but class seems so unorganized. Class is cancelled every or every other week which makes it difficult to understand whats even going on. Also she's just one of those professors who just looks to take points off on assignments.

Cancels class a lot. Assigns homework that is due on random days and does not give a warning that something will be assigned. Takes forever to grade and when she does she grades harshly. 
Lectures are usually off topic and often doesnt relate anything back healthcare professions. Exams are also random questions and will focus on one video we watch

NTDT301 aka HBNS300. Does not relate the course information to nutrition IN ANY WAY. Reads straight off dense slides full of vague, random facts. Often unable to pronounce cultural words/surprised by her own info. Study guides= titles of her slideshows. Tests on up to 160 slides worth of info. Cancels class often. HORRIBLE PROFESSOR. WASTE OF TIME.

name_title: David Naugle Professor in the Philosophy department at Dallas Baptist University

ratings.comment: He doesn't ever post grades to blackboard which makes seeing where you stand in the class difficult. His lectures are interesting - but he also doesn't use powerpoint. Overall, he's very eager to help students but his test are very hard.

Being taught by Naugle is like having C.S. Lewis as a professor.  The man is brilliant.  He also deeply loves Christ, and this has a transformative effect on his students.  If I could, I would major in Naugle.

Dr. Naugle is the absolute best teacher on campus!  People will tell you that he is hard (and he is), but he is also kind and very interested in the lives of his students.  Be respectful, attend classes, and work hard to do well!  If you get to know Dr. Naugle, he can become a friend/mentor for life!

Dr. Naugle literally changed my college experience.  He taught me how to think.  He is a great teacher but has an even bigger heart.  He has spent more time with me outside of the class than in.  He invests in lives.
Greatest professor I've ever gotten to know. He seems intimidating but he's very humble & smart, just listen; you could learn a few things.

name_title: Emma Jean Joseph Professor in the Criminal Justice department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Honestly easiest class ive taken. 10 quizzes you can take online, and 2 papers at the end of the year. You know about the papers the first week of class, and you have a presentation along with the essay that you work on all year. Extra credit was 5 short writings, and helped bring grade up atleast one letter.
