Honestly hated the class and was surprised I got a good grade. Her grading policy is confusing the only way to pass is to watch her "optional review lectures" and attend class and do all extra credit. Also, pay attention in class. She loves to ramble about off-topic stuff so be prepared.

So so easy. She means well and wants to help you. There are a few quizzes but easy when you are able to use your notes on them. Two final papers but there is enough notice for the assignments that you shouldn't struggle to get them done. She was overall a really good professor.

I love her as a person but her teaching style is a little outdated. She talks very fast and it is hard to take notes during her lectures. Our class as a whole suggested that she uses powerpoints when she lectures but she never did. Her quizzes never seem to be on what she talks about. I was able to save my grade with the essays we needed to write.

literally the worst professor i ever had. never has a lesson plan. just talks. gives incorrect information. quizzes are impossible. lectures are messy and hard to understand. never gives directions for projects and such. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!

name_title: Betty Ann Daley Professor in the M athem atics department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Doable if you've taken precalc before. Not professor Daley's fault but the fault of the class bc it's designed around an awful textbook and online system

Great professor, class lectures and activities were very useful. Need to attend classes to do well and does affect grading. Much of workbook done during class directly applies to quizzes and exams. There is a lot of homework; but, that is expected for a Math class since to really understand the concepts and solution strategies requires practice.

Dr. Daley is such a sweet lady. She cares about her students and how well they do in her class. Her notes for Math117 are fill in the blank and easy to follow. She walks you through everything and helps with the homework when she can. She wants you to succeed and will help you however she can.

Daley is an overall great professor. Her notes for Math 117 were fill in the blank which i found super helpful with following along. I got really sick at the beginning of class and she was very helpful during office hours and let me make up the work when i could. Shes super caring and as long as you put forth the effort you will do well in class.
Basic math class. Daley sits at the front and reads out random information while quickly showing how to do them. Not a great professor, would try to find another.

name_title: Leslie Skeen Professor in the Psychology department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Hard class. Dr. Skeen is very smart and talks about stuff that is way above what you need to know.  Go to class he gives out extra credit quizzes at the beginning of class.  Tests are hard and long but he curves a lot so it makes up for it.

Skeen is hard, no question. Don't let that scare you half to death though like it seems to have for a lot of people. The material itself is hard too! (c'mon psych majors, confounds) There's no "easy" way to learn this stuff. Read every page he tells you to, memorize it however you do best, and you're fine. Do it before each class for extra credit.

He was funny and nice and passionate.  He is used to teaching at the graduate level so gave a very heavy work load. Started every class with a quiz.  Tests were very hard.  This class is not hard because he is bad (because he is very good) it is hard because the material is very difficult.  This was the most helpful and informative class I've taken

Read the textbook and look at the slides. It is not possible to get a raw score A on his tests. He does it show that there is no way you can understand something as complex as the brain. It doesn't matter at all because he curves

People have issues when professors make them work hard. Grow up. Dr. Skeen is brilliant. You are learning from a neuroscience "stud." Stop complaining that you have to memorize brain anatomy for a NEUROSCIENCE class! You will learn so much in his class. Plus, he curves and gives extra credit. So work your ass off and you will be fine

name_title: Kelly Roos Professor in the Physics department at Bradley University

ratings.comment: Good guy. Very knowledgeable and helpful. Super understanding when it comes to deadlines and make ups. Definitely take Rooster at any given opportunity. This class was very helpful in gaining skills in technical writing and presentations.

Hon. Prof. Roos prepares you well for the real world with a mix of individual and group projects. Exams apply the concepts taught in lecture and hw. He sets you up for success for these assignments in lecture and is available outside of class to troubleshoot issues. Fun class and relatively balanced workload compared to other engineering courses.

I couldn't imagine another professor teaching this course besides the prestigious Hon. Prof. Roos. He is the most gifted singer of our time and should be soon releasing an album of parody songs that he has performed. Other than that, his teaching style is relaxed and his grading is more than generous. Easy to talk to for hours on end. Great guy.

Roos is a very self-serving prof. Hyper-masc poster child, and his insecurity in that is obvious and really embarrassing. Decided to make normal class assignments group assignments because there were "too many" assignments to grade. Ridiculous expectations for code assignments and reports for not teaching how to use MATLAB.

The class grade basically consisted of seven numerical methods projects, and a final exam. The final exam was online, and could be retaken until you got 100%. He offered extra credit for doing the projects in more than one programming language. Lectures were direct to help with projects, and he'd often go off on good-story tangents.

name_title: Min Qi Professor in the Chemistry department at Grand Valley St ate University

ratings.comment: She is a super nice professor. Whenever I emailed her for help she was super super nice but not the most helpful. Im not a science person but Ive never gotten below an A in a science class, but I know for sure Ill be getting a B this semester. The lectures were pre recorded which made it super difficult for me to actually learn

Do not take this professor, especially if you struggle with chemistry just in general. She will not help at all, not lead you towards the right direction, and does not at least try to help her students become better. Don't bother trying to go to office hours, so just save yourself the grade and choose someone else.
She was very helpful for lab. She knew what she was talking about and explained it until you understood.
This professor has been the worst one I have ever had. Not only can you not understand her; she does not care if the class average is under 60% and she does not have respect for anyone.
Actually helps during lab and knows what she is talking about which makes it much easier.

name_title: Carol Henderson Professor in the English department at University of Delaware

ratings.comment: Dr. Henderson will require you to work hard for your grade. Her classes are some of the hardest i've taken, but not because they are impossible. She challenges you to go beyond what you think you can do, and you will learn more than you ever imagined because of it. She is more than willing to help you, and she is just an inspiring person

She lacks clarity in her expectations for her tests.  I received good grades on my essays but Cs on my exams.  She had, in her mind, specific word-for-word definitions that she refused to share with the class, which ultimately led to mediocre exam grades.  I was pretty upset because I put lots of work into studying and those essays.
I had the exact same experience as another poster, who wrote, "i got an A on the first paper. interestingly,once she knew the face that went with the name, my grades went down. hmmm . . ."

prof. henderson makes this an amazing class by applying the literature we read to modern day examples... she has a way of teaching you how to sympathize and feel what the writer was going through.  You must be opened to changing your conventional ways of thinking!! She's my HERO!!

Dr. Henderson is a great professor.  She is very passionate about black literature and black struggle.  She is very hard and maintains high expectations for her students but only because she wants her students to be successful.  If you have trouble with the class, go to her office hours and honestly talk to her about the class!!!!  She will help!!

name_title: Lawrence Rowan Professor in the Physics department at The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

ratings.comment: Skips his own office hours, lectures are worthless, does not communicate how he is grading exams, does not answer e-mail, exams are multiple choice (rediculous for physics)
One of the worst professors I've ever had.

Great guy.  But, this class was useless.  Be prepared to be frustrated and teach yourself most of the material.  He does, however allow you to correct your mistakes on exams for 1/3 credit.  GOOD LUCK!

nicest guy...dr rowan is genuinely interested in students doing well.  that said, a lot of your progress will come from self-learning via textbook practice problems.  pay attention in class and do the practice problems, and go to office hours; he's generally more helpful if you talk to him one on one.

You must be very self-motivated to study and figure things out on your own. He doesn't assign homework so you have to find your own way to practice with the equations and the concepts. He's a nice old man, but isn't very clear sometimes.
